review_content: Color cobre, no es turbia, espuma gruesa media y de media duración. Olor a caramelo, ciruela. Sabor a caramelo, ciruela, es dulce, es carbonatada. No es aguada. Es bien rica. Se me puede parecer a una Belgian Dark Strong Ale, pero mas dulce y menos alcoholica.

Bottle from REWE Saarburg, RLP, Germany
Pours: dark nut brown, hazy, with a beautiful creamy, light brown head
Nose: licorice, plum, dark dried fruits, roasted malts
Taste: chocolate, toffee, roasted malts, dark dried fruits, licorice
Finish: alcoholic warming, lots of toffee, chocolate and dried fruits
Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, spora piana, kremowa. W aromacie ciemne słody, skórka chlebowa, lekkie rodzynki. W smaku przyjemnie, dobre suszone owoce i dochodzi fajny karmel. Naprawdę smaczne piwo.

The original Doppelbock supposedly. 500 ml bottle from the local German supermarket. Pours a nice reddish amber with little head. Aroma of roasted malt, lots of plum, raisin, grape. Malty, rich, alcoholic, perhaps a tinge of chocolate; reminiscent of stone fruit. Thick and alcoholic mouthfeel and low carbonation. Pretty impressive and good to have every now and then.

Terrific! Sweet, rich, malty beer with toasty and caramel rich flavors. It makes me think of rich bready malt. There’s a sweet, nutty pecan character that lingers. Medium carbonation, full body, and nice finish.

0,5l bottle from local store in München, drinking it on 16/07/2021 BB 04.2022 Pours a slightly hazy light brown body with a medium beige head on top. Aroma of dark malt, chestnuts, dried fruits, plums and a little boozy. Taste is rich with roasted malts, nuts, biscuit, dried fruits, caramel, plums and light chocolate notes. Quite strong and boozy at 7.9% abv while being easy enough on the palate. Medium body and slightly oily mouthfeel, moderate carbonation. Finish is dry with a boozy and hoppy bitter note. Rich and strong but still quite drinkable and balanced, delicious taste. Great.
Lidt mørk med lidt groft skum. Duft af brød og  muld. Let bitterhed der bliver hængende som et behageligt minde. Let sød og god fylde.
Very nice strong beer. A bit bitter maybe, but adds to the mouthfeel. I very much like it.

Bouteille de 50 cl achetée chez V&B. Robe brune claire et limpide avec légère mousse brune. Arômes de caramel, miel, banane, malts grillés. Texture crémeuse, carbonatation faible, faible amertume. Notes de caramel, épices, banane, malts grillés. Finale courte sur le caramel grillé.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Old rating from 2010 - 500ml bottle, pours red/ brown with a small white head. Aromas & tastes of dried berries, chocolate, caramel, honey, spice, nuts & roasted malt. Medium body. Dry finish

Bottle. Clear hazelnut brown color, fine white head. Caramel, honey, spice dried berry aroma. Sweet, medium to low bitter taste. More honey, heavy caramel, with a light roasted note aftertaste. Full, smooth body, medium carbonation.

Wysoka, drobna piana, jasno beżowa, piwo miedziane, wpadające pod światło w złoto, trwała piana, bez wyraźnej koronki, apetycznie się prezentuje. 
Delikatny aromat słodowy, niezbyt złożony, lekko wychodzi paloność i może odrobina fuzli? 
Pełne, okrągłe, alkohol zamaskowany, fajna goryczka na końcu, wyraźnie chlebowy, melanoidynowy. Nie odrzuca ani słodyczą ani alkoholowością. Dobry koźlak.

Cerveza de color castaña con una espuma de color caramelo.

Aroma a malta dulce, chocolate, ligeramente lupulado, con algunas notas frutales.     

Sabor suave a chocolate, a malta caramelo oscura y un ligero toque de lúpulo para terminar con un notable sabor a alcohol.Doppelbock muy consistente de Paulaner, una cerveza legendaria.
Super malty and a little boozy. It wasn’t exactly what I was in the mood for today, but there are days where this is exactly what I want

Color cobre, no es turbia, espuma gruesa media y de media duración. Olor a caramelo, ciruela. Sabor a caramelo, ciruela, es dulce, es carbonatada. No es aguada. Es bien rica. Se me puede parecer a una Belgian Dark Strong Ale, pero mas dulce y menos…
Bottle from REWE Saarburg, RLP, Germany Pours: dark nut brown, hazy, with a beautiful creamy, light brown head…
Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, spora piana, kremowa. W aromacie ciemne słody, skórka chlebowa, lekkie rodzynki. W smaku przyjemnie, dobre suszone owoce i dochodzi fajny karmel. Naprawdę smaczne piwo.

The original Doppelbock supposedly. 500 ml bottle from the local German supermarket. Pours a nice reddish amber with little head. Aroma of roasted malt, lots of plum, raisin, grape. Malty, rich, alcoholic, perhaps a tinge of chocolate; reminiscent of stone fruit.…

Terrific! Sweet, rich, malty beer with toasty and caramel rich flavors. It makes me think of rich bready malt. There’s a sweet, nutty pecan character that lingers. Medium carbonation, full body, and nice finish.

0,5l bottle from local store in München, drinking it on 16/07/2021 BB 04.2022 Pours a slightly hazy light brown body with a medium beige head on top. Aroma of dark malt, chestnuts, dried fruits, plums and a little boozy. Taste is rich with roasted malts, nuts,…
Lidt mørk med lidt groft skum. Duft af brød og  muld. Let bitterhed der bliver hængende som et behageligt minde. Let sød og god fylde.
Very nice strong beer. A bit bitter maybe, but adds to the mouthfeel. I very much like it.

Bouteille de 50 cl achetée chez V&B. Robe brune claire et limpide avec légère mousse brune. Arômes de caramel, miel, banane, malts grillés. Texture crémeuse, carbonatation faible, faible amertume. Notes de caramel, épices, banane, malts grillés. Finale courte…

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Old rating from 2010 - 500ml bottle, pours red/ brown with a small white head. Aromas & tastes of dried berries, chocolate, caramel, honey, spice, nuts & roasted malt. Medium body. Dry finish

Bottle. Clear hazelnut brown color, fine white head. Caramel, honey, spice dried berry aroma. Sweet, medium to low bitter taste. More honey, heavy caramel, with a light roasted note aftertaste. Full, smooth body, medium carbonation.

Wysoka, drobna piana, jasno beżowa, piwo miedziane, wpadające pod światło w złoto, trwała piana, bez wyraźnej koronki, apetycznie się prezentuje. Delikatny aromat słodowy, niezbyt złożony, lekko wychodzi paloność i może odrobina…
Cerveza de color castaña con una espuma de color caramelo. Aroma a malta dulce, chocolate, ligeramente lupulado, con algunas notas frutales.…
Super malty and a little boozy. It wasn’t exactly what I was in the mood for today, but there are days where this is exactly what I want
Non avevo tante aspettative, e sono rimasto piacevolmente colpito. Colore ambrato limpido con una bella schiuma. Aroma intenso e piacevole. È una bella birra.

Bottle. Wine Rack, Sharrow, Sheffield. Clear amber colour. Fine off white head stays the course. Nose has sugary grain. Some wet paper. At a pinch, there’s some nuts and vine fruit. Taste is a little sweet, with some papery dryness. Medium body. Fine carbonation. Dry finish. Expected more really.
Excelente dopplebock babares e. Famosa por la historia de la cuaresma. Algo de espuma que desaparece. Poco aroma. Ambar oscuro. Destaca el sabor a malta y algo a levadura. Muy buena.

A quite commercial, yet legendary, Doppelbock. Cloudy amber color, tending to dark copper, with a slightly yellowish head. The aroma is intense and characterized by aromas of chestnut honey, wholemeal biscuits, raisins, black cherries, light brandy and even vague cinnamon. The taste highlights flavors of caramel, bread crust, sour cherries in alcohol and raisins, with a light herbaceous-resinous bitterness and toasted notes on the finish. The body is medium-full, the carbonation medium-high and the alcoholic perception adequate, with a warming effect on the final drink noticeable in a pleasant way. Overall an excellent beer, with a sublime aroma, a slightly more dull but still good taste and an apt balance.

Piana dosyć trwała, beżowa, szyła na szkle, trochę w kierunku jak kożuch, powoli się redukowała. Kolor prześwitujący burgund. Aromat słodów, karmelu, miodu, ziół, lekko czuć alkohol. Smak orzechowy, czekolada, leciutko tylko kawa, słód, karmel, miód, zioła, czuć paloność. Dobre piwo.
Pours a mahogany brown, with a white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is dried fruit, caramel, a hint of molasses. Taste is rich and sweet, prunes, brown sugar and caramel. Warming. Nice.

0.33cl bottle from Aroma market. 

Pours chocolate reddish black tea color with thin white short lasting head. Outstanding taste. Roasted coffee and grain notes. Very drinkable and strong (7,9%). Fine on carbonation. Perfectly balanced. Love that picture on a bottle. Beautiful dark beer, and my first doppelbock. One of the best beers so far for me!

Predivno pivo, oduševilo me je na prvi gutljaj. Malo jače ali svi ostali parametri su savršeno izbalansirani

Bière ambrée, tres peu de mousse. Belle couleur 
Nez toaste caramel, complexe 
Goût candy, fruité avec du malt en première bouche 
Deuxième bouche très longue houblonnée, une amertume qui persiste en bouche
Effervescence faible, beaucoup de corps.
Bon ensemble, je recommande

Brown-chestnut with an average pale ochre head low persistent. Appetizing aromas, richly malted, coffee, cake with candied fruits, prune and butter caramel. Taste is superb, full body beer, complex savours with roasted malt, jammy red fruits, toffee and prune. Dry finale with a present bitterness of nuts-earth, notes of alcohol. A legendary beer.

500ml can. Clear copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are toasted cereals, toffee, molasses, raisins, berries and chocolate with herbal notes. Medium to full body, moderate to good carbonation, creamy texture.

Bottle online from 'The Trembling Madness'.
Pours an almost clear mahogany colour with a medium sized fast dissipating beige head. Aromas of dry dark fruits, caramel, leather, cherries, toasty brown bread and burnt brown sugar. Taste has all the notes again from the aroma with added hints of dark chocolate, nuts, tobacco with a rich bittersweet finish. Full body, fair carbonation and an oily mouthfeel. Top notch Bock.
Una cerveza de color ambarino, generosa espuma aunque fugaz. Aterciopelada con persistencia de dulzor y acidez, muy buena.
Pours with a thick off white head and a deep amber color. Strong malty aroma. Chocolaty, biscuity, malty flavor. A high abv bite similar to a winter warmer. Creamy mouthfeel.

How: Draught.
Where: Paulaner Bierhaus, Torrevieja, Spain.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Malt, caramel, yeast, sweet.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, caramel, sweet, some fruit.

Doppelbock clàssica i molt correcta, a preu assequible i present a molts supermercats. Bona espuma, correcta retenció, molt bon nas i gust dolç característic de l estil...No és la millor doppelbock segurament, però és curiós la mania d alguns ratings de lapidar qualsevol marca comercial...
You get what you paid for in this case.  Typical solid Doppelbock beer that is well made.  Very similar in flavor to other beers in the same category.  Good one!

Deeap amber color, weak white head. 
Sweet aroma of roasted malts, dark fruits and caramel. 
Taste is very complex: nuts, raisins, banana, caramel, roasted malts. Very good mouthfeel, just enough carbonation, and medium bitternes, what makes it very balanced. Some alcohol in the taste as well. A really nice Doppelbock from Paulaner.
This has been one of my favorite beers ever.  Dark like stout but more bitter but not overly chocolatey.
La mejor Paulaner , la mejor doopelbock, olor a pan recién horneado y caramelo, sabor denso fuerte y dulce, es un placer está maldita cerveza, gracias Paulaner Salvator desde Bogotá

Dunkler Doppelbock, mit 18,3 % und 7,9 % Alk.

Geruch Malz, Karamel, Alkohol. Geschmacklich findet sich das auch, zusätzlich etwas Traubensaft und eine leicht röstige Note. Recht anständiger Doppelbock.

Аромат карамельный, солодовый, спиртовой. Пиво имеет медный цвет, карбонизация умеренная, пена не стойкая. Во вкусе крепость, карамель, солодовый вкус, послевкусие приятное карамельное. Пиво неплохое, но алкоголь очень хорошо чувствуется

Cerveza ideal para maridar con postres o quesos muy fuertes.
Apariencia: Color rojo muy intenso y opaco; con carbonatacion muy baja y una Corona blanca casi inexistente.
Aroma: Cerveza muy aromática con un intenso olor a caramelo, toffe y un leve toque tostado. Se perciben también notas típicas del alcohol. El aroma a la malta es tan intenso que el aroma a lúpulo resulta imperceptible.
Al paladar: Cerveza muy corpulenta de trago corto con un toque picante debido al tenor alcohólico y carbonatacion ausente. Realmente parece que te estás por tragar un caramelo.
Sabor: Por supuesto presenta un sabor intenso y totalmente dulce, se notan los más de 7 grados de alcohol y luego de un rato resulta algo empalagosa.
Definitivamente una cerveza que hay que probar pero que no es para todos
Maltosa, picante, dulce. Buen trago. No termina de convencerme la burbuja, demasiado espumosa. Eso sí, un señor trago.

Extremely strong maltiness imeddiatly on nose. Amber color,off-white head,moderate resistance. Alcohol feeling shows after. No hoppiness as expected. Moderate body, medium carbonation. Sweetness and maltiness all over the way.

14.05.2020: 500 ml bottle at home, 7.9% ABV, bb. 2.2021, bought at Drinks of the World, Bern. Pours a dark amber with an off-white head. The aroma is malty with sweet malt, honey, biscuit, raisins, toffee, sweet candied nuts, dried apples and almonds. Medium to full body with a soft carbonation, a medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor starts with sweet malt, brown sugar, honey, raisins and is similar to the smell. Finishes with a light residual sweetness and a light to medium hoppy bitterness but also a light but lasting light notes of cardboard. The flavor was a little less sweet and with a lighter body than expected but with an enjoyable hop presence in the finishes that balance the malt sweetness.

Aroma: 6
Appearance: 4
Taste: 7
Palate: 4
Overall: 13
Davvero un'ottima doppelbock! Dal color rame, abbondante schiuma di media persistenza e giusto mix di caramell e malto dolce tostato. Carbonazione medio-bassa. Molto buona!
I am not an expert, but this strong beer tastes really good. Malty and sweet.
I'd say it is a good one, you barely feel its actual graduation. I really prefer the normal one.
Fantastic doppelbock. Malty and sweet. An all round great beer one id buy again. Well nice.

AR: Dörrobst, malzig, holzig, 
AP: opales kupfer
TA: Dörrobst, holzig, malzig
Pours hazy amber with abthin head. Aroma of malts, sugar, dark fruits. Taste of malts, molasses, spices, nuts. Some alcohol feel. Medium carbonation. Light bitter and sweet aftertaste.
On draft at Steinkeller.  Dark, cloudy pour.  This is a good, strong bock.  Fresh bread, molasses, raisin, and a dry finish.  I wish there were more good bocks available in the USA.
Very nice surprise. Bought it in Mercadona. Very tasty and different from normal Paulaner. Nice colour and reminds me of nice Belgian beers.

Poured from a bottle into a 8oz sample glass. Nose is dried, plum fruits and hearty dark breads. Perfect coloring, filtered, and thin head. Taste and finish are excellent. Very smooth with a burst of bitter bite with a sweet finish. Taste is incredible. Cheers!

Янтарный цвет, небольшая пенка. Аромат: сладкий солодовый, медовые нотки и нотки сухофруктов, кураги. Тело плотное. Вкус: мощная солодовая сладость. Послевкусие: солод, мед, курага. Итог: не плохой доппельбок.

330ml bottle brewed in Germany at 7.9%. Small, shortlasting head. Cloudy toffee colour. Woody, syrupy aroma, lightly smoky - very like a barrel-aged beer. Some hints of German hop underneath. Low carbonation. Decent thickness but stays refreshing, and not really any of that ABV on the throat. Hints of those classic German hops to start, but then there's an almost Maple-syrup woody sweetness taking charge, with strong toffee flavours leading into an extremely lightly toasted malt finish, with perhaps a hint of chocolate. Very fine Doppelbock, and, like Paulaner's Dunkel, really serves as an Ur-Example for the style. There are better Dunkels and Doppels, perhaps, but none quite say "Dunkel" or "Doppelbock" the way Paulaner's do.
Karmelkowo - cukierkowe, kwiatowe, słodkie, dużo niuansów słodowych.  Bock jak bock.
Colore Caramello schiuma fine. Buona doppel con adeguata persistenza e luppoli.

Hopinator@O'Connel's, Tampere, Finland. From hopinator w. orange. 

Day 6 in hopinator. Much better than in the beginning: bock's toffee, caramel and some syrup are quite clear and also a hint of maltines can be detected. Averagely balanced. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall, still a bit overglued feeling but still, good combination. 7 3 7 3 14

Day 1. Orange dominates too much, but the idea of combination is good. Likely better after few days. 5 3 5 3 8

Ciemnobursztynowe, zamglone, z niezłą pianą, zostawiającą trochę lacingu. W aromacie karmel, pieczywo, nuty opiekane, pieczone, podwędzane, owocowe. W smaku pełne, dość słodkie, z zaznaczonym chmielem, niską, ale wyraźnie wyczuwalną goryczką i nieprzeszkadzającą alkoholowością.
Dark brown with a thin head. Aroma of woody earth notes, toasted malt. Taste has dark smoked notes, earth and malt. Palate has spiced malt notes, smoke on the nose. Good.

Cerveza potente de Paulaner. De color ambar oscuro, con destellos rojizos. Espuma compacta de color marfil, de duración escasa. Aromas intensos a malta y caramelo.
El sabor tira más a lo dulce, donde domina la malta tostada y toques a caramelo. Final alcohólico y potente regusto. Carbonatación media-baja.

Hazy, amber color, big, creamy, beige head. Intense roasty and biscuity maltiness, some spicy hop aroma is noticable. Sweet, caramelly and bready taste, the huge amount of alcohol is well-hidden. It's like a christmas dessert in liquid form. Good carbonation, mild but very nice aftertaste.

Sweet, caramel and chocolate taste.
A little bit of bitterness.
Nicely hidden ABV.
Very drinkable.
From a 33 cl. bottle.  Pours a hazy brown with an ecru head.  Aromas of toffee.  Flavors are sweet treacle and caramel.

Amber-copper color with off white head. Caramel, dried fruits, sweet,  herbs aroma.  Sweet, caramel, sticky, slightly roasted, bit herb flavor. Bitter, caramel palate, medium body. 
Bottle from local supermarket.

I really surprised about the moderate ratings here. This beer is absolutely amazing.. Nothing wrong here. All on this beer is very pleasand and great..
First of all the aroma is very fruity and remind you some classic Trappist Belgian beer.. The taste and the mouthfeel is simple wonderful. Many caramel and fruity notes here and the finish is just amazing.. Malty and slightly bitter finish that remind you very strong some Belgian beer.. Also the beer is dangerous drinkamble and you cant notice the 7.9% ABV..
Overall one of the best German beers i have try so far. All here is very balance and beautiful.. Difficult you can find something bad..
Bottle pour with a light brown color. Aroma of brown bread. Flavors of the same with a hint of molasses, a hint of sweetness with a medium body.

Color naranja oscuro, cercano al marrón, ligera neblina, translúcida.  Espuma beige amarillento de más de dos dedos de espesor y buena retención. Aroma a maltas tostadas, ciruelas y vino tinto al servir, al atemperar aparecen canela, frutos secos, almendras sobre todo, madera, plátano maduro, pasas y caramelo. Sabor en esa línea y en ese orden, final de amargor herbal y alcohólico medianamente intenso, alcohol agradablemente notable. Textura entre acuosa y oleosa. Carbonatación media baja

11.2 oz. bottle.

AROMA:  Very sweet with scents of bread, brown sugar, and caramel.

APPEARANCE:  Pours an opaque, orange-brown with a dirty-tan head that dissipates quickly and minimal lacing.  Overall, its appearance is a bit on the "muddy" side.

TASTE:  Tastes almost exactly like it smells ... sweet, with notes of brown sugar, malt, and caramel.

MOUTHFEEL:  Full-bodied with a slick and creamy texture.  Carbonation seems a bit low for a beer of this type.  There is not much of a finish at all.

OVERALL:  This is what I would consider a "typical" doppelbock.  Which is to say, it is a pretty tasty beer.  But there's nothing to make it stand out from all the other ones.  Basically, if you put one in my hand, then I will drink it and graciously thank you for it (while asking you for another).  However, if I go to a bar, then I'm not going to remember that I've ever had this beer, much less that I actually enjoyed it.
Аромат слабый, кислый хлеб, виноград, алкоголь. Вкус кислый хлеб, немного карамели, с нагревом становиться чуть лучше, но хуже своих конкурентов.

Robe ambrée sombre et voilée, belle mousse rousse assez peu durable, très forte carbo. Nez caramel, alcool, fruit mûr, riche. Bouche pus sèche qu'attendu: caramel cuit, malt grillé, légère amertume (longue), pointe d'alcool. Riche mais pas excessivement sucrée.
Gift from SimonTomlinson. Copper appearance. Aroma is bread, wheat, brown sugar and herbal. Flavour is bitter, herbal, liquorice, brown sugar, sweet and toffee.
Clear dark brown pour. Metallic nose. Sweet, roasted malt tones with a subtle herbal finish

Orange hazy with a thin head.
Roasted smell of chocolate and yeast. Malty chocolate in the taste. Low carbonation.
Deep amber color, high-carbonation. Strong malty aroma and taste, sweet and bitter at the same time. Perfectly balanced.

Bevuta in bottiglia da 50.
Aroma dolce amaro. Colore ambrato intenso. Persistente retrogusto amaro.
Fgr

Bottle at Antarabangsa, Penang. Poured a clear medium amber colour. The aroma is grainy caramel malt, woody hop. The flavour is moderate bitter light sweet, with a rich, sweet toffee malt, fruity, slightly boozy, light floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average to soft carbonation.

Low formation foam, medium density and short duration. Copper/amber liquid with traces of ruby, semi cloudy. Aroma is very interesting, with sweetness of dry fruits such as raisin, plums and a strong malted and toffee. Alcohol is notable either but lightly and very well inserted.
On mouth, the dry fruits are so easy to note, specially the plums but the sweetness is much lower. Malted comes right after, with strong caramel/toffee taste but not that sweet and even some far coffee notes (maybe because of the toasted notes). Bitterness is not low and short, but mostly came from toasted notes, giving the coffee sensation at the end. 
Aftertaste is little bit more bitter, longer but not that long. A malted feel stays til the next sip.
A very nice beer, very alcoholic but still not heavy. Better stay sharp because it is easy to get drunk with just a few of this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Low formation foam, medium density and short duration. Copper/amber liquid with traces of ruby, semi cloudy. Aroma is very interesting, with sweetness of dry fruits such as raisin, plums and a strong malted and toffee. Alcohol is notable either but lightly and very well inserted.
On mouth, the dry fruits are so easy to note, specially the plums but the sweetness is much lower. Malted comes right after, with strong caramel/toffee taste but not that sweet and even some far coffee notes (maybe because of the toasted notes). Bitterness is not low and short, but mostly came from toasted notes, giving the coffee sensation at the end. 
Aftertaste is little bit more bitter, longer but not that long. A malted feel stays til the next sip.
A very nice beer, very alcoholic but still not heavy. Better stay sharp because it is easy to get drunk with just a few of this.
le farfelu Rouen. Très bonne bière rousse légèrement amère , forte mais  pas écoeurante , bien équilibrée. Une réussite .

0,33 l
Odlicno! Tamna bakrena boja s crvenim odsjajem, pjena korektna, okus jak i pun..
Super, za preporuku..
Pésima. Me costó bastante terminármela porque el sabor no es nada bueno. La única sensación que me dió fue de asco
Pours a beautiful amber colour with a thick, creamy head. Vanilla and dark toffee on the nose. Tastes like dark fruits with a very long and bitter finish.

Belle bière brune au reflets rougeâtres. Assez limpide. Faible carbonatation, mousse peu présente et très éphémère. Nez sur le miel , les épices , le malt . Bouche peu amère. Caramel , miel , fin de bouche sucrée et sirupeuse. Trop peu de bulles . Bien moins bonne que ses sœurs de la même brasserie !

Bevuta alla spina in bicchiere da 0,3 cl. Aspetto color rubino con riflessi ramati, versa 1 dito di schiuma. L'aroma piuttosto semplice, caratterizzato da note caramellate e di malto tostato. In bocca le note di malto risultano predominanti, seguite da un finale leggermente alcolico. Nel complesso la bevuta risulta discreta.
Buena cerveza estilo doppelbock de sabor ligeramente alcoholico y caramelo.

Cerveja vermelho escura e turva, formação de espuma inexistente. 
Aroma sutil de caramelo e tostado, mas muito sútil.  Pouco aroma. 
Perineuro gole adocicado, sabor de malte tostado com notas de caramelo. Retrogosto alcoólico condizente com os 7,9%
Não estou louco pra beber outra.

0,5l bottle from REWE Supermarkt, Waidmarkt 1-3 in Köln, Germany.
F: big, tan, creamy, long lasting.
C: coppery, hazy.
A: malty, caramel, bit bready, fruity touch, dried banana, raisins, mellow fruity, toast.
T: malty, bready, caramel, mellow fruity, bit dried fruits, plums, toast, bit spicy, decent bitterness, medium body and carbonation, good balanced and enjoyed as classic for the style.

Bottle from Kaufland 2019-06-12 Markerska 
AR: sponge, brown sugar
AP: hazy amber, frothy beige head
F: sponge, caramel, brown sugar, rich

Butelka, barwa ciemnego bursztynu. Wysycenie średnie,  piana nieduża, minimalną koronkę na szkle zostawia. W aromacie i smaku mocno słodowo, herbatniki, biszkopty, karmel, toffi. Intensywność średnia. Alkohol świetnie schowany. Udany Doppelbock.

Appearance: Beer is brown with a reddish tinge. foam quickly settles.
Aroma: Powerful aroma of a mixture of malts, with hints of esters.
Taste: Malt with wine notes. light sweetness passing into a bitterness.
Great beer! Liquid bread)

Can't believe I haven't rated this one yet.  Amber pour, finger sized head that fades to a small ring, no lace.  Bready aroma and taste, caramel, malty, somewhat sweet, dark fruit, raisin.  Medium body, moderate carbonation. Alcohol well integrated.   Used to kick these back with gusto years ago and still crack a couple out when we BBQ some brats.

Aus der Pulle. Riecht süßlich malzig, fast schon klebrig. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig malzig, süß. Tiefdunkle Dörrobstaromen, etwas Nelke, Honig. Ganz gut gelungen. Liegt zwar relativ schwer im Magen, allerdings ist der Alkohol gut versteckt.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of prunes, toffee, raisin, brown bread and red wine... the taste is caramel and floral with notes of brown bread, toffee, raisin, dry wine, plum and dried berries... the aftertaste is sweet, dry and bitter...

Bottle at home from Utobeer, 22nd April 19.  Pours chestnut brown.  Aroma is caramel, dark fruit and malts.  Taste is smooth, caramel, chocolate and dark fruits, molasses.   Quite thin and slightly watery, but a good tasty beer.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Cerveza alemana rojiza, cuerpo medio, algo turbia con inexistente espuma. Muy buena fácil de beber y con regusto a caramelo.

Bottle from Edeka, Rothenburg. Pours hazy dark amber-brown with a lasting, small, unstable, frothy, tan head. Aroma of prune, raisin, red apple, almond, dried banana, dark honey, brioche, brandy, 'carré confiture', tea leaves. Taste is medium fruity sweet, notes of raisin, dried banana & red apple on bready & even cake-like malty base, caramelly & nutty edges, only light herbal bitter with tea leaves & some pepper. Dryish, herbal hoppy finish, lingering dried fruit, cake, and a good dash of warming brandy alcohol. Medium body, slick-oily texture, fizzy carbonation. Satisfying Doppelbock, but the difference in class with Ayinger Celebrator is noticeable.

De color ámbar oscuro, una buena cabeza espumosa; ligera y de carbonatación media. Aroma a malta, frutos secos y un poco de caramelo. En boca es dulce, destacando el caramelo pero de a momentos se hace empalagosa.

Outstanding beer. Bread crust and dried fruit in aroma. Pretty sweet taste, just like fresh burnt caramel, but not "too sweet". Alcohol is hidden really good, especially for a nearly 8% beer. Must-try for the money if you're searching for a beer to become your favourite one - this might be it.

Botella de 330ml de Mercadona. 

Color rojo cobrizo oscuro, sin turbidez. Corona finísima de color marfil y burbuja muy fina con retención media-baja.

Aroma a malta caramelo medio y a lúpulo floral de intensidad media alta.

En boca, malta caramelo de intensidad media-baja y toques a pan. Amargor medio-bajo que no obstante compensa bien el toque acaramelado. Carbonatacion media-baja. Cuerpo bajo, textura acuosa. El alcohol se percibe ligeramente en el posgusto.

Se bebe como nada.

Servida en su jarra original. Prototipo de Doppelbock o Lager oscura más popular de Alemania. Apariencia ámbar cobrizo con corona marfil compacta y con retención perfecta. Desprende los típicos aromas maltosos, tostados, frutos secos, plátano maduro y levadura. En gusto encontramos características similares acentuadas por dulzor como de azúcar moreno y caramelo. Amargor moderado y frutal. En el paladar es cálida, intensa y de cuerpo pleno. Una gran cerveza con merecida fama.

33 cl. bottle @ home, served in a teku glass, due date: 2019/11

Aroma: not very intense aromas of toasted and caramel malts, dark dried fruits (prunes, raisins, dates, black figs), honey, hints of estery fruits and very light phenolic spices.

Appearance: amber to dark amber with copperish / reddish overtones, beige and very creamy head made of tiny to medium sized bubbles. Medium to high head thickness, medium retention and low Brussels' lacing. Very low haziness, almost crystal clear.

Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of caramel malts, caramel, burnt caramel, brown sugar, burnt brown sugar, toasted malts, honey. Hints of dark dried fruits (prunes, raisins, dates, black figs), toasted bread crust. Balance is toward the sweetness, maybe it's a little bit cloying and not very refreshing for this sweetness.

Palate: medium body, oily to silky texture, low carbonation, very long mainly sweet finish with medium sweetness, light to medium bitterness and the same aforementioned flavors . Alcohol is only noticeable because of some throat an mouth warming, but it's quite difficult to believe this beer has the ABV read in the label. Low astringency.

Overall: very good looking, good aromas and flavors of caramel malts, caramel, burnt caramel, brown sugar, burnt brown sugar, dark dried fruits (prunes, raisins, dates). Quite good and enjoyable, good sipper. Maybe it could be better with a little more hops and bitterness to balance all the malts charge and a little bit more of carbonation.

Almost see through reddish copper, which gives it a very appealing look - the eyes and nose loves it. It is a bit bubbly. Foam leaves instantly. Taste it very round and full - a nice feel in the mouth and the whole way down. The bitter and sweet notes complement each other and is quite pleasant. Waiter - please bring me another - and another - and..........! ;-)
Malty, with lots of decadent stone fruit flavours, plum, damson and currants. pours a tea colour with a head that starts big but fades quickly. Lovely beer.
Schneider weisse tap 6'dan biraz acı olan Arpa versiyonu denilebilir.İçimi zor değil fakat biraz acı diyebilirim.Gazlılık olarakta fazla gazlı değil. Aroma olarak belirgin tadı yok.

Pours a hazy amber body, large frothy head. Aromas of sweet malts, dark fruits, and lots of caramel. Taste is very sweet, highly carbonated with all the flavours from the aroma. Low bitterness and dry finish. Solid beer.

Dark orange/red colored beer with low, off-white foam. 
Fruity aroma, with hints of gasoline. Melanoidins are also present.
Quite sweet with really low bitterness.
Medium to full body.

Clear amber color with beige head. Aroma has caramel, brown sugar, bread crust and some earthy hop notes. Taste is well balanced with dark bread crust, burnt sugar and leafy hop bitterness on the finish. Medium plus body with medium carbonation. Clean, balanced and well made.

can.  Poured dark amber with a beige head. Fruity syrupy aroma.  Medium bodied,  tight carbonation,  a bit oily. Roasted malty flavour, notes of  dark fruit with  caramelized sugar, lingering alcohol.

Pours amber copper brown with white foam head.  Aroma of caramel malt with honey notes.  Taste is medium to full sweet to lightly bitter.  Palate is medium bodied,  sticky texture,  average carbonation,  and a light bitter hop fruit finish beneath the toffee malt. Very nice if a little monochrome

Tohle pivo jsem chtěl dlouhou dobu vyzkoušet. Chtěl jsem okusit naprostou klasiku a legendu. Prostě si odškrtnout must have pivo, které bude dobré, ale neměl jsem očekávání, že by mohlo atakovat ty úplně nejlepší příčky v mém seznamu. A ono ještě překvapilo. Jsem nadšen. Uvažoval jsem mezi 3.9 a 4 a dávám nejpřísnější 3.9 co jsem kdy dal. K naprosté elitě chyběl malý kousek a tak můžu říct s klidným svědomím, že při klasickém poměru cena/výkon je to NEJLEPŠÍ PIVO ZA SNESITELNOU CENU NA TRHU!

Color ámbar rojizo, ligera turbidez. Dos dedos de espuma amarillenta con excelente retención. Aroma dulce, maltas dulces, azúcar y levadura. Gusto muy maltoso, caramelo, frutos secos garrapiñados y levadura. Cuerpo medio. Todo un clásico, ahora bastante fácil de conseguir de barril, esta buena y tiene clase, pero para mi gusto peca de dulce.
On tap at Paulaner Am Kirchplatz. Aroma is sweet.  Taste is slightly sweet, well balanced with hops, but still a slightly sweet finish.
Классное тёмное пиво, крепости не чувствуется, пьётся очень легко, поэтому необходим самоконтроль, всё-таки 8 оборотов.

Aussehen :
Kupferbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone
Geruch :
Früchte und Malz
Geschmack :
Malz und Kaffee mit Schokolade
Well this is just splendid. Rich and malty with lots of caramel and a dash of fruit so while it's a bit lively it's just got a lovely smooth taste to it and a nice sweet finish. Great stuff.

The Paulaner Salvator with its strong,typically malty taste is the original Paulaner. The bottom-fermented Doppelbock-Bier unites the finest hops and dark barley malt. The Paulaner monks served Salvator as a replacement for food at Lent. Their most famous brewer was Brother Barnabas, who was the head of the Paulaner monastery brewery starting from 1773. Its original recipe is today almost the same as it was in Barnabas’ time. In order to protect the original recipe, Paulaner had the trade mark "Salvator" patented in 1896. 
 
 Original wort 18,3% 
 alcohol 7,9% 
 calories 68,0 kcal/100 m

Bottle at home. Pours dark amber to brown. Small white head. Smell and taste are caramelly, the traditional maltyness of a dippelbock. It'd pretty thin for the style though, and not that intensely flavored. The specific bottle I had, had mild oxidation on top, but I won't take that into count for the actual beer itself ( this was perhaps a tad older bottle?). Not bad, but certainly not great between the best of the style.

11.2 oz bottle. Smells of caramel, malt, touch of banana and a bit of spice. Dark amber/ brown color. Tastes sweet, a bit of caramel and chocolate, with a bit of banana. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter. A little thick feeling, with a sweet, light chocolaty finish.
Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
W zapachu trochę kukurydzy. Poza tym dość ładnie - słodowe, karmelowe nutki. W smaku słodko dość, lekkie drewno, melasa, rodzynki. Alkohol. Butelka 0,5 to za wiele.

0,5l bottle Nürnberg- red clear with brown head - aroma of choco and malts - taste sweet nothing to heavy with a bitter finish and feeling the extra alcohol after a while - expected more to be frankly, but maybe I need to give it one more try ....
Noe uklar rødbun farge med offwhite skum. Lukter fruktig. Frisk og syrlig i smak. Medium fylde. Medium minus karbonert.

Creamy & fluffy just white head left a good cover on a reddish brown still body.
Minimal aroma of malt, caramel & spice.
Medium to full bodied sticky, smooth & creamy on the palate with heavy cloying finish.
Heavy malt, brown sugar, dark berries, citrus hints & a bitter spicy finish
Bottle, 50 cl. Pleasant, not too boozy; nice caramel aroma but not too sweet. Carbonation and finish well balanced.
Small sample at Frankford, brown color with average head. Nose and flavor were toffee, fig, barley, bread, fruity malt, light sugars, pine and roast. Medium to fuller mouthfeel.
Im Glas ergießt sich ein braunrotes, bernsteinfarbenes Bier. Geruch und Geschmack  intensiv nach Röstmalzen und Schokolade. Alkoholgeschmack dezent bei fast 8 Umdrehungen. Klasse Bockbier.

Garrafa. Coloração Âmbar/Rubi. Espuma de media formação e baixa persistência.  Ótimo aroma resinoso de amêndoas e nozes. Sabor também resinoso bem maltado com dulçor agradável. Álcool levemente presente.
Fairly sweet, caramel, bread, dark malty. Low carbonation. Dark bronze colour

Piana szybko ucieka do zera. W aromacie skórka od chleba, karmel i jakby lekki sos sojowy, leciutko suszone owoce. W smaku słodkie, chlebowe, karmelowe, lekko przypalany cukier. Alko spoko ukryte, wysokie wysycenie. No niezbyt szałowe.
Bottle at a Irish bar in Madrid. Nose is caramel, wheat, malty. Palate is deep sweet caramel, bread, toast. Beautifully caramelly doppelbock. Mhh..

Немецкое пиво - если вы понимаете о чем я.
Отличная крепость, которая едва уловима, для тех кто не любит бегать в туалет каждые 30 минут. Цена 100 - вкус мужской, немного грубый
Doppelbock de aroma intenso, lembrando carvalho, amargor presente, leve refrescancia, mas com sabor explosivo de malte tostado desde o ínicio ao fim. FENOMENAL

Wygląd:Barwa bursztynowa, klarowna z średniej wysokości głównie drobnopęcherzykową kremową pianą, która po chwili sycząc opada do trwałego krążka nie pozostawia śladów na szkle. 
Aromat: Słodowo melanoidynowy. Skórka chleba, przypieczona skórka chleba, tosty, lekkie orzechy, biszkopt, chleb, w tle troszeczkę toffi i subtelne nuty karmelowe. Odrobina kwiatowo -ziołowego chmielu. Minimalne fioletowe suszone owoce. 
Smak: Tak jak zapowiadał zapach. Przyjemny lekki rozgrzewający alkohol towarzyszący aż do finiszu. W ustach słodkawe, gładkie. Treściwość średnia, sprzyjająca pijalności, wysycenie w stronę niskiego. Goryczka średnio-niska, ziołowa, dobrze kontrująca. Finisz słodowo-melanoidynowy z lekką goryczką i rozgrzewającym charakterem alkoholowym.
Ogólnie bardzo przyjemny doppelbock, dominują produkty racji mailarda. W ustach fajny rozgrzewający alkohol. Goryczka dobrze kontrująca i podkreślająca słodową stronę piwa.
Mooi bock bier. Smaken van karamel en dat van kruiden. Daarnaast veel smaken van donkere mouten en iets wat lijkt op de smaak van brood. -backlog de BierApp-
Što reći, a da nije rečeno. Paulaner. Nisam probao loš Paulaner. Ocjena govori sve. Svaka preporuka.

500ml can. Pours hazy amber with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma is caramel, toasted malt, dried fruit. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, nuts and a touch of spicy hops. Finish is sweet and slightly alcoholic. Very decent.

Cloudy golden-amber color with a small beige head that goes down quickly, no lacing. Aroma of caramel, roasted malts and spices. Very sweet taste, alcohol, caramel, toffee, syrup and nutmeg or clove with hints of whole cereals, rye and cinnamon. Medium-high body with smooth texture and low carbonation. An extremely sweet doppelbock with distinctive spicy and malty aromas and flavors.
33cl bottle. low carbonation with little head. caramel aroma and taste  with spicy notes. creamy and full body finish. One of my favourites.

Had this my first time at the German American Society in Omaha. Great tasting double buck with a quick buzz that will sneak up on you 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Malty aroma, matured fruit, sirupy notes, light caramel. Tastes the same as aroma, light sweet, light to medium bitter. Full body, malty bitter sweet finish. Good.
Sabor frutal, algo pesada en alcohol pero no en exceso, recomendable para tragos largos y disfrutar su sabor lentamente. Por esa razón compré dos de estas. Increíble

Bardzo solidny koźlak. Aromat słodki, karmelowy, trochę suszone owoce. Barwa ładna, ciemny bursztyn, ale piany brak. W smaku to samo co aromat, karmel, słodko, suszone owoce, ale też goryczka wyraźna. Alkohol mało wyczuwalny. Umiarkowanie dużo ciała, wysycenie niskie. Przyjemne, pełne, dość ciekawe i pijalne. W stylu bardzo dobre.

Been a fan of this one since high school, I remember having it in 2004 and 2005. Rated it in summer 2017 in Dublin Irish Pub, Ohrid, Macedonia. Shared with lovely Anja. Murky amber, small creamy off-white head. Strong dried fruit aroma, honey, light toffee, some cherry jam and biscuit. Moderate to heavy sweetness. Sticky texture, medium body, moderate carbonation, light finish. A good Doppelbock.
Reddish amber color, white head, aroma of sweet malts, honey and caramel, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, .medium body.
95Р — можно брать. Хоть убей, но пахнет кукурузой, помимо солода. Полный карамельно-медовый вкус, с хлебными нотами. Алкоголь скрыт, но не до конца.

On tap. Clear reddish mahogany colour, with a medium and quickly dissipating off white crown. Aroma of malts, caramel, raisin, and dried figs. Taste of sharbat, malts, some caramel, raisin. The aftertaste is slightly sweet. Very strong, very concrete, but at the same time exceptionally smooth and drinkable, so be careful. Goes well with spicy chicken wings or oven roasted ribs.

Cerveza de menor cantidad que la Paulaner habitual, pero mas contundente.
Espuma consistente, de color ambar tostado, y densa. Esta muy rica, pero golpea fuerte. Para dias puntuales, con gran sabor

This was my first introduction to doppelbock style beers and it's still one of my favorites. The mouth feel is nice and would say it's a medium bodied. The alcohol isn't really apparent, so be careful. I will always have this in my beer rotation.
Deep orange without much head. Toffee, caramel, burnt brown sugar. Full body, satisfying beer.

Colore ambrato scuro,schiuma molto compatta e di colore beige.
Gusto deciso.Ho notato subito un connubio di sapori,tra cui ha spiccato dopo qualche istante,quello di cacao.
Birra da non bere a pasto secondo me,da gustare solitaria.La pizza,ad esempio,rompe il sapore

Reddish Amber. Off white thick head. Good retention. Medium bodied. Dark fruit. Caramel. Malty. Deep sweetness. Very slightly bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo bursztynowe, klarowne.
Piana ecru, dość obfita, ale szybko znika, nie zostawia lacingu.
Aromat przyjemny, słodowo chmielowe, karmel i suszone owoce.
W smaku słodkawe, również słód, pieczywo, toffi i susz owocowy.

24-07-18 // 500ml bottle from Maruhn. Absolute German classic beer. True Doppelbock. Almost clear chestnur brown.Nose dark malts caramel. Taste is sweet malty, caramel, toasted, fullbodied, mild bitterness. Good.

Donkerbruin bier met een romige witte kraag die vrij snel inzakt.
Smaak en aroma: Karamelachtig, gedroogd donker fruit en moutig.
lange droge nasmaak.

Delikatnie zamglone, jasny bursztyn, piana średnio obfita, beżowa, średnie i drobne pęcherzyki, zostawia lacing.
W aromacie chleb, jabłkowe i morelowe estry, karmel, przypieczone ciasto. Mocno słodowy i słodkawy.
W smaku delikatnie słodkawe, nie jest ulepkowate. Owocowe estry, karmel, przyprawy, skórka od chleba, dużo słodu, nieco alkoholu. Wydaje się nawet lekkie, głęboko odfermentowane. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, goryczka niska, wzmacniana przez alkohol.
Fles 50cl thuis. Caramel, toffee, donker fruit, maltig, zoet, hazelnoot. (10-2014).

Bottle @ DØE Køge bestyrelse. Appearance: pours cloudy brown with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, caramel, chocolate, banana, light alcohol and raisins/dried fruit. palette: strong malty and medium yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Defiantly one of the better bocks around

Pours a burgundy with minimal head. Light aroma of darker malts and maybe a little yeast. Right away, I was surprised by the sweetness. There's some really good roast malt flavor to it with maybe some plum notes. Maybe a bit woody. Interesting mouthfeel. It's smooth. With the sweetness, if it had any more of a viscosity, could feel syrupy. Overall, though, the rich malt flavors carry it. Tasty.
As expected, a clear definition of its style. Good to have it available in some many bars recently. Strong but not overwhelming, complete and warm. Good beer.

Almost clear amber with a tan crown. Strawberry, plums, light banana, brown sugar, mate, strong resin, spruce, citrus in the background, wood lacquer. Thick medium to heavy bitterness, sugary medium sweetness, light sourness. Medium body, lively carbonation, long bitter finish.

330ml bottle from the shop, drunk at home on a hot humid spring afternoon. Pours clear with a thin, almost instantly settling, coarse head, minimal lacing, some visible rising carbonation. Rusty amber in colour. Aroma driven by eatery fruits with plum and fig over faint honey and caramel malts. In the mouth, very low carbonation, strong alcohol presence, slight dry sourness, strong but indistinct stewed fruit flavour, with a surprisingly short clean finish leaving just a little sugar on the lips. Overall, an example of why even a good Doppelbock is the poor cousin of a Belgian Strong Ale.

Draught at beerbistro. Warm brown with a white head. Big sweet malty biscuit aroma, with toffee and some stone fruits. Taste is sweetish malt and biscuit, caramel, toffee, a light bitterness that nicely balances the sweetness.

Bottle
- Amber color with very thin head
- Very strong taste of caramel and brown sugar, low carbonation.
- vert good aroma.
Bottle - pours hazy dark amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, some orange and sugar. Taste is sweet sugary malt up front with a drying malty finish.

0,33 Bottle- SPAR. It's a great pleasure to taste it. I've never drank a beer I felt so high on the scent of quality malt. I felt: when I brew beer with my friend, in the minutes before hops added ... Beautiful beer, smells and color is unique. You don't feel honey, sticky sugars, even if the alcohol is high. Fantastic flavors. This beer I think is as perfect as it is. The most delightful surprise in the past year, though not the unique "world star" and the price it was not. For me it"s a world star though :)
---
Nagy öröm, hogy megkóstolhattam. Sosem ittam eddig olyan sört, aminek ennyire éreztem az illatán a minőségi malátát. Azt éreztem: amikor barátommal sört főzünk, a komlózás előtti percekben... Gyönyörű a sör, mellette komló is érződik az illatán, színe egyedi. Nem érezni mézes, ragadós cukrosságot, pedig alkoholfoka is magas. Malátás, fantasztikus ízek. Ez a sör szerintem úgy tökéletes ahogy van. Az elmúlt év legkellemesebb meglepetése, pedig nem akkora egyedi "világsztár" és az ára sem volt az. Nálam viszont világsztár :)

Draft at Crossbar. Pours hazy Amber with a very thin head. Tastes like dried dark fruits, light booze, caramel malt, toffee, banana, and some pine hops. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dark fruits, some booze, banana, caramel malt, and toffee.

From the tap at BeerBistro in Toronto. Right off the bat, caramel and biscuity aromas hit your nose, and lo and behold, the same goes for tasting notes as well! Well roasted malt, with tasting notes of dried fruit as well! Mouthfeel is slick. Definitely a beer to keep going back to!
Tastes to what a dark beer should. Taste. Very nice flavor and strong. Not bitter

January 31, 2021, Bottle from Kroger Madison, AL. 


April 27, 2018,  Bottle.  It poured a mahogany color with a quickly disipating off-white head. It had malty caramel aroma. The taste is slightly sweet. Very smooth.  Rating 3.9.

caramel, bread, hay, cereal, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, roasty, herbs, earthy, leather, basement aromas, amber, brown, red, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness,

Tremenda Doppelbock. Aroma, exquisito. A pan, frutos secos, especias y muchos fenoles más que aparecen a tomar temperatura ambiente. Aspecto. Ámbar casi naranja, carbonatacion media alta, espuma consistente y duradera. Deja encaje. Sabor, la mejor parte sin dudas. Frutos secos, panes, especias como pimienta, clavo de olor, a su vez bastante dulce. Tiene mucho cuerpo, sedosa en la boca. El alcohol está bien equilibrado, solo se siente un poco de picor en la garganta cuando llevas un rato tomándola. Excelente.

Ambra scuro rossastra, limpida, con schiuma quasi bianca fine e compatta. al naso tanto malto caramello, leggera tostatura, frutta matura, idem al palato bella dolce con una intensa nota maltata e di frutta secca, alcol avvolgente.

WARKA: 02.19 r.
WYGLĄD: barwa rubinowo-miedziana, klarowne. Piana drobno i średnio-pęcherzykowa, półcentymetrowa.
AROMAT: pierwsze wrażenia przy otwarciu butelki to mocna karmelowość. Po chwili po przelaniu do szkła czuć dosyć konkretną skórkę od chleba i podbudowę słodową. 
SMAK: na początku nieco alkoholu, ale czuć też skórkę od chleba. Alkohol skierowany nieco w stronę szlachetnego alkoholu i rozgrzewa. Dosyć konkretne ciało.
Ogólnie: naprawdę dobrze pijalny Bock (lub doppelbock, ciężko ocenić) o intensywnym, chlebowym smaku i aromacie. Co prawda poza nutami chlebowymi i alkoholowymi nic praktycznie tu nie czuć, ale piwo jest w porządku i warte spróbowania.

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a aclear reddish amber colour with a medium off white head. Aroma of bready malts, some caramel, fruit, raisin, slight toffee and subtle spice. Taste of bready malts, some caramel, fruit, raisin, a hint of charcoal and subtle toffee. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A sharp, dryish, toffee and fruit bitterness in the finish. I agree that’s it’s a simple doppelbock but it’s well made. Very bready, chewy with some dried fruity notes.

Aromă intensă, dulce și bine caramelizată, biscuiți și sirop de zahăr brun, ceva flori și miere, puțin alcool.

Gust ușor și plăcut dulce, cu puțină amăreală de frunze uscate pe fundal, biscuiți, caramelă, ceva grâne, în postgust conturându-se ceva alcool (de parcă aș fi servit recent 20 ml de divin).

Foarte bună și bine făcută.

Fra flaske til påskefrokost.
Mørk og Ravgylden med hvidt skum.
Næsen giver ikke så meget. Mest malt.
I munden er den behagelig og fyldig. Dejlig smag af malt og karamel. Sødmefuld uden at blive kvalm.
Pours dark amber, frothy head. The aroma is toasted bread, caramel. The taste is semi sweet, bread, burnt caramel, some hoppy bitterness in the back. Medium body, smooth, no alcohol. Decent bock.

Przemożne. Piękna etykieta, takoż i piwo. Pełne, treściwe, godne alkoholowo. W aromacie chlebek, tościki. W smaku słodowe ale tak na plus, chlebowe, są melanoidynki, ale pumperniklowe już nie. W zasadzie nawet i drożdżowe w smaku, w odczuciu na języku. Ro-dzy-ny!!! Klasyka, w bockach jak najbardziej sztosiwo. Fajna cierpkość na języku, podlana alkoholem. Barwa ciemnoherbaciana, pełnobursztynowa, nawet klarowne, o pianie nie ma się niestety nad czym rozwodzić. Doskonale ułożone, czysta przyjemność, TOP50 RB.

W aromacie miód wielokwiatowy, nuta chlebowa, rodzynki. Zapach jest słodki, trwały i średnio-intensywny. Piwo bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana żółtawa, zbudowana z oczek różnej wielkości, dosyć obfita, ale szybko opada do zera. W smaku bardzo słodowe. Nuta chlebowa dominuje, dalej mamy wyraźną skórkę od chleba, trochę ciemnych owoców. Goryczka niska, słabo wyczuwalna. Wysycenie średnie. Piwo półsłodkie, sporo ciała. Jest pijalne, a sporej ilości alkoholu zupełnie nie czuć. Byłem sceptycznie nastawiony do tego piwa, stylu, ale pozytywnie mnie zaskoczyło. Pije się to bardzo fajnie, nie ma nudy, alkohol ukryty, Klasyczne style w takim wydaniu? Jestem na tak.

33 cl. bottle bought at Macro Center in İzmir. Cloudy amber/copper coloured with a beige head. Its aroma is roasty malt (even some smoke), it smells marzipan. Taste is medium bitter but its bitterness is malty (I usually prefer hoppy and crispy bitterness). It is also possible to sense some sweetness. Quite bready. I was expecting a bit different palate because I thought that it would be somewhat creamy but its texture is from thin to oily (and somewhat sticky). Carbonation is average (but quite soft on the palate). It has a somewhat bitter and enjoyable finish.

I think this is not my kind of beer but still good!

Amber/koperkleurig, beige foamy schuimkraag, vrij helder en voldoende koolzuur.
Aroma: Moutig, karamel, iets kruidig en zoetig, toffee 
Smaak: karamelmout, vrij zoet, Moutig, toffee, iets kruidig en spicy gehopt. Beetje mossig/aards hoppig en veel kandijsuiker zoetigheid. 
Medium body, redelijk vol en stropig, wat alcohol warmte.... Afdronk is spicy en karamelzoet... redelijk lange bitter.
Much less nice than the blond Paulaner.  It has this kind of caramel taste that some black beer have. Not for me.
Deep golden medium white head. Biscuity with a hint of caramel. Tasteful, but crisp ale.
Absolutely love this beer. Rich. Smooth, and honestly a real beer. If you want more info. There’s thousands of others in here that have described it
Salvator has a copper/brownish colour with a small head. Aroma: sweet, caramel and malty. Taste: caramel, sweet and malty. Not a complex beer but it's quite tasty.

Color naranja, tirando a ámbar, con capa de espuma de un blanco ligeramente sucio de dos dedos de grosor y retención más que decente. Carbonatación suave. Textura oleosa. Aroma a pan, levadura, bizcocho, caramelo, fruto seco, malta tostada. Sabor que sigue al aroma. Mucho pan, caramelo, fruto seco, levadura muy presente, también malta tostada, incluso recuerdos licorosos. Ligeramente dulce. Alcohol bien integrado. Buen postgusto a pan, caramelo y fruto seco. Consumo preferente de este mismo mes y, aun así, muy rica.

500ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear deep amber colour with one finger of head. Malty caramel aroma. Taste is malty with some candy, caramel notes and well balanced spicy finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Not bad.

Schöne rotbraune Farbe. Heller beständiger Schaum. Geruch ist süßlich malzig, erinnert an Marzipan. Geschmack ist süß, malzig, mit Aromen roten Früchten und einer leichten Würze. Ein angenehmer Doppelbock.
Rich and warming. Pour light mahogony small but saying head rich caramel malts boozy warmth sweet finish.
330ml bottle at Octoberfest Pub. Caramelly and malty beer, but slightly watery.

Bottle from Merchants. Aroma is caramel, toffee, earthy hop, wheat, booze, nice. Appearance is amber brown, hazy, light brown head. Taste is caramel, toffee, earthy hop, booze, corn, good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, earthy hop caramel aftertaste. Overall, it's pretty good.

Bottiglia 33 cL. Colore rosso carico, riflessi ambrati, limpidissima. Schiuma non molto persistente. Al naso è dolce (malto caramellato) e in bocca è esattamente come al naso: dolce e tostato in lontananza. Finale amaro ma non particolarmente interessante.
Clear amber appearance. Malt dominates the aroma - toast/bread. Sweetness dominates the taste but there is a touch of bitterness. Strong and pleasant.

Pivo u flaši. Dakle knjige kažu da je to "praotac" svih Doppelbockova. Pivo jake sladne arome i suho voće. Slatkast i likerast okus bez neke posebne gorčine. Svakako treba probati kao nekakvu mjeru za druge Doppelbockove!
Cor âmbar profundo, com uma espuma cor de café com leite. Sabor a café, talvez um pouco doce demais.
V sweet malty smell. Yeasty sickly sweet malt taste. Residual bitterness And boozy aftertaste. Interesting if not great
Great beer with a somewhat sweet aroma and an exciting taste. The palate sensation is great too. Although it is not my favourite.

330 ml bottle, over two years after best before date, but still good. Pours cloudy brown with a very fine tanned head, lacing present. Vere nice and sweet aroma, caramel, cocoa, malty. Very sweet in taste, bit like coffee candy, some chocolate and pruns. Very delicate for almost 8% abv, flat, taste doesn't linger too much. Nice beer in overall but a bit too sweet for me. Maybe it was due to age.

Bursztynowej barwy, klarowne.
Piana niska, dosyć szybko się redukuje.
Aromat słodowy, jest delikatny karmel, nuty opiekane, skórka od chleba, delikatne słodkie nuty miodowe.
W smaku słodowe, trochę słodkie, goryczka niska.
(robe caramel, doppelbock, 7,9°, ça passe très bien pour une lager !)

Bottle. Clear dark amber beer with average off-white head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, bread, with notes of dried fruits, some dark fruits and nuts. Taste is medium sweet and light+ bitter, of caramel, bread, dark fruits, some raisins, toffee, nuts. Medium body and carbonation. Quite good.
Bottle at Ghetto Golf in Liverpool. Amber off white head. Fruity malts and raisin. Good.

Slight caramel sweetness, hints of raisin, pleasantly bitter aftertaste. Alcohol clearly comes through, as well as yeast. Smells fruity, quite nice. Appealing color, unstable head. All flavors perfectly balanced. Definitely too be repeated.
Achetée au E-Center. Bière ambrée au reflets rouges. Nez de malt, licoreux et boisé. Bouche pas assez ronde à mon goût mais bien sur le caramel et les grains. Bonne bière et belle découverte.
On tap at Black Forest Inn German restaurant. Caramel brown hazy pour. Malty sweet aroma. Taste is spot on for the style, very well made. Great beer.

330 ml bottle. clear gold brown color with thin white head. smells caramel and some kind melon and yeast. taste are nice caramel sweetness with pleasant fruits and a bit yeasty. pleasant aftertaste. average in time. aftertaste are caramel sweetness with some grapes and yeast notes. very pleasant beer
Malt aroma with caramel notes. Dark amber without head. Malt, caramel, fruits in flavor. Medium body, high carbonation.
Bottle pours amber-brown with a beige head. Dark fruits, malt, brown, sugar, raisins, hints of smoke, alcohol. I suspect fans of doppelbocks will like this one, but for me, it's too malty and sweet.
From tap, half finger white head, slightly metalic aroma with notes of honey, sweet start and bready finish

Tamna amber boja, vuče na smeđu. Zuta pjena srednje debljine, ne baš mnogo trajna. Arome karamela, kafe, čokolade, kvasca, kao i note alkohola i zemljane arome. Malo slabije karbonizacije, srednje gorčine, sa određenim ukusom i slatkog, izraženog u sasvim dovoljnoj mjeri. Tekstura je uljasta prema kremastoj.

Pours a slightly hazy amber colour with thin white head. Strong malt driven aromas of caramel, stewed fruits, some burnt sugar and freshly baked brown bread; backed by strong alcohol. Taste is full bodied, a rich malty sweetness, warming alcohols, caramel, molasses and stewed fruits with just enough hop bitterness to prevent sweetness from being too much. Fantastic beer.

Caramel/sweet aroma, pours a golden brown with almost no head. Balanced flavour, not overly sweet/syrupy, with delicious aftertaste. Difficult to isolate flavours in this one but a rich, enjoyable dopplebock to be sure!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Has a caramelized taste, can also taste a hint of chestnut. It tastes quite good. Would try again 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Es dominieren süßliche Malzaromen. Gradlinig vom Aroma bis zum Abgang. Sehr solider Doppelbock, dem lediglich ein bisschen mehr Spritzigkeit fehlt.

Kalea Advent Calendar. Sweet almost mead like aroma. Opaque dark amber. Long lasting thick creamy off-white head. Sweet with in an underlying bitterness, more so in the finish. Banana and honey. Herbs and spices. But malty and not OTT. Thick bodied. Creamy. A light fizz to the carbonation. Slightly astringent finish. Very easy drinking with some character to it.

Pours a deep amber coloration with a medium frothy head. Smells of sweet, caramel malts with a hint of honey and an underlying boozyness. Taste is dominated by sweet, caramelly, biscuity malts with just a slight hint of hoppy grassiness. Starts out pretty mellow, but turning a little harsh in the aftertaste. Pretty one-sided, there is not a lot of complexity to this, even though it is still nice in a sweet, malty, but not overpowering so, way. Actually, the longer I drink this, the more I feel that it has a kind of unplesant boozyness to it and is also just a little too sweet. Highly overrated, IMO, but I've seen people say that it actually used to be better and has deteriorated over the years.

High alcohol % beer but the taste is great and doesn’t taste strong. Shame it’s German 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark amber poured into a short dimpled half liter mug with very little visual carbonation. Sweet malt and raisin aroma. Medium body with some sweet malt. The alcohol is well hidden. Filling finish. I thought this beer use to be a little dryer and less sweet. Still one of the best doppelbocks in the world.

Chilled 50cl bottle in large glass
A - hazy orange brown with quickly resolving white head
A - sweet malty caramel dark grapes
T - strong sweet, no bitter, no sour
P - medium body, minimal carb, watery thin texture
O- enjoyable German brew

W aromacie melanoidyny, goździki, metaliczność. Barwa bursztynowa, klarowne, piana drobnopęcherzykowa, niska. W smaku słodowe, nuty opiekane, zboże, alkohol rozgrzewa przełyk. Chyba nie zostanę fanem koźlaków.
Barwa bursztynowa, klarowne, obręcz kremowej piany. W zapachu goździki, opiekana skórka od chleba, ziemiste, korzenne nuty, lekki banan, zboże. W smaku przyprawy, zboże, alkohol. Wysycenie niskie.
Great bockbeer this, it's still the season of bock and I crave the real ones, this one is for real, raisins and smokey caramel flavour. It is the whole picture.

Certainly one of the best value/widely available European brews that’s out there. Pint+ @ 3 bucks...can’t beat that. And it just happens to be outstanding, as well. Appearance resembles a Barleywine - including the short term head. The Taste at 45degrees or above is complex and delightful: malty, smooth, slightly warming. Aftertaste is English-Barleywine ‘like’.

Great taste, smooth with a chocolate coffee after taste. Salvator is def a favorite 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle from Bitter Virtue. Excellent malty doppelbock with brain numbing ability

Wygląd: Bursztynowy, piana beżowa, niska i szybko opada.

Aromat: Słodowy, słodki, chlebowy, ale raczej taki środek chleba i raczej jasnawy.
 No lekkie estry i karmel, dosyć przyjemnie, czysto

Smak: Jest słodycz, ale niezbyt wysoka. W smaku znowu słód, lekka piwniczność,
 chleb, lekkie owoce. Jest goryczka! bardzo fajnie kontruje

Odczucie: Wytrawnie, z lekkim skrętem w kierunku słodycy, zdecydowanie za mocno wysycone, jest goryczka. Finisz słodowy.

Podsumowanie: Jest smacznie, coś się nawet dzieje. Jest słodycz i słodowość przyjemna. Wad raczej nie, więc solidnie. I goryczk ateż jest.

Nice label but not a lot of information about this beer here. 
Clear red brown beer with big long fine cream-colored head, smell is sour and malty, light grass, taste is light sweet and at the end light bitter, medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, alcoholic, overripe dark fruits, 
(I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 10.18 and batch L28575 N)
Cerveja forte, com teor alcoólico de 7,9%. Bem marcante para a escola alemã.

330ml bottle. Pours clear reddish amber, yellowish head. Aroma is malty, sweet, toffee, nutty, prunes. Taste is caramelly, toffee, mildly roasty, honey. Hoppy bitter in finish, some alcohol. Medium bodied, over average carbo. Oily texture. Drinkable beer, maybe too much alcohol in taste.

A small bottle from Extrabrew beer shop in Phitsanulok, Thailand, consumed at the hotel. Aroma: oxtail soup and malt. Appearance: dark brandy, completely flat. Palate: medium-bodied, chewy, long and complex finish. Taste: well-balanced medium bitter and sweet. Biscuits and a hefty brandy-like kick at the finish. A superior beverage, finding this made my day!
Cerveza suave con un matiz tostado. Gustosa al paladar incluso a tragos largos. Para consumo diario.
lots and lots of malt and some caramel in the aroma, taste and after. nice but a bit boring.

Botella 0,33L Color cobrizo, com espuma de color beige, alta con burbujas finas, media resistente, Aroma muy complicada- cereales, frutas secas, ciruela, malta tostada. Sabor- frutas secas, ciruela, malta tostada, caramelo, un dulzor agradable y un amargor fino. Tiene cuerpo. Muy buena

Pours a clear copper brown fron the bottle with bubbly khaki head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of sweet caramel and toasted malts, a back end of oxidation. Taste is malty, sweet, a bit of booze and smoke. Soft and sweet, tasty.
Amber color, large beige head. Sweet aromas of malt, caramel, butter and ripe fruits. Taste of alcohol, yeast, ripe fruits and sugar.

Bottle from Beer Emporium, Bristol.
Tiny head, dark amber colour, clear. Aroma: roasted malts, roasted bread, bit of nuts. Lightly bitter, full body, long finish, soft carbonation. Very nice, smooth, well balanced.

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma beige fine media persistenza, color ambrato carico/rosso torbido, al naso intenso malto tostato caramello miele, in bocca malto caramello biscotti e in fine alcool, carbonatazione leggera, corpo rotondo, oily, leggero dolce, l'alcool si sente, amaro accentuato lungo nel finale. Non sono un amante dello stile ma è una birra intensa e buona. 03.11.17

Pours a reddish chestnut with a thick head that quickly dissipates, with no lacing. Aroma is faint bread with just a whiff of cinnamon. Taste is rich caramel with a very slight spice building. Aftertaste is sweetness with just a hint of booziness. Drinkable beer that is timeless.

0,5 l bottle, BB 11/16. Okayyyyy ... Murky copper in the glass, an huge amount of sediments floating around. Mid sized pale beige head. Malty fruity smell. Taste is malty, little bit dry, berriefruity, mid alcoholic sharpness. Warming. Increasing alcoholic and bitterness to the end and in the aftertaste. Little bit like medicine. Good medicine.

Couleur brune/rougeâtre du plus bel effet. Visuellement presque limpide, mousse éphémère. Nez très agréable sur le raisin sec/caramel. Bien entendu on retrouve ces mêmes arômes en bouche, mais de manière un peu moins glamour, la faute à un manque de corps et à un goût d'alcool qui ressort pas mal en fin de bouche. Dommage, ça partait bien...

Bottle: 330 ml, Price: 1,19 eur 

Nusivyliau, tikėjausi geresnio
Totally decent, fairly full body, some sweetness, slight esters, medium carbonation.
33cl bottle from Alko. Pours reddish to brown coloured with a thin beige head. Aroma has dark fruits and malt, hints of glue. Flavour has caramel ,malts, plums and some yeasty notes. Sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with minimal beige head. Heavy caramel malt aroma. Sweet toasted malt flavor with a touch of hops. Medium to full bodied. Enjoyable.

From Mar 2007

Pours from 16.9oz bottle(room temp) a clear amber with a smallish head of foam that shrinks very quickly. Just a bit of foam in the center of the glass and a tiny bit of lacing.

The smell is of caramel malt and some alcohol.

The taste is of caramel malt up front and it's in big abundance. There's also some grain in the flavour as well as some bready notes and a bit of alcohol. This is defintely a nice tasting Doppelbock and has much more going on than the Optimator I tried yesterday.

Further sips in and the grain is really asserting itself and, combined with this really nice caramel malt that I'm getting, makes for a very tasty and drinkable brew. I like this one a lot! I'm going to have to get some more, for sure.

Bottom line: This example of the style hits my palate very well. I can only recommend it!

330 ml bottle. Pours cloudy amber brown with medium high bronze white head. Aroma is bready, roasted malts, sweet caramel, apple and dried fruits (raisin, figs). Taste is sweet toffee, bread, dried fruits toasted malt and light alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium and syrupy with low carbonation and a sweet, mildly toasted, lightly warming finish
Older bottle @ home. Brown colour with no real head. Tastes sweet, malty, haagse hopjes, Werthers original. Medium body, nice carbo.
Hazy amber with off-white head. Malty aroma. Taste is sweet malts, a very gentle bitternesss, and some spice that gives it a unique character. Good.

Barwa ciemnozłota, klarowna, piana obfita, wyleciała z butelki po otwarciu. W aromacie i smaku niewiele się dzieje - słodowość, lekkie banany, karmel, suszone owoce, ciemne pieczywo - wszystko jest mało intensywne. Piwo wyleciało z butelki przy otwarciu, ale wysycenie nie było za wysokie.

(Bottle) Pours clear amber brown with short-lived thin off-white head. Toffee aroma with hints of raisins. Medium body with good carbonation. Taste of toffee with some fruity hints. Little bitterness apparent and high alcohol content not particularly obvious in taste. Nice beer.
Chlebek, suszone owoce, toffi, trochę alkoholu. Średnio treściwe, półsłodkie. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, średnie wysycenie.

Piwo barwy miedzianej, klarowne, z jasno-beżową pianką. W aromacie trochę karmelu, trochę bananów, trochę pieczywa. Tak naprawdę zapach bardzo średni. W smaku również mało się dzieje. Od biedy można powiedzieć, że czuć trochę karmelu, trochę pieczywa, delikatna kwiatowość i suszone owoce ledwo wyczuwalne. Poza tym uważam, że wysycenie mogłoby być mniejsze. Po tym piwie cudów się nie spodziewałem, ale i tak mnie rozczarowało.

My first double bock but really nice flavor still smooth not to overpowering 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Kolor herbaciany, duża biała piana drobnopecherzykowa. Aromat słodowy dość ostry. W smaku nuty słodowy, chleb, karmel. W sumie niezły podwójny koźlak.
Vynikající pivo! Bohate aroma s tony karamelu, trochu kakaa a mirne uzeniny. Masivni hutny riz, plna nasladla chut a kremova, ale husta pena! Spokokenost!

AROMA: what the fuck, it smells like meat or something. If beef flowers existed, that's how I imagine them to smell. It's very 'brown', malty in its aroma but it's quite refreshing, something like eating a steak in a nice leathery sofa in a restaurant that's just been cleaned. That's some expert analysis from me. ***** APPEARANCE: uuuuuugh soooooo. Literally no head at all, but good clarity (a style requirement). Head is expected from a bock - and yet, this is a strong doppelbock, bottled. So perhaps I can see this through. ***** TASTE: lightly sweet but not overpowering. Malty but doesn't taste like porridge. A bit of dried fruits, with alcohol slightly peeking through like it's a nice Belgian. I dislike most Belgians (except Divock Origi) but it is good, boozy but lovely in doing that. Overall, solid from an almost 8% beer. ***** PALATE: hooooooooooooooo booooy. It's lager-like (8 PERCENT ALCOHOL!), has medium carbonation and goes down like water. As usual, I warmed it through to see all the garbage. The garbage was precisely in line with the aroma and the taste. Slight dried fruit, slight malt, weak boozy undertone. All in a soft lager-ish beer. ***** OVERALL: Lovely. I'd down pints of this, if given the chance. It's strong beer done well, with every detail following you through the entire trip. There are weaknesses in this beer but in general, it's a pretty little number.
Pours an clear copper with a thick white head sans lacing. Nose is slight roasted malt. Body is full. Taste is medium chocolate. Well balanced with a slight bitter after taste. 11.2 oz bottle
Very nice taste. Aroma is one of beer's most complex features.Thanks for the service.

Pretty straightforward doppelbock, steamrolling your palate with deep toffee and caramel malt notes backed up by date, fig, candied apple, and clove. A woodsy, floral bitterness keeps the pint from growing cloy, while the fade has traces of apple jam on buttered bread. Smooth, creamy carbonation makes for an easygoing texture, and the nose is all boozy fruit. Pour's not great, coming out a hazed orange with tons of yeast beasties swirling about but not much head or lace. Otherwise a solid beer.

Clear copper, little carbonation, small head, no lacing. Strong malty aroma, sweet, floral, caramel. Tastes bitter, but with a sweet malty, quite unpleasant after taste. Bitter yeasty funk, utterly sweet-bitter sticky feel on the tongue, herbal, caramel, booze. Terrible to my taste, reminds me of the taste in my mouth when I wake up after a night on booze. Quite flat carbonation, with a oily mouthfeel, strong artificial sugary bitter puke after taste. Terrible.

Had this one on tap at Ottawa's Craft beer Market. Very refreshing on a nice September Friday evening. Great company, great selection. Had a second one yesterday (can from LCBO), had time to savour it, gave it an extra point. 3rd time was part of beer exchange, a bit too sweet, truly taste the toffee.

Weich alkoholischer, herb-malziger Antrunk. Erstaunlich geringe Würzigkeit, hell getreidig malzig, trocken werdend. Die Intensität bleibt hinter den Erwartungen zurück, der Nachhall ist entsprechend kurz. Okay, angesichts des Alkoholgehalts enttäuschend. 10/8/9/8/11/8
Color anaranjado, espuma densa y de 3 dedos de grosor. Textura suave, con olores a cereal sobretodo. Final suave. Una grata sorpresa, bien por Paulaner.

Barwa rubinowo-miedziana, bardzo klarowne, piana niska, pozostaje tylko cienka obrączka. W aromacie chleb, ciastka zbożowe, lekko mięsne. W smaku czuć sporą słodowość, karmel i inne chlebowe akcenty, w końcu to koźlak. Wysycenie średnie, goryczka niska do średniej.
Приятное немецкое пиво с нотами сливы и карамели. Присутствует легкая горчинка. Абсолютно не чувствуется алкоголь при 7,9% .

Strong bitter after taste. Initial taste is good. But take a big gulp and it's too bitter. Also doesn't look like beer. Looks like juice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 50cl bottle. Pours a beautiful reddish amber with abundant white foam. Aroma is caramel, brown bread, resinous, candy fruits. Nice and complex, rather sweet but deep. Body is quite dense, with moderate carbonation. Taste is sweet and complex, though not overly sweet. A nice bitterness can be felt in particular in the finish.

Nice beer! Colour - not typical like doppelbock. Its red-like, orange, brown, the taste is nice, creamy mouthfeel, you cannot taste the alcohol at all... A lot of maltz, sweety notes and taste, a lot of barley aroma, hay. It reminds me of village in Germany, with typical smell. Specialitet!
A german, dark amber, foggy Dobbelbock with very low head. Aroma is malt, caramel, prune, tea, leather, tobacco? Taste is bitter.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: slightly hazy dark amber with medium eggshell white head. Aroma: banana, caramel, plums, dried fruits, bread and some spice. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of banana, caramel, bread, wort, Reine Claude plums, clove, spices. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation.
All time favorite. Would order tons of it if I could get it to the Northern United States
Clear dark anber with a white head. Bready, Malty, caramel and dried fruity aromas. Taste of caramel, roasted malt and dries fruit.

Aroma is sour banana, caramel, pours an amber colour with a small head, taste starts with a very nice malty, bready caramel that leads to a hit of alcohol and leaves a lingering clove, malt resin taste that lasts. Butelka, warka do grudnia 2017r. Barwa ciemnozłoto-czerwona, przejrzysta, piana drobnopęcherzykowa, brudno-biała, stoi długo. W aromacie ciemne słody, ciemny chleb, estry kojarzące się zarówno ze świeżymi jak i suszonymi owocami, w tle nuta alkoholu. Smak piwa przykrywa silny alkohol, mimo że to specyfika stylu to tutaj jest to jednak trochę za mocne. Dopiero w finiszu możemy doszukać się goryczy od ciemnych słodów i słodkiego smaku chleba. Piwo dość ciężkie, przy tym treściwe, wysycenie niskie. Może warto poleżakować i zobaczyć, czy alkohol się uspokoi. Klasyk, chociaż piłem lepsze. Na zdrowie!

Doppelbock brassée depuis 375 ans... on n’aborde pas cette Paulaner de n’importe quelle façon. Perdurer de cette façon mérite tout de même un certain respect.
En houblon, nous avons donc Herkules, Taurus et Hallertauer Tradition. Avec les deux premiers, on s’attend donc à une bière épicée avec une amertume prononcée. L’Hallertauer Tradition est quant à lui plus sur des arômes floraux et sa présence se justifie très certainement pour essayer d’équilibrer l’Herkules et le Taurus. En Malt, Münchner et Pilsener : du classique. Restes à savoir comment tout cela va s’articuler. En verre, la robe ambrée et limpide (EBC aux environs de 38) est plutôt chic. Une mousse blanc cassée malheureusement trop peu abondante nappe à peine la surface. Le nez, quant à lui est très beau. Un véritable voyage olfactif avec des arômes d’orange confite, de pruneaux, de céréales, de banane, d’abricot et d’épices variés qui se mélangent pour notre plus grand bonheur. L’attaque en est le reflet, complète, complexe et équilibrée sur le caramel, l’orange confite et le pruneau; le tout relevé de touches épicées (coriandre et poivre notamment). La deuxième bouche, sur le malt et des arômes de caramel, de biscuits et de banane, continue sur cette belle lancée. L’arrivée de l’amertume en troisième bouche arrête cependant nette la belle histoire qui s’initiait. La raison? Un manque d’homogénéité et d’équilibre entre les saveurs. La ligne directrice disparaît entièrement sur des arômes ne se complétant pas. La deuxième bouche voit l’amertume apparaître sur une intensité modérée, des notes épicée comme on s’y attendait et des arômes de pruneau. L’arrière bouche est alors des plus brouillonne et sans accord avec l’ensemble. La transition avec le final est quant à elle imparfaite et mal amenée. Ce dernier, cependant est agréable, avec un alcool liquoreux se présentant, allié à une amertume appréciable (sans être brillante) et de notes poivrées qui restent longtemps en bouche. L’alcool à 7,9 % Abv permet une bonne longueur mais sur une intégration perfectible. Quelques beaux points forts, mais trop d’imperfections pour en faire une grande bière. En 375 années, ils auraient pu se pencher sur la question...

Barwa ciemnego bursztynu z czerwonymi przebłyskami. Słodki, mocno chlebowy aromat. Do tego karmel, melasa i nuta alkoholowa. W smaku również intensywnie chlebowo dosyć słodko. Są melanoidyny, lekki karmel. Piwo jest rozgrzewające w przełyku, jest lekko alkoholowe ale nie w sposób ordynarny. Jest treściwe.
