Bottle, 330 ml. Pours slightly hazy deep amber/orange with a thin sheen of off-white head. Small amount of visible carb, large bubbles, thick lacing. Big, rich, malty and sweet aroma with loads of molasses, caramel, wholemeal bread, slight honey, slight dark fruit, touch of cinnamon and ginger. Something of a meaty characteristic to it, like honey glazed ham. Taste is caramel and molasses again, some slightly burned, grainy malt, more fruit emerging towards the swift finish, which is moderately dry with lingering light bitterness and some sweet-ish wholemeal bread in the aftertaste. Moderately sweet, less rich and full than in the aroma and lacking in spice, but tasty still. Body is surprisingly light and texture is smooth, helped along by minimal carbonation; very easy drinking for a 7.9! Good stuff overall, exemplary doppel.

Couleur ambrée/orangée, légèrement troublée et recouverte d’une légère mousse elle même ambrée. Nez sur les malts caramel, de belles céréales chaudes, la cannelle, la vanille, le sucre candi, la cassonade, le miel, la châtaigne, la banane et la figue séchées, l’orange confite, le zest de citron, le pruneau, l’amande... Un vrai condensé d’arômes maltés ! En bouche, une carbonatation moyenne mais efficace, un alcool qui tient parfaitement son rôle, une texture souple et riche et une amertume non négligeable mais sous contrôle qui contrebalance très bien les saveurs douces et sucrées. On retrouve des saveurs de biscuits sablés au beurre et de noix, une arrière-bouche liquoreuse, tandis que le final est long, marqué par une légère amertume persistante, l’alcool bien présent avec des 7.9% nerveux et ces arômes maltés qui ne nous quittent vraiment jamais et ce après une bonne minute ! Une excellente Doppelbock à mettre au même niveau qu’une Aventinus par exemple. Excellente bière et au format 50cl ce qui est quand même appréciable et ne nous laisse jamais sur notre faim (enfin, soif...) ! Bouteille 50cl, V&B Grenoble.

330ml bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a dark amber. Off white head. Aroma of dark fruit, caramel. Taste is lovely; dark fruit, caramel, malt, bread. High alcohol profile, so warming. Interesting. Only a small bottle so I’d like another go at this sometime.
Flaska på Thunder Bay Grille Pewaukee. Brunröd med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av torkad frukt och kola. Kola, bränt socker och torkad frukt i smaken.

Takes some getting used to, quite strong with lots of flavor. Alcohol is there but it doesn’t detract from the taste. I like these alot. --- re rate. im keeping as high as it is. its the best doppelbock ive had simply because of its price point. its cheap as balls and just as good as many other competitors

Dark amber color, between orange shades and something darker near the brown cinnamon. Crowned by an immense layer of creamy foam of great persistence and soft texture.
Aroma malty with notes of cereals, butter and fruit confit with delicate floral notes. Of intense entrance in the mouth, medium carbonation and with enough body, it emphasizes the deep sweetness of the malt, the nuances to toffee, currants, plums and toasted bread. The alcoholic content provides a dry finish that leaves the initial sweetness aside, appearing in the aftertaste a hint of hops, which causes a final sensation of dry and slightly bitter at the same time.
Tap at pub. Pours dark amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is caramel, malts, fruit. Taste is caramel, malts, dried fruit. Some dryness. Nice one.

12:16 Bottle from Table and Vine. Room temp. Amber with fizzy head that fizzes off to ring quickly. Caramel fig raisin maple syrup aroma with some booze. Roasted/burnt caramel raisiny maple syrup sweetness with woody herbal bitterness. Slick body and surprisingly fizzy. Not as great as I remember but still tasty. Maybe I should have chilled it but I like room temp beers sometimes.

Drinking from a 0,5 l bottle. 
In the aroma caramel, raisins.
The unclear brown beer has a medium off white head. 
In the taste chocolate, roast malt and raisins.
Medium carbonated.

Sampled from a bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark orange/amber colour with a white head. Aroma of caramel and fruit. The taste is very warming with lots of sweet malts bringing a butterscotch flavour. Lots fruit with notes of raisins, figs, dried banana, orange, port and herbs. There is even a hint of rum or whisky - this beer does not hide its alcohol content! Excellent balance and a really good mouthfeel. A really nice, well-made winter warmer.
bottle from hyvee....nose is caramel malt....this beer is delicious....sweet caramel and toffee notes...light fruit...raisiny...so good!

The beer looks nice. Its quite light for a Doppelbock. The color is a dark amber/ orangey brown. The beer seems clear, but light reveals a lot of particles floating around. The beer bubbles happily. On top of the beer a nice layer of soft white foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses, but a nice drape of foam remains.
The smell of the beer is nice. It is a lovely beer for a cold autumn night. The smell is soft and sweet, filled with delicious sweet aroma’s of syrup, caramel, dark red fruits and some raisin. The malts are clearly smellable. I also smell some bitter hop notes. There is a lovely warming touch of the alcohol. The smell is the same like manny German doppelbock beers. It is a lovely rich warming smell.
The taste is pretty much the same. It is also familiar. It has a lovely malty sweeties, some roasty bitters and a salty touch. The flavours are all in very good balance. I really like it. It is lovely besides the fire.
The palate is good. The beer is filled with tiny bubbles. The tingle the tongue lovely. A good beer it is.

Appearance : amber color moderate nice soft foam    Aroma : caramel roasted malts malty      Taste : herbal cough syrup caramel dried fruits banana    Palate : mouthfeel creamy medium bodied7.9% dopple bock bier not expensive great bier

Bottle. Pours a beautiful red with orange tint and a light, quick-dissipating head. Nose is caramel, date, fig paste, milk chocolate, butterscotch, and toasted grain. Starts out with a surprisingly savory flicker, then goes straight into the barreling freight train of sweet, dark fruit, boozy notes, and rum-soaked raisin paradise. If whiskey was made out of dates, it might taste like this. Finish is long and hot; it actually drinks higher than the ABV. Very good, but not as subtle as some.

50cl bottle at home. Cloudy amber colour, offwhite creamy head. Herbal, cough syrup, clove, caramel, dried fruits, banana, vanilla. Lingering herbal finish. Good body, medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

Bottle. Color: Light ruby red. Small light beige head. Taste: Sweet lightly roasted malts, caramel, hints of brown sugar, vegetables and metal. Finish is also lightly bitter. A bit too sweet in my opinion.

- rotbraune Farbe mit leichter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- ein leichtes Aromen nach Süße und Malz
- angenehme Carbonisierung
- geschmacklich ist das Ganze dann leider nur ein malzig-süßlicher Brei
 ohne besonderen Körper oder weitere Noten
- im Abgang kommt dann noch etwas Hopfen hinzu und das wár es dann
- es bleibt ein seltsam klebriges Mundgefühl
Fazit: Klebrig süßer Brei

50cl. Bottle. 

Pours clear brown, tan head. 

Aroma caramel, roasted malts, sweet, sugar. 

Taste caramel sweets, roasted bitter. 

Mouthfeel creamy. 

Great brew.
bottle @ supermarket (budapest) dark brown colour, medium body, normal carbonated, nice sweet malty, caramel aroma, doesn’t feel the high alcohol percent, very delicious!!

Kolor: bursztynowy, lekko zamglony.

Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trochę strzela, ale dość wolno opada.

Zapach: wyraźnie słodowy, chlebowy, sporo aromatów ciemnych owoców, rodzynek, melanoidyn, aromatów opiekanych, lekkie akcenty chmielowe, niestety niezbyt świeżego chmielu.

Smak: pełnia jak na ekstrakt i styl, dość lekka, smukła, sporo nut słodowych, chlebowych, trochę ciemnych owoców, melanoidyn, lekko opiekanych, lekkie akcenty chmielowe, niska goryczka. 

Wysycenie: średnie.

Pours tea colour with a medium, decent head. Aroma of breadcrust, caramel, cake, some raisins and red fruits. Quite sweet in the taste but by no means cloggy, alcohol well hidden, medium herbal bitterness. The flavours are again caramel and cocoa biscuits. Tasty beer of malty profile.
Mild coca aroma with a roasty body and a smooth milky body finish is clean. Great doppelbock, but not as good as optimator.
Good Doppelbock. Pours deep amber (like tea) with small head. Sweet malty aroma and taste. Drinkable despite it’s ABV.

Thick, dense cream head over deep clear amber beer. Intense, coloured malts’ nose, sweet bread, very powerful. Autumn leaves. Bitterish taint on top of all the former. Good, noble hops and not in a small dose. Even a tad metallic; breadcrust. Medium to well-bodied, slick, even slightly sticky; low carbonation. A classic, well deserving its moniker of liquid bread. Had no idea I hadn’t it covered on RB yet.

Enjoyed: On tap (King’s Caffe Food Pub Rijeka)
Appearance: Blurry copper colour, with medium head. 
Aroma: Vanilla, caramel, roasted malt, grains, alcohol.
Palate: Medium body; medium carbonation.
Taste: Bread, caramel, alcohol and sweetness which turns to bitter aftertaste. 
Overall impression: Solid beer for enjoyment.
Edit: Bottled version was somehow watery (?) and had some banana taste (Poured from a bottle into a stem glass.)

Pours a hazy caramel brown with a thin light tan ring. Pleasant aroma of sweet malts. Very smooth with a medium body. Tastes of caramel and toffee flavors. Not harsh or bitter. A slight alcohol tingle on the tip of the tongue and a smooth warm finish. Pretty enjoyable.

Pauliner's Salvatore: has a unique dark rich taste that is often described as "liquid bread," it a hearty beer that can be a mini-meal by itself.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33l bottle. Pours clear copper, a finger of almost tan head, medium retention. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, toffee, dried fruit. Tastes sweet, some bitterness, caramel, plum marmalade comes to my mind. You can feel alcohol, but it’s not annoying. It just adds some warm feeling. Body is quite sweet with almost oily texture and average carbonation. Some bitterness in the finish. Well balanced, proper late evening comfort beer.

16 Septiembre 2016. From Carrefour. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 3x01. Typical profile of the style. Maybe not the best example but nice enough, cheap and easily available in supermarkets again. Avg 4

12 Octubre 2019. De Bar Batavia, en Barcelo Punta Umbria Mar. En almuerzo, con papas fritas con huevos fritos + Nuggets. Maltosa, acaramelada tipo toffee y fuertecita. Mas apagada de lo que la recordaba aunque a medida que la vas bebiendo va gustando mas. Sin casi nada de espuma. Avg 3.75

28 Sep 2019. De Bar Batavia. En vaso hefe de Bavaria. Tras partido de futbito. En almuerzo, con papas fritas con huevo frito + pollo empanado + alitas de pollo frito. Bastante mejor de lo que la recordaba, con el sabor a caramelo bien rico y bien combinado con  la calidez alcoholica. Incita a trago largo
Bottle at home. Clear reddish brown colour, big white head. Nose is caramelly. Taste is also sweet, full bodied. Boozy aftertaste. Nice and full bodied, a real killer.

zapach dość intensywny, mocno słodowy, sporo karmelu, przypieczonej skórki z chleba i alkoholu. kolor głębokiej miedzi, opalizujący, piana biała, średnio obfita, średnia i drobna, stara się trzymać. w smaku pełne, słodowe, chlebowe z odrobiną biszkopta i nutą karmelu. goryczka niewysoka, alkoholowa z nutami ziołowymi. nasycenie średnie do wysokiego.

I’m drawn to a memory of several years ago, on an ice-cold winter’s night; I got off work around 9pm, and head to the Publix supermarket close to work to pick up steaks and beers (it was Sunday evening, the last day of my work week at that time).

After picking up some potatoes and ribeyes and other goodies, I head to the beer section, and Publix has a good one; since I’m a huge fan of Paulaner’s Hefeweissen, I decide to also try their Salvator double bock; the picture on the bottle is quite amusing, with the chubby (obviously German, possibly Bavarian) monk, selling (or giving) some double bock to what appears to be a wealthy German man - who was ever-so-pleased to receive his generous helping of double bock in a huge, metallic stein.

I arrived home with my groceries, frost coming out of my mouth as I kept the heat off to save money (was using only space heaters as the propane take was empty - Hank Hill would be ashamed of me!); I turn my tiny space heater on in the living room, turn on the TV, open some chips with some Helluva Good sour cream & onion dip - and start at it!

The Paulaner Salvator double bock was truly strong - I could taste the alcohol - but it was also rich and flavorful.
I start to get a buzz quickly; after a while I make the ribeye and microwave the potato and chow down while watching whatever I was watching on TV that evening; I’m bundled up all nice & snug under a comforter (I better damn well be - it’s probably in the twenties as frost was still coming out of my mouth; there’s nothing quite like drinking a good beer while in a freezing room)!

The house I live in is next to a kudzu field, which means that field mice find their way into the house when it’s cold; regardless of who cold the inside of my house may be, it’s still warmer than outside.
A field mouse notices I’m watching the TV, so it makes its way across my coffee table where the food is, and perches itself on a cup or glass with some of this Paulaner Salvator double bock in it; it sniffs the contents, bends over further until it is able to reach the beverage, and proceeds to lap the stuff up - clearly this mouse has great taste in beer!

I give it about a minute, as it no longer really notices me, and yell, "HEY!!"; the mouse, startled, loses its footing on the edge of the cup/glass and FALLS IN!
Half a second later, it jumps out of the beer and scurries off to God knows where; I feel a little guilty in scaring the poor thing, as it was bad enough that it was so cold, but now it was WET, which only makes things colder; not sure if it survived or not, but you can bet that I wasn’t going to drink out of that cup/glass any more that evening!

Hope little mousey enjoyed its buzz.........

Damn good doppelbock. Malty and satisfying with every mouthful. Looks and smells fantastic and a good hit of alcohol that complements the taste. Medium level of carbonation and not fantastic head retention in the bottle I had (500ml), but good drinking all the same. If you like strong beer or you are turning others on to stronger beers, get yourself one of these.

330 ml bottle at Bavarian Bier House in Brisbane. Pours dark Amber with small tan head. Mild, sweet aroma. Taste is malt, dried dark fruit. Good.

Cas-En lo referente a esta cerveza, debo decir que tiene poco gas y poca espuma y un aroma dulce y un sabor muy fuerte pero empalagoso.

Gal-No referente a esta cervexa, debo dicir que ten pouco gas e pouca espuma e un aroma doce e un sabor moi forte mais empalagoso.

Pours a nice amber with a quickly fading medium head. Not usually a fan of doppelbocks, but this has changed my opinion. Has a bit more going on than your average American doppel. The balance of malts and sweetness was refreshing. Aroma was rather weak but a nice smoky malt.
Brown colour opaque and super malty smell. Chewy palate, sweet, big caramel, a hit of warming alcohol at the end, drinks like a meal.
Couleur ambré foncé; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés et fruités (fruits rouges); l’alcool est trop présent; bière un peu trop douce

Medium frothy off-white head with good retention.
Hazy brownish amber.
Weak aroma, roasted sugar.
Taste is roasted sugar and spicy (clove) with some alcohol warmth.
Bitter finish and some crispy palate. Full body.

Bottle 330ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a clear copper with a red tint. Head is off-white, averaged sized and lasts well in the glass. Aroma is of lightly cooked brown sugar, dark plums (ripe), dried cranberries, toasted brown bread, chocolate, caramel and a pinch of cinnamon. Flavour is exceptionally smooth (especially considering the ABV) with a light bitterness, lightly toasted malts, wholegrain bread, caramel, brown sugar, raisins, tea leaves, a touch of chocolate and a (white) peppery finish. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a good length, warming finish. An amazing Doppelbock in every sense – not to mention suburb value for money!

Looks about coppery brown with no head coming up. Strong malty flavors and a recognizable alcohol bite to sum things up. Pretty weak in the middle, a little unwanted watery hole there. Starts off with a good malty base with bready notes and honey. Finishes with warm alcohol to draw the line. Decent doppelbock.
Dark copper color. Very malty and coffee taste. Some bitterness and alcohol. A fine doppelbock abv % 7.9

I bought the bottle just because I was out of bock beer and I liked the label. Glad i did! Color is a slightly hazy amber an i has a big creamy head. A bit of lacing. Aroma of bread, caramel and maybe citrus peel? Taste is sweet with notes of burned malt, dark chocolate, bread and caramel. Finish is a little bitter. Just enough to invite another sip. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear copper with a small white head that disappears a little too quickly and leave low lacing. Nose is of caramel, bread and alcohol. Taste is only lightly sweet and features less caramel than the nose would indicate. Alcohol is still present and a bit disturbing, taking too much place in the flavor profile. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is a bit syrupy. Alright but I had higher hopes for it.
Long pleasant aftertaste. Bit of coffee notes. The high alcohol is noticeable. But not dominant.
Fles gedeeld met Tom. Roodbruin, licht troebel bier. Erg wild bij inschenken maar het schuim trekt snel weg. Aroma van caramel en pruimen. De smaak is ook caramelachtig en bitter. Nasmaak is bitter.
De salvator is een dubbelbock, dit bier heeft een zoete geur, een donker bruine kleur en een caramel-achtige smaak.

Despite its smell is quite weak it has a very rich amount of french vanilla chocolate tofee rosewood nuances. I was specting a much darker aspect although its caramel color its pretty sexy. All of these aspects come together and create an exquisite expirience wich contains a rich tofee chocolate vanilla coffee flavor with a moderate bitter taste that gives the sensation ure drinking a sturdy sexy beer.
Bottle at home. Dark caramel pour with a thin tan head. Caramel, toffee, dark fruit, coffee. Medium bodied, smooth and silky texture, and a burnt caramel bitter-sweet finish.

Robe ambrée. Nez élégant sur des notes d’agrumes, de malt, de caramel, pointe de vanille. Bouche à l’attaque ronde, belle onctuosité, bulle crémeuse et finale ample et équilibrée. Une bière puissante mais qui garde de l’élégance.
Good dark ale muddy and dark full malty flavours good stuff really will sample again

Muddy brown pour with thin head, quite low carbonation. Caramel, bread and sweet dried fruit aromas. Taste is caramel, bready, doughy, at first, ends more like a sweetish pretzel. Sweetness cuts through a little booze at the end

Clear, dark brown colour and small tan lacing. Aroma is not that strong, I get mostly malts, some toffee and... rye? Taste is really nice and rich, almost sweet at first, then ends with a slightly bitter and dry finish. Slick, a bit oily mouthfeel, light carbonation, tiny bubbles. Well-balanced, rich and flavourful beer, just the way I like it.

0,33l bottle. Clear deep copper/ruby colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Honey, flower, caramel malt. Taste: Sweet start with a pleasent bitter mouthfeel. The malty caracter is strong but well balanced. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium lasting sweet finish. Very good and drinkable.

Pours red-brown with a light head. Smells of sweet Caramel and raisin. Tastes fruity particularly raisins with the alcohol only apparent as a warming aftertaste.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Cor vermelha-acobreada, límpida, espuma branca de boa formação. Aroma de caramelo, malte tostado, pão. Sabor é doce, maltado e caramelado, que perdura na boca por um bom tempo, amargor muito leve e levíssimo frutado. Possui bom corpo, de médio pra cima, bem complexa. Possui uma drinkabilidade alta, com boa sensação de aquecimento do álcool
I really like this beer. It's full bodied and flavourful, perfectly brewed, no off flavours. Strong caramel notes. D&S Dresden

Soooo smooth! Paid a reasonable price of around 3 bucks for this. I'm glad I did so tasty but I drank other beers. Before hand either way still great!

Boca 0,33L..pjena brzo nestaje, iako ima 7,9% alkohola ipak se ne osjeti u okusu, klasični doppelbock, iskreno očekivao sam više od ovoga piva..

Pours nut brown with medium head. Aroma is sweet, sourish, caramel, malts, fudge, leather, toffee. Taste is woody, some bitter notes, caramel, burned sugar, resin, sweet caramel candies, milk toffee. Very nice beer!
Warka 05/2017. Geshenk od wujka dla taty. Degustowane z ojcem po pół. Klasyczny doppelbock chociaż wydaje mi się, że nieco mniej intensywny w smaku i aromacie od polskich piw w tym stylu.

Miedziany kolor, dość klarowne. Żółta, średniotrwała piana. Początkowo idzie do góry, jednak już po paru minutach opada do kożuszka. W smaku i aromacie dominują słody. Dość słodkie w smaku z nutami karmelu, toffi, tostów, chleba. Chwilami przebijający się alkohol. Średnie ciało, dość wysokie nagazowanie. Nic szczególnego.

Bottle. Dark chestnut, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, toffee. Taste is medium heavy sweet, only light bitter. Alcohol is hidden, but I have found this beer too heavy to be easily drinkable.
500ml bottle. Brown with one finger head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, dried fruit. taste is caramel, nutty, dried fruit. Very smooth and hides the alcohol well. Nice beer.

Aroma - sweet malt and some wooden qualities. And a decent bit of alcohol.
Appearance - the body is a clean burnt umber. The head is beige and 1" and slowly rings out.
Taste - has a rich barley malt, only slightly sweet. There is slight woody and a little dark sugar.
Palate - medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, slightly sweet finish.

Bottle courtesy of rickgordon. Pours hazy brown with a small beige head that doesn’t leave much trace in the glass while quickly dissipating. Smell is heavy malts, slightly fruity and tiny floral with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, fudge, dark honey, prunes, cherries in brandy, hay, minerals, leather and hints of vanilla. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, malty, fruity and tiny floral. Mouthfeel is soft, round, velvety, very tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny bitter with complex fudge malts, dried dark fruits and floral dark honey. Rich, complex and incredibly tasty. A treat and an absolute delight with some blue cheese.

330ml bottle from Beer Cartel, Sydney. Poured a deep chestnut brown with fading light beige head leaving a soapy lace. Rich and intense malt-forward characters of caramel, toffee, mid- and dark, dried fruits, Christmas spices, toasty malt and milk choc. Live the nutty, yeasty complexities too most notably on the palate. Deep and rich but clean and not without balance. A gentle bitterness keeps things in perspective. Medium to full body with medium carbonation and a moderate to full length and intensity finish of warming fruits and spice.

Pours hazy amber/brownish color from bottle. Intense malt aroma, especially crystal malt, toffee and bread aromas. Head fades quickly. Low to med carbonation and body. It’s hard to drink too many bottles because of sweetness and of course alcohol ratio. A bit too sweet for me

Nagy, tartós hab, barna szín. Malátás, karamelles, kissé fűszeres illat. Karamelles íz, malátás alapon, enyhe keserű, gyenge szénsav. Utóíze gyorsan elillanó kesernye és karamell, pörkölt maláta. Testes sör.
330 ml butelka. Ciemny bursztyn, brązowy kolor. Piwo ma smak karmelowy. Pianka szybko opada. Średnio gorzki smak, który normalnie zostaje w ustach. To dobre piwo, ale przereklamowane.

Pours clear reddish brown from the bottle. An attractive off white crown forms, albeit briefly. Relatively quickly after the initial pour the beer loses all evident lacing and foam. Smell is malty sweet with no evident fruity notes. The malt aroma has a distinctive roasted tinge. Flavor is sweet caramel and butterscotch. Finish trends alcoholic and leaves a light bitterness behind. Am overall a bit disappointed, it lacks the depth of better Doppelbocks. The German offering from Andechser is much more rewarding and complex. Still, it is quite drinkable. Have it in a quiet moment, after dinner.
Dark amber / brown color. Smells prunes, buckwheat honey, malt and bakery yeast. Medium body with malty focus and quite solid alcohol mouthwash. Hint of caramel in the aftertaste.
Espuma beige que permanece durante la cata, color cobrizo anaranjado apreciándose finas burbujas en constante borboteo, dulce aroma en nariz, sabor dulce de la malta con un final potente y seco

Aroma: Dried fruit, bread, caramel, light hoppy spiciness, metal on minimum. Quite pleasant and intensive. Appearance: Head at first high and dense, quickly falls to a small layer, color is deep amber to ruby. Taste: Strong bread notes with some dried fruit, caramel, molasses, some spicy hoppiness, light booze alcohol. Palate: Sweet boozy finish, full body, carbonation medium.

Color copper, no bread when it’s pour by the waiter. Smell of toffee. Some good dried fruit sweetness and very slight coffee bitterness. No alcohol taste despite its 7.9%.

A good beer with white sausages!

bottle. Pour is a clear copper with a thick khaki head and average lacing. Aroma is malty as expected. Caramel, toffee, and bread. Sweet but not overbearing. Taste is caramel and toffee with a sour bread flavor that lingers on and becomes more of a glazed, toasted biscuit. Average mouthfeel and a sticky sweetness that lingers. Good beer.

Butelka 0.5l (03.2017). Piwo klarowne o głębokiej, miedzianej barwie podkreślone żółtą pianą, obfitą o kremowej konsystencji choć szybko znikającą bez widocznego efektu krążkowania. Aromat "koźlakowy" choć wyraźnie podkreślony nutka alkoholu, nieco słodką ale całkiem przyjemną. W smaku słodowe, lekko słodkawe z nutami melanoidynowymi i bardzo przyjemną rozgrzewającą nutką alkoholu choć sam alkohol bezpośrednio jest dość dobrze schowany. Pours a clear copper color with a long lasting head with lacing.
Smells a sweet grainy aroma.
Tastes fruity, malty with a bitter kick.
Medium mouthfeel.

Overall? Very good with a nicely hidden near 8% alcohol content!

500ml bottle. Clear, copper-ish, dark amber colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Slightly sweet-ish, dark malty aroma with a minimally grainy and strawy touch, hints of malt lozenge, nuttily interludes. Taste is slightly sweet dark malty, minimally dry woody, hints of malt lozenge, minimally grassy hoppy counterweight, chatoyant maltiness alludes to hazelnut, pecan, cola. Very clean, well balanced. Not too heavy, nevertheless effective.

APARIENCIA: Ámbar oscuro con tintes rojizos a contra luz, se observa traslucida con moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color marfil de burbuja compacta, poca retención ya que se disipa rapidamente.

AROMA: notas de caramelo, maltas tostadas, azúcares quemados, muy discretas notas de chocolate.

SABOR:de entrada y lo que predomina son las notas de caramelo y maltas tostadas, azúcares quemados, y atrás ligera nota de chocolate, que en ningún momento llega a empalagar; el retrogusto con amargo ligero seco, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero con sensación cremosa en boca, carbonatación moderada baja.

RESUMEN: una doppelbock excelente, de libro.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of May 2016 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a deep red amber colour with a just under two finger light tanned head that dissipated quickly leaving sparse spotty lacing. Aromas of sweet honey, caramel, overripe banana, plum and fig. Taste was also very sweet, probably over sweet for my palate. Lots of toffee, butterscotch, caramel, grape, plum and prunes. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Overall, if it was less sweet, this would have been really good. As it is, its not so sweet that I don’t want to drink it again, yet at the same time, I can’t finish a whole bottle myself due to its sweetness. Around half a bottle and I’m done. Or I just drink it really slowly. Because of this, I currently prefer both Ayinger Celebrator and Weihenstephaner Korbinian over Salvator.
Excelente aroma, coloração vermelha rubi. Sabor bastante maltado, alto teor alcoólico.
Garrafa de 50 cl . É uma das Doppelbocks mais fáceis de encontrar. Já foi consumida várias vezes mas nunca tirei notas. É uma boa cerveja
330 ml bottle @home. Dark copper color. Very malty and coffee taste. Some bitterness and alcohol. A fine doppelbock abv % 7.9

A copper-coloured dobbelbock, with malty caramel aroma and flavour, but not with as full a taste as the ones from Aying or Andechs. Moderately sweet, with a bitter finish, and some unfortunate metallic notes. No reason to revisit this.

An overwhelming caramel aroma. The look of it isn’t very appealing, it has almost no foam and the color is vague, not golden, not dark, not too clear, not too hazy... The taste though is quite sweet and the alcohol is almost undetectable, light body and medium carbonation makes it an easy drink.
Bottle, 330 ml courtesy of colleague. Pours deep amber with off-white head. Caramel malty, sweet, dried fruit and spices notes. Some people are crazy about this, just OK for me.

Diverse set of aromas - toffee, bread, a light touch of orange, some brown sugar and just a bit of plum/prune. Malt dominated, but some noticeable impact of hops and yeast.

Slightly dark amber color, hazy; small off-white head.

Fairly sweet, especially on the finish; light to moderate bitterness with a hint of orange.

Medium bodied; oily/creamy texture; fairly long finish.

Overall a pretty good beer; I like the wide diversity of aromas; while it is malt dominated, the hops and yeast add some additional flavors and diversity.

Bottle at the St Neots ’Booze on the Ouse’ Beer Festival 2016. Orange-brown, clear. Bready malty smell. Toast and honey. Taste is sweet and bready with an intense hit of orange peel and spicy hop. Fully carbonated palette. Very very good.

This one’s evaded me for a while, but Salvator is well worth the wait. Paulaner’s Doppelbock pours ruby-brown. Aroma packs dark fruit, caramel, toasted nuts, rich malt, brown sugar, and bread. Flavor brings lots of candy-like and fruity succulence. There’s some heat and sugar from the alcohol, but this brew avoids coming off as hot or cloying. This brew has plenty of strength and more than its fair share of old-world charm.

Originally rated on 5/30/08. my first doublebock was pretty good. the body was a dark reddish color there wasnt much head or lacing to speak of. Thick malty flavor with hints of brown sugar. a rather smooth beer, easy to drink, cant wait to try the second one.

Let tåget nøddebrun med tæt cremefarvet skum. Duften er fyldig og maltsød. Smagen er fyldig og blød, med stærk sødme, domineret af mørk malt, balanceret af en svag bitterhed og alkohol. Eftersmagen er domineret af brændt malt.
Very clear red amber beer. Extremely alcoholic and very sweet and not too much else. Great looks and very smooth and full palate, but otherwise not very convincing for me.
Few notes and numbers for this rating. Sweet maltiness. Some fruits and alcohol with almond.

Smell: hops, malt, citrus. 
Taste: bitters; in the background: delicate flavor of anise with dried plum & almond’s accent.
Color: tea - orange with the cream-colored head.

Tried this beer for the first time last night at of all places, a wine bar, now my favorite. I went out and bought me some to have in the comfort of my home. Beer is very, very smooth with exceptional flavor but be careful because it does pack a punch that’ll sneak up on you. I can go on and on so I’ll just stop here and go enjoy another one. Enjoy any beer and be safe.  Juan

Light amber colour,small white head that disappears quickly. Sweet malty aroma with caramel and alcohol. Taste is sweet and malty with alcohol bite. 
Nothing fancy but its good.

dense creamy head, deep amber/red; toasty caramel & slightly boozy nose; rich first sip of malt and alcohol warmth; subtle bitterness, earthiness, dryness on my palate; I was expecting sweetness but got warmth, bread crust, and almost barrel-agedness.
Amber colour, caramel-malty aroma, almost no head. Sweet, medium body. Far from being a good doppelbock, rather disappointing.
3,5l op starkbierfest wat een killer niet echt een spannende Bock, mout tonen met wat melkchocolade redelijke Body, ik wordt er niet warm of koud van

Tall dense creamy head, deep amber/red; toasty caramel & slightly boozy nose; rich first sip of malt and alcohol warmth; subtle bitterness, earthiness, dryness on my palate; I was expecting sweetness but got warmth, bread crust, and almost barrel-agedness; a hearty meal, makes me want to start a monastery. Would enjoy again on a cold and/or rainy night.
Very vindictive of the style and having a good thing to of the this style is I think at one of the better styles.

Bière sombre ambrée
Mousse non épaisse mais bien présente
Bière assez "épaisse" un peu lourde et alcoolisée
Caramel et miel
A réessayerr

Draft at Beer Bistro. Pours a hazy caramel orange with a thin, off white head. Aroma has great notes of caramel, toffee, dark fruits, bread, apple, and other fruits. Taste is slightly sweet but balanced. Caramel, bread, dark fruits, toffee, apple and fruits, and a drawn out, slightly brown/candy sugar ending. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Slightly syrupy in the mouth. Overall very nice. Dark fruits, dark sugar, and fruits.

Bottle. Aroma of moderate malt, caramel, sweet alcohol and spices. Hazy amber with off-white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate+ sweet and light bitter, and some alcohol sweetness. Medium+ body, oily texture, avg. carb., sweet finish.

Dunkelrotbraune Färbung, sehr behäbige Perlung. In der Nase eine tolle Malzigkeit, Karamell. Im Trunk setzt sich das fort, dann alkoholisch, wenn auch nicht zu sehr, süßlich, leicht holzig, leicht kirschig. Schöner Absacker.

Bottle from the supermarket. I heard that the tap version is quite different. This one is ridiculously sweet. After a strong taste aroma experience (that is hard to describe... the sweetness overtakes it all) a long finish with some bitter pepper and smoke notes follow. Also some booze. The whole combination seems very one dimensional and didn’t please me so much.
However I look forward to trying this from the tap again...

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 9A - dark). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: malt predominant, with moderate Maillard notes (bread crust) and slightly toasty aroma. Some alcohol present with a slight peppery note. APPEARANCE: medium to dark ambar color and clear. medium-low beige head, creamy, with low retention. TASTE: predominant flavor of bread crust (Maillard), toasty malt and a faint caramel-like note. low bitterness with an almost dry finish. no hop flavour discernible. PALATE: medium to medium-full body with a slight velvey texture. moderate carbonation. faint alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a good and traditional Doppelbock well within the style. Does not exhibit optional notes as dark fruits among others.

Pours clean dark amber color with small off-white head. Smell is sweet and very pleasant; toffee, caramel, herbs.

Full body with medium carbonation. Thick texture. Bittersweet and somewhat boozy taste. Aroma of sweet malts, toffee, caramel, herbs, flowers, cinnamon. Aftertaste is mostly boozy and combines the sweetness of malts and caramel with burning sensation of alcohol. Very rich and nicely balanced.

Overall, great doppelbock. Recommended.

33cl bottle, served in Lagar glass. Pours amber/brown with small white head. Aroma is based on sweet malts, very caramel-ish and licorice forward. Strong licorice taste along with caramel and hints of fruits. Quite sweet on the palate as usual in this kind of beers. Medium body, soft carbonation. Not bad.

Bem avermelhada, pouca espuma, aromas intensos de torrado e doce com pão bem marcado. Cerveja de alto corpo, FG e maltês torrados bem perceptíveis. Álcool muito bem inserido e atenuado ao paladar frente aos 7,8%, sensação de cerveja "nutritiva" (verdadeiro pão líquido). Amargor balanceado,inclusive no retrogosto.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille de 50cl. Couleur rousse, mousse abondante mais de tenue assez faible. Des arômes très caramélisés qui débouchent sur un mélange d’ herbes aromatiques( à la Jägermeister ). La carbonnation est un peu tristounette, çà doit être plus sympa à la pompe. Trouvé à V’nB’ - Noyelle Godault.
Clear amber liquid with yellowish thick head. Caramel, bread, silo. Taste of bread and caramel, med sweet, light bitter, Medium body.
Red brown with thick white head. Mild aroma of malt, bread, caramel and dried fruit. Taste is medium sweet with small bitterness, alcohol burn is also present. The beer has a very creamy texture.

Gekauft im Supermarkt (Rewe) in München. Dunkler Bernstein ohne Schaum. Süßlicher Geruch mit Honigaroma. Geschmack für mich gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber mit der Zeit immer besser. Karamell, süßlich, Malzig.

Brown with tan head. Aroma sweet malt and caramel. Medium full body, minimal alcohol. Pleasantly sweet and sticky up front, malty, brown sugar, finishes on the drier side. I am a fan of doppelbocks and this a solid one.
On tap. Clear amber with off-white foam. Caramel and yeasty aroma. Sweet caramel flavour
Aromas of caramel, marmalade, and almond. Taste is caramel, honey, and very bready.
Pours deep amber with a medium white head. Aromas are roasted malts, chocolate, caramel and grilled almonds. Low carbonation, medium body. Long sweet and alcoholic finish. Great doppelbock!
Aroma a malta dulce. Color tostado. Sabor a malta y caramelo, persistente. Muy recomendable.
Amber colored, heavy aroma of malts and caramel. Thick, sweet, low carbonation, low bitterness. Very malty. Good beer.

This beer is apparently right on track for its style, problem is I don’t much care for this style. Way too much abv making sessions unlikely, and drinking this beer is like drinking liquid bread. Works for some, just not me.

Bottle from We Brought Beer at Clapham Junction. Clear chestnut brown beer with an off white medium head. Nose is earthy, autumn leaves, toasted grain, grassy, slightly nutty. Taste is earthy slightly grassy and tangy hops, toasted malt, nutty, caramel, some slight menthol from the hop.

Bottle 50cl. Deep amber a.k.a. nutty brown, small frothy off-white head, mostly diminishing, almost no lacing; aroma roasted malts, caramel, dried plums, raisin, dates, licorice, bit vinous, juniper berry and laurel notes; taste light heavy sweet and light bitter, roasty, malty, toffee, fruity bites, with long duration, continues in the sweetbitter aftertaste, roasty and spicy notes, warming alcohol; full bodied, creamy to sticky texture, soft carbonation; a classic and solid Doppelbock.
Clear ruby color with white foam head. Sweet smell. The taste is a little sticky sweet and a bit gooey. The aftertaste is sweet. The whole beer is nice but not much more than that.

Bottle from World Market in Mountain View, CA. Aroma is red bananas, malts, chewy dark bread desserts. Taste is malty, sticky sweet, herbal and slightly bitter. Overall well-balanced, perhaps a bit malty sweet for me...but still enjoyable.
Smooth taste of roasted harps. Not filling but satisfying. Sweet but not overwhelming. A tasty double Bock.

25 Dec 2015, bottle. Dark amber, clear, some steady bubbles. nose is raisins and dark wheat bread, some alcohol. med body and moderately fizzy. yeasty, dark wheat bread, some alcohol, some bitter burnt malt and alcohol is slightly harsh. nice.
La doppelbock de chez Paulaner. Pas franchement désagréable cependant loin d’être transcendant.

Ciemno miedziane, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat słodowy, miodowy, lekko alkoholowy z nutą chmielu, tak w skrócie do pachnie po prostu piwem i jakoś tak się składa, że niemieckie piwa najbardziej mi przypominają w zapachu pierwsze piwa jakie piłem w życiu w latach dziewięćdziesiątych. W smaku także słodowe, miodowe, bardzo gładkie, alkohol niewyczuwalny, lekko ziołowe. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie bardzo dobre piwo, a jak na koncerniaka to wybitne, bardzo gładkie i ułożone, pijalne.
Thuis, uit een fles. Bitter gebrand kauwgombalzoetje. Alcoholisch. Backlog from 2015/08/16.

Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, malty, red fruits.
Appearance: clear amber color and nice beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, red fruits, some herbal notes, roasted malts, caramel, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Really good doppelbock.
Pours a rich red-brown from a bottle. Rich roasted caramel malts. Flavor is a nice slightly spicy caramel, good level of yeastiness, slightly bitter. Very good beer.

Flaske i grænsekiosk. Farven er rødbrun og skumkronen er tæt og flødefarvet. Aromaen er ristet malt og karamel. Smagen er ligeledes, men hertil kommer en smag af alkohol. Øllen er sødlig også i eftersmagen.
2014 bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden brown with an off-white head. Aroma and taste are extremely bready and yeasty with a solid malt backbone and some prune-like taste and smell.

500ml from Woodmans in the Falls. Amber brown pour with no head. Aroma has lemons, sweet malts, some grains. Taste is of bread, light rye, some fruit, sweet malts. Medium bodied with a touch of alcohol. Finishes sweet, fruity and doughy. Always solid for style. 13.6

Flasche 0,5l: Mahagoni, leichte Trübung, kräftiger Schaum; fruchtig frische Nase mit dunklen Früchte, Traubensaft, kräftige Malzigkeit, Röstaromen; im Körper kräftige Malzaromen, angenehme Bitterkeit, cremig, Kohlensäure, schöne Röstaromen, Milchkaffee, Mokkabohnen
I am no lager man and this is not an exception.The body was thin and the aromas weak.I will try this again because it might be out of date.

Aroma:


Sweet malts, brown sugar, wheat, caramel, dark fruits.




Appearance:


Amber/brown beer with a slight light brown head.




Taste/Palate:


Starts sweet with lots of malt and caramel, the sweetness subtly fades away and only the malts remain.

L: pours a murky brown-amber, highlights, like an oolong tea, small beige head. 
S: lovely raisins and fig, malty, slightly sweet, brown sugar, a hint of alcohol esters. 
T: warming malt base that rides from front to back, a little booze warmth with rich malt, sweeter than the nose but with a balancing bitterness. Lovely. 
F: nicely carbonated, medium-full bodied, easy mouthfeel that’s substantial yet slightly drying, inviting more sips. 
O: this always goes down really well. Cheap in Japan, warming, refreshing and full-tasting. Great stuff.

From a 330ml bottle on 28/11/2015. Pours a clear amber with a biggish head. The nose is mild but distinctly malty, with chocolate, caramel and toffee present. As expected the flavour is sweet and malty - caramel, toffee, rye bread and nuts, finishing with a very mild bitterness. Full bodied with slightly soft carbonation. Nice stuff.

This is probably my favorite overall beer. Malty, bready, sweet, delicious. To me, this is the ultimate in what a standard ale should taste like. Get it!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Plaisante. Une Doppelbock plutôt légère mais bien maîtrisée. Un bon petit caramel fumé. Sans grande originalité ni défaut. Édit : je regoute, assez aqueuse, plutôt fine, au bouquet des notes de pommes, légèrement poires confites. Agréable.

Deep amber, reddish color. White head, getting small soon. Aroma is malty, little alcohol, sweet. Body is on the heavier side, good maltcharacter. Caramel, bread, creamy. Heavy beer, typical for its style and pretty good.

Draft at Huppel. Pours hazy brown with a big off white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, sweet malt and a touch of overripe fruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
33cl bottle. Pours dark amber colour with small off white head. Light caramel aroma with noticeable alcohol, but still very drinkable. Very light bitter aftertaste.
Red/amber, medium head, clear. Aroma of alcohol and malt. Sweet, medium carbonation. Alcoholic bitterness.

Aroma: caramel, raisins, a little honey, a little alcohol (not offensive, helps break the sweetness).
 Appearance: pleasant brown, fairly strong tea; clear; head small and not for long.
 Taste: sweet, a little bitter; not exactly balanced, but the sweetness is broken.
 Palate: body full; carbonation average; finish more sweet than bitter. For 7,9%, the alcohol is reasonably well hidden; it’s still clearly there, though.
 Overall: I’m not too excited about the alcohol, but the beer’s nice, full, intensive, sweet, strong, and definitely enjoyable. Not in huge doses, I imagine, but quite fun once in a while.

50cl bottle at home. Pours a darkbrown colour with a nice beige head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, malts, slight coffee. Taste is malty sweet with notes of caramel, toffee, raisins. Texture is watery with average carbonation

Bright brown beer with a white head, medium carbonation.
Tastes malty, hoppy bitterness, caramel and alcohol.

Copper color, clean, with lively carbonation. Aroma caramel, toffe, raisins, honey, cloves and a hint of smoke in finish. Palate bit watery, alcohol quite present when warmed up. Aroma estery fruity, raisins, oak wood, caramel, spruce resin and salty umami/like finish. Balanced with low bitterness. Very decent malt heavy caramel brew with balanced characteristics. Enjoyed.

Bottle. Clear dark reddish amber colour with a medium off-white head, nose is malty and roasty with notes of banana, dark toffee, bread crust and honey, taste is sweet, roasty and slightly boozy with a roasty and medium dry finish.

Botella. @Mare Nostrum, Oviedo. 01/11/2015 BBD: 06/16
Color ámbar, aroma malta dulce, sabor caramelo, cuerpo alto.
Botella el 03/18. Agradable.

Aroma: sweet, caramel, toffee, alcohol.
Taste: sweet with some alcohol bitterness.
Flavour: caramel, toffee, alcohol, some fusel notes, some ethers.
Light bitterness in the aftertaste.

Generally I like Salvator but it was too hard drinkable at the rate date.
0,5l Flasche. Rötlich-braunes Bier mit kleiner beiger Schaumkrone. Geschmack nach Caramel, Kaffee und Röstmalzen.
Amber with a small off white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, toffee apple, medium body, texture is oily and thins out. Finish is balanced with a light bitter short ending.

Sjov og anderledes mørk øl. Tynd - lidt vandet - fornemmelse er min førstehåndsindtryk. Den første tredjedel af øllet var jeg skuffet - men må indrømme, at smagen bliver bedre og bedre. Heldigvis, for eftersmagen er meget lang. Kraftig karamel/kaffe agtig smag. Mørk mørk.
cereal, coffe and caramel aroma, amber, clear, beige foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, taste like it smells , medium body, average carbonation, slightly bitter aftertaste, Good beer

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours clear mahagon with brief yellowish head. Aroma is sweetish, toffee, dark berries, caramel, hay, hints of milk chocolate.Taste is sweetish, hay, caramel, toffee, slight alcohol. medium body. A bit watery. Sweetish finish.
Bastante encorpada, aromática e saborosa. Lembra as Ales inglesas porém mais robusta. Cerveja excelente!
enregistrement personnel - à tester à nouveau pour affiner la note et le commentaire
Muito boa cerveja! Forte! 7,9% ! Reconfortante ! Vale muito a degustação! Cerveja para os fortes

Niska, sycząca piana, szybko opadająca do zera. Barwa miedziana, klarowna. Aromat likierowy, słodowy, karmelowy, w tle delikatna dębina, stare drewno. W smaku bardzo podobnie, jest półsłodko, nieco melanoidyn, karmelu, czuć wysłużoną dębową beczkę, delikatna głogowo-alkoholowa goryczka w kontrze oraz nuty likieru rozgrzewającego przełyk. W posmaku suszona morela, rodzynka i cierpkie taniny. Nagazowanie średnie do niskiego, szczypiące. Pełne odczucie w ustach, oleista tekstura, dość mdłe, ciężkie i słodowe.

Red amber coloured beer with a short-lasting off-white head. Aromas of dark bread, earthy potatoes, caramel, alcohol, herbs, fruits preserved in rum, cherry schnaps, some spices. Roast malt and fruit schnaps in taste. Overall warming. Fizzy carbonation, creamy texture, medium body.

Smooth taste of roasted harps. Not filling but satisfying. Sweet but not overwhelming. A tasty double Bock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It is in my opinion, a beer appearing more to be a kind of smoked beer. There is a nice balance between hop and sweet malt. We could feel a bit the caramel or sugar. Neverthless I could not drink this beer all the night and it is a nice beer to finish a night.

amazing amazing amazing amazing amazing,......yhsskkddksj
............................
Sweet n malty.. Caramel and a strange herbal sweetness to it. Warming and a bit boozy. Mid carbonation. Palate is sticky molasses, apples  and brandy. Pretty heavy stuff. Love this one.

Bottle from Crafty Dog. A spicy bock, slight sweet tone to it, possibly after letting it sit. Caramel, wheat, barley and malt. Flavorful malt character. Kudos. Keeps it basic but memorable, also disguises the strength well.

The color is beautiful dark amber and the head is sparse, but 7.9% alcohol is generally not overwhelming foamy. The taste is sirup with lovely pleasant roasted malt notes. Light sweet fruit notes mingle well with dark overwhelming caramel. It is a malty beer, which has a crisp and leak volume.
Hints of vanilla, scotch, malty. Rather light color and body for a Doppelbock.
Pours dark red with a white head. Aromas of malt and sweetness. Caramel, earthy, butterscotch, vanilla. Nice beer. Very complex flavor. Very nice beer.

Kein besonders guter Doppelbock. Mahagonifarben und somit erstaunlich hell. Im Aroma Karamell, extrem malzig, kein Hopfen im Aroma.Auch im Geschmack "recht hell". Karamell, Toffee, süßes Malz, vielleicht ein wenig Röstmalz, Alkoholnote. Insgesamt okay, aber nichts besonderes.

330 ml bottle. Very beautiful amber color with natural fermentaton gas. Sweet smell of caramel. Good sensation in the mouth, with ending complex. Hoppines in the mouth has well and very astringent. Would try again, but with a little more push in the flavour would have been perfect.

From bottle. Dark amber color with off white head. Malty aroma, and light yeasty, fruity, caramel, bready. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with the addition of hoppy notes. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation
Pint 9 oz. bottle. Pours amber with creamy off white head. Aroma of toasted malts. Taste sweet, malty and delicious.

33cl bottle. This is a sticky, thick reddish-brown doppelbock with much of alcohol warming. Taste isn’t alcoholic, rather malty with some black currant and other black fruits. Light hop at the end. Good beer, but i don’t like doppelbocks. :)

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Pooler, GA. This is a mahogany colored beer with a fairly large white head. Has an aroma of malt, fruit and maybe some cocoa. The taste is big malt with some fruit, very good. This is a very good beer, highly recommended.
Caoba turbio y espuma color crema ligera. Aromas de fruta confitada, frutos secos y avellana. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce afrutado y sabor de avellana y frutos secos.

On tap. Intensità olfattiva elevata. Persistenza olfattiva discreta. Il cappello è di schiuma compatta, aderente e persistente, a bollicine fini e di media quantità. La frizzantezza è con bollicine fini, a bassa ma vivace carbonazione. Il colore tende al rosso. Il corpo si presenta strutturato. L’aroma alla lingua è decisamente amaro, con un gran senso di saporito. L’intensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è deliziosamente lunga. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate e di amaro. Il finale è amarognolo, lungo, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso e persistente, con alcol presente ma non invasivo. Questa è una birra che risalta per il gusto veramente piacevole e di grande soddisfazione.

Bottle 0,33.
Dark amber color. Medium body. Caramel aroma. Taste: warming, some alcohol, caramel. Good beer.

Pours a clear amber brown color, topped with a decent tan colored head. Malty aroma, quite roasty with some mild caramel. A hint of alcohol. Taste is sweet and malty, some caramel and fruity feel, but also some a bit unpleasant alcohol presence. Fairly full and strong, not really what I’d prefer.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange-brown with a rocky cream head that collapses to a ring. Aromas of crusty bread, burnt orange, raisins and fresh plum. Taste starts out with sweet malt and raisins before a firm orange zest and pepper bitterness washes through. Some fresher fruit flavours and warming alcohol towards the end. Sweet malty aftertaste. Nice one.

Strong aroma of malt, bread, earth, grapes and other fruits. Pours clear red or dark amber liquid with a frothy, soft white head. Medium bitterness and light sweetness, also some umami. Flavour of dark malt and some bitter hops as well as liquorice, grapes, dark fruit, bread and coffee beans. Medium body with a creamy texture and average carbonation with a somewhat bitter finish. This is a good Doppelbock, the alcohol isn’t too astringent and the dark, roasty malt balances the bitterness very well, but also gives it a nice and dark flavour.
Amber brown pour, tall tan head, good retention, fairly sticky but little to no lace. Dark malt and plum nose. Rich toffee malt taste, fairly sweet. some alcohol is present, dark fruit as well.
Sarkynortherner 3K Yorkshire Day tasting; clear burnished amber pour with a thin beige head, red berry aroma, with some sweet malts, taste has sweet molasses, some wood action, dark fruits.

Sarkynorthener 3k Yorkshire day tasting. Bottle shared thanks to s_hartshorne, cheers Shane. Dark Amber beer with small head. Aroma of caramel, malts and spice. Taste is caramel, spice, malts and toffee. Good.

Bottle sarkynorthner3kyorkshiredaytasting. Amber decent white head. Aroma is caramel malts. Taste dark malts toffee fruits good long bitter finish some alcohol. Ok body. Very tasty for dopplebock not watery like most. Good stuff.
Amber-brown color, very small yellow head. Aroma of caramel, malt, roasted malt, brown sugar. Taste sweet, caramel, dried fruit, alcohol warm.

Pours caramel brown hue with an off white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: malty, caramel, roasty, molasses, toffee, floral hops, slight spice and honey. TASTE: malty, caramel, roasty, molasses, toffee, spice, herbal hops, lightly boozy and honey. AFTER TASTE: malty, spice, caramel and hop bitterness with an oily lightly spicy finish.

Aroma is roasty malts with deep caramel, honey, molasses, caramel and toffee. Taste is exactly like the aroma. Deep malt flavor. Light earthy hop finish. Appearance is a clear dark amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.
Colore ambrato scuro, profumo di malti caramellati. Sapore di malto, malto caramellato, leggermente tostato e astringente, intenso. Corposa e forte, buona.
Frukt och metall. Inte SB vafan tror ni ?, flaska. Aromen frukt och sprit och meteallica. Mäktig och vad man förväntar sig av Paulaner.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnomiedziana, zmętnione. Piana drobna, wysoka, krótka.

AROMAT: Dosyć intensywny. Bardzo dużo przypalonego karmelu połączonego z nie mniejszą ilością alkoholu. W tle słody.

SMAK: Słodowe. posmak przypalonego karmelu. Słodkie. Mocno alkoholowe.
Flaske. Klar lys karamellfarget. Moderat karvonert med tynn skumtopp. Smaker malt,karamell, urter,frukt, butterscotch,krydder. God dobbelbock

0,5 l Flasche. Rotbraunes Bier, cremefarbener, kurzlebiger Schaum. Aroma nach Röstmalz, Bitterschokolade und vergorenen Früchten, leicht säuerlich, leicht alkoholisch, Geschmack nach Röstmalz, Bitterschokolade, leichte Kaffeenote, leicht bitter. Alkoholischer, leicht bitterer Nachgeschmack. Ersttest: 5/3/4/3/8, Zweittest: Bierverkostung im Bierweltweit, Siegburg, 17.11.2017. Bockbiere. Bier #7. 5/4/6/4/12 (Wertung: Mittelwert mit Rundung in Richtung Zweittest)

Rich amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of smoky malt, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, dark fruit, caramel, and some chocolate; Warm alcohol finish; Nicely balanced; Not as rich as other double-bocks - but good overall.

Bottle BBE: 10/15. Lightly-chilled. Pours a clear ruby red body with negligible head. Ripe banana, flour, bubble gum and a little sherry on the nose. To taste: a heavy sweetness counteracted by a moderate sourness and only a slight bitterness. A full-medium body with a slick, oily texture, low-medium carbonation and a lasting finish. The Paulaner description is pretty spot on - this beer is characterized by its malty nature. Maybe not as complex as a Belgian dubbel, but this is a classic in its own right.

Bottle: 10/15 code date. Appearance: Clear ruby red/brown, with a thick khaki foam head. 
Aroma: Toasted bread crust, figs, raisins, dark cherries
Taste: Rich bready, toasted, chocolate malt. Very fruity, with notes of figs and cherries. Multiple layers of flavor here. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body and moderate mouthfeel, with an underlying alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Leaves a warm toasted breadiness on the palate. 
Overall: A world class doppelbock. Rich malt breadiness and fruity character, that leaves you feeling warm.

@ Kallithea Beach, Rhodes 150708. Bottle (330 ml) from Carrefour. Malty, caramely and fruity with dried fruits, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter, sweet and caramely with dried fruits.

Redish-amber-brown colour with a frothy light beige head and good lacings. Aromas of bread, hay, toffee, bit earthy notes with a light floral-raisin impression develop. Softly carbonated with a slick texture and a full body. Leaning towards the malty sweet side yet allowing to let some hop spiceyness show through. Lasting finish.
Murky orange with soft beige head. Sweet currant and brown sugar nose. Dense dried fruit with some warming alcohol and bready flavours. Perfect winter sipper. The doppelbock benchmark for me.

330ml bottle into glass. Spicy fruit malt nose. Cloudy dark orange beer with small creamy head. Light spritzy mouthfeel with oily texture. Malt backbone gives way to dark fruits and alcohol. It’s like a good rich Christmas cake. Excellent beer, really delicious.

330ml bottle. About 9 degrees Celsius. Mid brown hue with very slight reddish tinge. One and a half fingers of tightly laced beige head which held well. Immediate toffee and caramel aroma which is very strong. Flavour is intense, matches aroma and lingers long after the last mouthful has gone. Very sweet upfront with minimal bitterness in the end, yet balanced - perhaps by the strength of the alcohol. Good mouth feel, plenty of weight with enough carbonation to even out the flavour. Great beer, had to have a second, but intense enough to be satisfied at that. Much stronger, in every sense to the other dopplebocks brewed in and around Australia (that I have tried so far). Special on its own, fantastic when paired with robust food to contrast the intensity and sweetness.

The doppelbock style was one that took me a long time to grow accustomed to, but now that I “get” the style I really enjoy it and the best examples are a nice treat. Paulaner Salvator was one of the first authentic German examples of the style I ever had. I thought it was good when I first tried it, but six years later I realize it’s more than just good - it’s a classic.



I poured a 500ml bottle into a mug. It had a best before date of 5/2015 and cost $2.79 ($0.17 per ounce).



Appearance: Hazy/foggy appearance. Rusty burgundy hue. Pours to a one-finger, tan, soapy head which mostly dissipates and leaves no lacing.



Smell: Strong rich malty aroma with plenty of confectionery notes. A hint of alcohol and slight cider-like character (probably an old bottle).



Taste: If there’s any style known for being a “malt bomb,” Paulaner Salvator is it. From the first impression of the first sip it’s all malt-dominate. Strong, sweet, delicious flavors of toffee and caramel right away with milder notes of toast and milk chocolate towards the back. Bitterness is dry and perhaps a tad spicy (most likely Noble hops are used in this brew). I detect a hint of mulled cider-like character towards the finish. This might be due to the bottle being old or it might just be natural melanoidins. Alcohol gives the palette some intensity, but adds little as far as flavor or distraction. Overall, a very tasty beer that would be fantastic when fresh.



Drinkability: At 7.9% ABV, Paulaner Salvator is a big beer to be sure. The mouthfeel is surprisingly comfortable, though. Soft in weight and smooth in texture with intense flavor that’s not abrasive. There is significant warmth from the alcohol, but this is by no means an obese or obtuse brew. A liquid meal in and of itself, though it would pair with Easter dinner for sure.

A dark red color with a beige cream, good training and medium to high duration.
The aroma is of espresso, roasted malt, nuts, cloves, bitter chocolate and some fruity denoting a certain sweetness.
Clove flavor at the beginning leaves a very pleasant feeling, which then immediately shows the caramel, good strong coffee being hugged by chocolate bitterness. The sweetness of fruity is revealed with shades of plum and very, very light banana flavor. Admittedly, the black bread is present in this explosion of flavors, syrups, and as the malty. In this way the alcohol emerges without compromising the set.
Silky texture, oily, shown with a bitter sweet touch that persists in the aftertaste.
A good amount of bitterness faithful to the style, great Doppelbock.
A great beer and maintained tradition.
