Premetto, la mia doppelbock preferita, tra quelle che si trovano in commercio, è la Samichlaus. Quindi per me è lei che fissa i parametri di una "buona" doppelbock. Capisco che la scelta potrà risultare estrema e forse anche grezza, ma per i miei gusti così è.
La Salvator quindi è buona; ottimo colore ambrato scuro, buona la schiuma (anche troppa...), aroma debole ma non ci si aspetterebbe niente di più.
Soddisfacente il corpo, anche se per arrivare allo "sciroppo" della eggenberg ce ne vuole.
Sapori dolciastri di malto si accomunano a note tostate. Buono anche il grado alcolico, alto ma non invadente.
Per essere un prodotto completamente industriale, mi soddisfa comunque bene. ---------------- I state, my favorite doppelbock, including those that are on the market, is the Samichlaus. So for me it is she who sets the parameters of a "good" doppelbock. I understand that the choice will be extreme and perhaps even crude, but for my taste it is.
The Salvator is so good; very dark amber color, good foam (also too much ...), faint aroma but you would not expect anything more.
Satisfying the body, although to get to the "syrup" of eggenberg it takes.
Sweetish malt flavors are common to a toasty. Good also the alcohol content, high but not intrusive.
To be a completely industrial, I still meets well.

Butelka 0.5l do 01.10.2015r. Aromat dosyć skormny, słodowy, bardzo delikatny, jednak są w nim takie żeśkie nuty. Piana beżowa, średnio pęcherzykowa, obfita, ale szybko ginie praktycznie do zera. Nie oblepia szkła. Kolor bardzo ciemnej pmarańczy, może delikatnie miedziany do tego. W smaku niestety ale czuć trochę alkohol, co dla mnie jest wadą. Do tego słodowość i ogólna gładkość. Gorycz jest, ale na drugim planie. Czuć też delikatną słodycz. Nasycenie średnie. Pijalne, ale spodziewałem się czegość ciekawszego.

200 ml on tap. Dark orange/light brown, pretty clear, with an average, fluffy and persistent yellow-ish head. Very inviting aroma, nutty and earthy, notes of toffee, caramel malts, almost ashy/smoky in the background. No alchool smell at all. Perfect level of bitterness, quite rich tasting, obviously malty. Toasted and caramel forward aftertaste. Perhaps some dark fruits as well. Way less sweet than the aroma indicated. Average carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Not a big fan of the style, but it’s certainly great.
Une doppelbock relativement légère en corps et alcool.Ronde, douce, un poil acide, maltée et épicée, légèrement torréfiée et plutôt désaltérante.

11.2 oz bottle The Doppelbock poured a hazy amber with small head and no lacing. This was one the twelve beers of Christmas 2014. The aroma of sweet caramel malts greet you. The bock had a medium body with light carbonation. Nice warming alcohol. My beer taste have focused more on beers with higher IBUs. The taste of sweet roasted malts stays till the last swallow. The finish is sweet and clean.

500ml bottle. pours an extremely cloudy, hazy amber with 1cm thick head. aroma is oak, smoky bacon, yeast and nuts. taste is roasted malts, some oak and toast. really nice and the alcohol is well hidden.

I may be biased but I love this Dopplebock. This is probably the first of my ’Best Beers’. Probably 15 years ago, and I really haven’t found a better standard. I loved it then when I found it and love it now after years of tasting new beers.

 It’s probably the heaviest ’alcohol’ tasting bock I’ve had but I like that. I don’t think it’s too much, but you’ll notice it.

 I found Spaten Optimator and Full Sail (90 day) Bock (Bock on box and Dopplebock on label ;) ) to be fairly similar in taste, but each getting less alcohol taste as listed.

Number 5 in our doppelbock blind tasting. Pours a light orange-read with modest head but abundant carbonation. Alcohol is way too forward (hard to believe this is less than 8%) and that totally ruins it for me.

A great doppelbock. Pours a hazy, dark amber with a thin, dense beige head. The aroma is malty with big toffee, nutty caramel malts and earthen notes. Alot of yeast flavour with fruity notes of apple and pear combining with the sugary malt. A rich and heavy flavour with a warm, boozy finish and slight bitterness. Overall, a good heavy brew great for a cold or rainy day.
Tap@kerho. Red color and small head. Mild aroma with hints of caramel and malt. A bit sweet taste with long malty aftertaste. Flavors of malt, caramel, toffee.

Color marrón oscuro. Espuma no muy persistente. El aroma es muy suave, de maltas. Sabor dulce de maltas, frutas maduras, algo de alcohol. El final es ligeramente amargo, con un toque de regaliz. Buena doppelbock. Muy bebible.

Piana średnio obfita, głównie średnio pęcherzykowa, raczej nietrwała, kolor lekko beżowy. Barwa piwa rubinowa, klarowna. Koronka uboga. Dominuje aromat palonego słodu, odrobina karmelu. W smaku gorzkie, mocno palone, jest jakaś słodycz gdzieś z tyłu, którą ciężko mi zdefiniować. Goryczka ściągająca, lekko zalegająca. Na języku szerokie, wysycenie średnie. Lekko czuć alkohol.

pours a perfectly clear light brown colour with a white head. light malty aroma but not very prominent. Very malty taste, hint of liquorice. very rich. Not as heavy as I was expecting and SO easy to drink!! Fantastic beer

330ml bottle at home in a tulip glass. The aroma was toffee and fruit. The flavour is sweet malt and yet lightly sour at the same time. The hops are in the background, but noticeable in their light bitterness. A very good dopplebock.
0.5l bottle drank at home. Dark colour. White head. First impression : soft, sweet, lightly bubble. Very nice beer!
Bottle. Cloudy, amber, rocky head, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, & long finish.

Not an ordinary doppelbock! In tulip glass, real orange red colour, clear, like rose wine from Bandol, onion water. Wonderfull strong palate, you can feel alcohol more then in many much stronger beers. Fast disappearing head. Possible to drink almost everyday, which is not the characteristic of that kind of beer. Absolutely delicous aftertaste. I repeat, color is unique.

Exercice profitable que de reprendre une bière après plusieurs années, quand on a une vue plus complète sur le style qui la concerne, et surtout un exemplaire plus âgé.
Mais cette bière m'inquiétait depuis quelque temps, et plus de 3 ans après, je la reprends à la base,
avec l'appui d'un Padawan qui passe prochainement au stade de "rater".
Malts pils et munich. Houblonnage en herkules, taurus et hallertau tradition.
Niveau abv de 7,9 %, pour 18,3° plato.
Mon exemplaire était à 3 mois après sa date.
Couleur ambré aux reflets cuivrés très jolis et à la clarté nette.
Bulles fines, en fontaine centrale virevoltante.
Mousse beige, soyeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de pruneau, fruits confits, abricot, pointe de banane, malt cara.
1ère bouche très souple à l'ensemble entre fruits et malts bien intégrés.
Arrière-bouche harmonieuse sur le même groupe de saveurs.
2ème un peu plus sur le candi, caramel et banane.
Arrière-bouche très équilibrée, fruitée.
3ème qui n'accuse plus son problème de jeunesse qui la trouvait désorganisée.
Nous avons grâce à l'âge une bouche bien construite, avec les saveurs du vrai doppelbock qui se
poursuivent.
Arrière-bouche très riche, avec même des nuances de whisky jeune (speyside 3 à 4 ans).
La longueur continue sur cette lancée pour nous donner plein de belles choses, et du pain liquide, comme il se doit !! Elle harmonise complètement l'ensemble.
Jambes fines, très longues.
Levure souple, très belle.
Alcool correct et conforme, il met l'accent où il le faut.
Finale parfaitement relevée.
CONCLUSION : je suis très content d'avoir pu retester ce doppelbock, avec de l'âge (lui et moi ..).
Cette bière me chagrinait depuis longtemps, et je suis content d'avoir trouvé sa vraie valeur.
Pours a brown colour, taste is malty, quite sweet and oily on the palate, good, but the reputation is bigger than the beer

Pours a caramel amber with a head that instantly disappears. Only knock to the aroma is it could be a little stronger: caramel, roasty, floral, dough, super light soy sauce. Palate is wonderful with just a little stickiness in the corner of the mouth. Difficult to stop at just one!

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours dark brown with red highlights and one finger off white head. Typical doppelbock smell, sweet roasted malt, prunes and alcohol. Tastes a little boozy with notes of prunes, roasted malt, raisins and sweet malt. Finishes moderately dry. Palate is creamy without being thick. Very good beer, had before, will have again.
0,5l Bottle. Clear, light brown color with a head that disappears quickly. Smells malty. The taste is pretty sweet with a slight bitter aftertaste. Low carbonation. Overall a good Doppelbock.

rood/bruin met schuimige wit/gele kraag. aroma is die van een hoop caramel en mout een redelijk typisch Duits aroma. smaken zijn redelijk zoet, zwak bitter, fruitig van donkere fruiten, banaan, wat rozijn. caramouten, iets pittigs (peper?), maar de caramel en de zoetigheid overheersen op een clean/lean mout basis zoals zovele Duitse bieren. medium body, dun en glad van textuur, lage co2. afdronk zoetig en kruidig. mwah

33cl bottle, hazy dark amber color, small beige head, caramel aroma, raisins, roasted and honey notes, brown sugar sweet flavor, full body, finish with caramel and grass, very nice surprise I thought it was a simple and cheap beer (0.99€). In pratica pensavo di aver preso una birra ignorante da scolare guardando un paio di puntate di south park e invece mi trovo una dolciona che sembra un blend tra una belga e una stout. E beh. Se ste doppelbock son tutte come questa ne voglio altre.
Absolutely delicious. Luckily it is 7.9% and the alcohol is noticeable or I’d drink more of these! Very good heavy malty flavors and good nutty malty roasty aroma. Nice brew all around.

500cc Bottle. I call this one the benchmark of dopplebocks. Light brown to orange with a nice white off thin head that dissipaste quickly. Aroma is cereal, lots of caramel and a light noble hops presence. The body is medium with medium carbonation. Sweet but with some bitterness ( for the style). Very good overall dopplebock.
Nice brown colour with beige head. Nice malty sweet aroma. The taste is sweet malts with warming alcohol.

Amber colour, lasting beige head. Intense aroma of bubblegum, banana, caramel, alcohol, raisins and plums. Starts off slightly sweet, to give way to some unexpected bitterness, with some burnt notes. Finishes with a malty and alcoholic aftertaste. The body is rather heavy, yet smooth. Quite a complex beer, one of the better ones I’ve had so far.

(Bottle) This is a tough one to rate. There’s very little aroma and it’s not very attractive. The taste is really nice but maybe slightly too sugary sweet? I do like it and I think it’s a pretty nice beer, but I feel like it’s missing some dark malt bitterness.

12 oz. bottle from BevMo. Brown-orange color with a pillowy head. The aroma is molasses, brown sugar and toast. No floral hop presence. Just richness, sweet and balanced against the alcohol. Complex, yet subtle, the flavor is dark raisins, burnt coffee, hazelnuts and root beer with an earthy undertone. Slick feel, oily and very smooth with a neutral finish. Paulaner’s got this. Pretty definitive.

Seriously unexpected bubblegum aroma. Are the hops coming out to play on this Doppel? Beautiful malt. Rather ugly to look at, soapy beige. A rather fine beer. I guess they perfected it >100 years ago, so why mess with it. A nice beverage, but plenty of room for it to be a better beer, regardless of style. Nicely dry for a 8% doppel. This would have been epic in the 1900s.

Bottle from Trinkgut in Goch. The beer has dark brown/red color and a nice cream colored head with a lot of bubbles. The aroma is malty, with tones of dark fruits, roasted malts and the sweetness of caramel. The taste is light sweet with tones of chocolate and a little alcohol which makes it really intense. Further tones of roasted malts and some hop notes in the end. The finish is warming by the alcohol and to change in a nice bitterness from the used hops. Wonderfull this doppelbock, one of the best so far.

Bottle. Pours brown with orange hues and white head. Aroma is floral, nutty, cereal, grains, vanilla, fruity, earthy, figs. Taste is medium-bodied, silky, smooth, easy, low carbonation, a bit dirty, bitter finish. Overall, good.

Beautiful brown color with beige foam. Molasses, nuts and cloves in the aroma, very intense. Taste is heavily sweet and spicy. Heavy body and smooth mouthfeel. Very boozy and with a warming finish. Has that special sirupy feeling. Not bad, but I prefer other Doppelbocks. I think this might turn out well when you let it age though.

Beautiful red brown beer. Clear with a big white head.
Smell is lots of caramel with subtle pepper, leather. Hint of alcohol.
Taste is rotten fruit sweetness with a bitter finish. Bread, dough. Fizzy.

Syrupy, molasses brown-orange color. Fluffy meringue of pillowy head. 

The aroma is molasses and brown sugar; toffee. Not a lot of hop presence. Very sugary, but it is balanced beautifully by a nuttiness. It’s mild in the nose but good.

The flavor is dark raisins, burnt coffee, hazelnut, root beer. Tons of flavor. At the finish, it’s very pronounced dates, with an earthy undertone to them, as if they were just plucked from the earth.

Slick feel, oily and very smooth; slides right down the gullet, but has a chalky finish afterward. This is the best Paulaner beer I can remember having: it’s dark, nutty, and challenging.

From the bottle. Aroma is caramel, chocolate bread, and malty maltness. Pours brown with a nice white sticky head. Taste is malty bread, chocolate, toffee and sugar. Nice sweet thick mouthfeel without being syrup. Still one of the best.
Mahoganymörk med lite skum. Smakar maltig, lite söt kola. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång karamell, lite alkoholanstruken. Mkt lite kolsyra gör den lättdrucken. OK.

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass to drink. The beer had a very cloudy and hazy deep amber-brown color with an average-sized, slightly creamy off-white head with average retention, lacing, and cling. Its aroma had a lively blend of dark fruits with raisins and plums, along with some caramel malt, barley, and bits of grain and yeast. The taste was somewhat sweet and fruity with notes of raisin and caramel, along with a sour grainy effect and touches of hops. The beer had a pretty thick and full mouthfeel with a heavy body and a noticeable presence of alcohol, and had fairly high carbonation and fizz.
Alcoholic, tart and stingy at first but the brew grows on you, displaying a rich and complex fruity flavor on top a full, thick body. Warming.

Pours dark brownih-redish hue. Very poor head from this bottle. Malty and sweet on the nose. Flavour sweet to start, then bitterness kick in with roastiness, finishes well, still a little bit sweet, but with balanced bitterness. Alcohol present in flavour and aroma, but still pretty well hidden for the abv. Great beer..

October 28, 2014 ..
Bottle, 330ml, tasted 100ml poured into improper glass. Pours lovely dark reddish copper color, head is very tall and very dense with a beige color and a lovely mouth feel with sweetish taste. Aroma of sweet fruits, dried fruit and caramel malt. Carbonation is flat, body is full and very smooth. Taste is mostly sweet with almost no bitterness nor sourness. Flavors are of ripe fruits, bread, strong dark malt, caramel, dried fruits, biscuit, butter, strawberry, savoriness, some light warm spices. Alcohol is well hidden. Warming. Good flavors with great texture and mouth feel thanks to the combination of good thick body and long lasting dense head. Taste is flat sweetness, which is a little boring and might get cloying in larger servings. Over all, very good.
.. 6/5/6/3/17=3.7
..
Aug 6, 2020 ..
Tap, 250 ml. Aroma of caramel malts, fruity, dry plums, grain. Gentle but tangy carbonation. Body is a little thick, a bit syrupy-sticky. Taste sweet, slight sharp bitterness, some acidity. Feels a bit unbalanced at first, but it grows on you quickly, as you re-calibrate to the bold taste. At that point it tastes nice, a little sweet, good bitterness. Flavors comes through, caramel ,alt, maybe toffee, dried plums, grain, sugar, hints of citrus, no much hops. OK+
.. 7/4/6/2/16=3.5

12 oz bottle. Pours a reddish/ brown color with a short lived beige head. Nose of toffee/ caramel/ fruits and malt. Taste follows and I just can’t get past the sweetness. All raisins and grapes with caramel notes. But probably right for the style. Pretty yeasty. Somewhat slick/creamy/ round mouthfeel. Some bitter notes at the end, but just ok overall.
Braun, wenig Schaum. In der Nase Karamellnoten, dunkle Früchte. Am gaumen dunkle Früchte, Hefe, leicht herb, an ein belgisches Dubbel erinnerned minus die typischen belgischen Hefen. Gut.

Appearance with amber color (dark), cloudy liquid and big and dense head. 
Aroma of roasted malt. 
In the mouth it is sweet, bitter, alcoholic and with a dry finish. 
It is a great beer... for anytime!
"compared to the KING... Celebrator...this beer is lacking, but on it’s own it’s a pretty good, sweet and aromatic malty brew. enjoyable and drinkable, pairs well with meat and game."

500ml bottle served in a Weizen glass.
A: Beautiful slightly cloudy dark amber colour forming a huge and aired beige head when poured. Low retention and only few lacings left
S: Really good in the nose. Sweet and fruity. Very strong smell of toffee and caramel with notes of caramel malts and grapes. Yeasts and alcohol in the end
T: As the nose. Impressive. Toffee, caramel malts and grapes. Yeasts and hops. Good hoppy bitterness too. Upfront is slightly sweet. End is considerably bitter. Well balanced
M: Medium to heavy body. Sweet upfront and quite bitter end. Medium to low carbonation and almost no alcohol considering the reasoable ABV
O: Good drinkability which is a bit compromised by the sweetness. A good Paulaner specimen anyway...
[ BA Review @ 9/11/2010 ]
Enjoyed this, one of the rare German styles that I can put up with. Quite sweet though moreish, enjoy this on a colder night.

Clear rock candy brown / syrup-coloured, flowing thinly with yellow, airy foam. Smells slightly yeasty, with some malt. The taste contains malt, some brown liquor and a whiff of oil - unsophisticated strong beer which is not much to write home about. "Spesialität aus München", they say, but they know better than this.
Bottle. Pours chestnut brown with an off white head. Aroma: a bit muted. Taste: caramel, chestnut, roast, baked apples. Fairly thin but with a lasting finish.
Pours a copper color. Caramel and wheat aroma/ Medium bodied with flavors of caramel malt, wheat and hops. Good beer from a Paulaner variety pack.

Dark copper with a nice, soapy head. Heavy roasted malts in the nose. Flavor is also heavy on the malts and some spiced apples and butterscotch lingering. A beer I loved when I first had it several years ago and it’s just as good as I remember.

Noch eine Wiederbegegnung: der Paulaner Salvator war vor knapp 30 Jahren mein erstes Bockbier, und ich kann mich gut erinnern, daß mich damals eher die Wirkung als der Geschmack beeindruckte. - Flasche (50 cl) von Getränke Hoffmann, Berlin. - Kupferrot, leicht trüb; feinporiger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase warmes, schweres, süßes Karamelmalz, dumpfe Herbe und eine doppelbocktypische fuselige Note. - Antrunk schwer malzsüß mit viel Karamel, Sahnebonbon, Rosinen und Toastbrot. Dahinter eine etwas leere Bittere. Feinere Hopfenaromen sucht man vergebens - hier wurde mit Hopfenextrakt gearbeitet. Nicht zu rezent, vollmundig. Der Abgang ist dumpf hopfenbitter, etwas holzig aber wenig aromatisch, mit etwas schroffem Nachhall und unangenehm fuseligem Alkohol. - Recht simpler, auf den Gegensatz von breiter Malzigkeit und derber Bittere reduzierter Doppelbock, etwas holzschnittartig aber noch genießbar. Ganz brauchbar als Einstieg in die Bockbier-Saison. Danach darf es dann etwas besseres sein ...
One of my favorite styles, and this is a fine specimen. Solid malt flavor. A bit of alcohol heat.

330 ml bottle. Copper red color with a big rocky beige head. Nice lacing. Rich caramel malt aroma is buttery and enticing. Flavor is sweet roasted malt with notes of toffee, baked apple and raisins. Chewy mouthfeel. Spicy dry herbal hop finish. This arguably one of the best Doppelbocks in the world. A must have.
Color cobre. Cabeza de media duración. Aroma a caramelo, malta tostada, lijeramente metálico. Cuerpo completo, dulzon. Postgusto amargo.

Cor caramelo, espuma persistente, turva.
Aroma forte de banana, caramelo e malte.
Gosto adocicado no começo, caramelo, banana, malte forte, lúpulo no final com leve amargor. Encorpada com final seco.

Excelente doppelbock.

Hazy red copper, minimal orange head. Roasted malts, cereals, caramel, burnt honey. Fulfilling caramelized malts, dry passito with alcohol, burnt caramel, light toffee. Quite complex, yet well balanced.

Nose is banana, malt, slight lactose, slight butter. Taste is caramel, leading to brown sugar and malt, dark fruits, slight mint, bread, touch of honey, dry, bready oak finish. Mouthfeel is a little thin.


Coming back to this after a year is a treat and much nicer than my memory.

Bottiglia, colore ambrato carico con un cappello di schiuma fine e persistente, l’aroma ha caramello e malto, al palato uguale, l’alcool non da mai fastidio e la birra scende giù facilmente, niente male

Deep hazy orangeish brown, fairly dark, with a creamy tan head.
It has strong touch od alcohol with malty finish.
Medium bodied and smooth.

0.5L bottle. Pours clear red with a fluffy, off-white head that lingers. Some different aromas on this: caramel, butterscotch, overripe banana, Medium sweetness at beginning that grows into the middle flavor profile. Flavors of cough drop, bready malt, vanilla. Finishes with fairly pronounced roasted malt bitterness to balance of the sweetnes, leaving cloying sugars. Full body with average carbonation and a thick mouthfeel. Overall, a tasty brew! Interesting aroma profile, and nice complexity to flavors as well.
Grande birra, nella sua semplicità con il.lievito a farla da padrone decisamente. E va bene così

In short: Sweet strong beer.
Aroma is to soft malts, taste is sweet-caramel, thick aftertaste. Is like a drinkable version of a dubbel.

Bottle at home. Pours a deep, dark amber colour with a medium, beige, creamy head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, dried fruit, wood and apples. The flavour follows up with more sweet malt, milk chocolate, leather and some roastedness. Has a rich and slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A well-balanced, sweet and delicious classic.

Aroma: Liquid malt, special: rubber glove. Appearance: Brown/Amber/caramel, decent foam. Taste: Alcohol can be felt quite noticeably, mellow, average carbonation, very malty, some caramel and dry wood flavors.
Aroma is quite weak. Reddish, clear. Medium sweet. Little bitter. Nice and drinkable. But slight metallic taste spoils it a bit.
Sweet malty aroma slightly caramel like. Strong in taste bit thin and even boozy. Almost no bitterness. Aftertaste is too much alcohol like,strong.

Pleasant surprise! Intense toasted caramel malt background, quite fruity, plums, berries, bit yeasty. Feels very smooth, bit oily, light alco kick. Well balanced, highly drinkable, dangerous thirst quencher due to ABV. But I like it and price/performance very nice
Spicey, a bit chilli, caramel, coffee. Aroma - caramel, malts. Decent beer!

Bottle @ de Tolly joogipood, Tartu, Estonia. Pours with light brown, caramellysh head that lasts. Aroma of caramel, spicy hoppiness. Taste of sweet fruits, some burnt sugar, some alcohol and bread. Aftertaste has the best flavor with its bready taste and mild bitterness that stays in mouth. One of my favourite lagers.
Bottle from Tacoma boys. Pours a reddish Amber. Very little head. Scent is a little spicy. Taste is a little caramel and some more spice. Tasty.

Bottle. Hazy amber/red body with a thin off-white head. Light lacing. Aroma of caramel, red apple, brown sugar, raisin and lime zest. Flavour of green apple laces, toffee, dried apricot and honey. Medium body with a powdery mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Not quite as sweet as my favourite Doppelbocks.
Pours a beautiful golden amber color. Aroma and taste are caramel and bready malts.
One of my favorite beers of any style. Has a nice bready flavor but not overly sweet considering the maltiness.

Bottle from E.Leclerc, Riberac. Poured a clear, dark ruby colour, with a dense off-white head. Aroma of rich lager malt, caramel and spicy hop. Sweet fruits in the flavour, with some burnt sugar and rich grain. Finish was dried fruit, toffee and some resin.
Mørk kopperfarve med lys beige skum. Lukt av bær, rosin og malt. Smak av frukt, malt og karamell. Fruktig nesten vinøs ettersmak. Import
Fin duft av frukter og karamell. Dunkel honning farge. Tynn hinne skum. Fir fruktig smak med fin karamell avslutning.
Pours clear medium brown color with light tan head. Aromas of bread, toasted malt and molasses. Similar flavors. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation.

Single bottle from W&M Mansfield. Pours out a medium chestnut brown. Light tan head fades to a thin lace. Aroma of sweet malts, plums, brown sugar. Flavor is deep and malty. Alcohol is well masked. Could use a tad more hop balance though. Otherwise solid.
Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color ambar oscuro. Sabor a malta tostada, caramelo, ligeramente a alcohol.

Bottle. Clear copper color liquid with big vanilla color head. Medium to full body, average carbonation. Melon aroma. A bit of caramel in taste. Very alcoholy and sweet. Taste like beer with sugary fruit syrup and vodka.
Awesome dark malt aromas with raisins and cherries. Beautiful mahogany color. Taste is sweet malt with a slight bitter hint from the hops. Well done.

The archetypical Doppelbock, as invented by the monks of Paula, the roots of the current Paulaner brewery, intended as ’liquid bread’ and having inspired all those other Doppelbocks with names ending in -ator (after the name ’Salvator’ had been copied many times and finally became a deposited trademark somewhere in the late 19the century).  This was the first Doppelbock I ever tasted (and therefore a reference not just for the style as a whole, but for my personal appreciation of this style as well), from a ’tall boy’ can some twelve years ago, but since my palate must have evolved since then, I decided to put it to the test and re-rate it from its classic 50 cl bottle, bought at an Albert Heijn supermarket.  Off-white, creamy, quite dense head leaving a thick, steady, moussy rim around the glass and thin patches of foam in the middle; lightly hazy, warm autumny amber-hued bronze colour, the archetypical looks of a Doppelbock.  Aroma of butterscotch and caramel candy, wet towels and even vague wet dog, soggy sandwiches, dry autumn leaves, brown rum, butter melting on a hot pancake, burning brown sugar, something vaguely root-like (cooked chicory), sugared tea, dried fig, some toasted bread, roasted tomato peel but much less of the actual ripe tomato scent I remember it had from the can twelve years ago, hazelnut, mineral water, ’jenever’ and something - luckily - vaguely - and ’sulfurically’ - slurry pit-like.  Sweetish onset with a sourish edge, no lively fruitiness so this is very clearly a lager, clean, with vague hints of dried fig, hazelnut and dried berries, vividly carbonated with a minerally effect, even numbing a little bit; smooth, full body, consisting of a full-fledged toffeeish and nutty maltiness, restrainedly sweetish but shifting to a mildly bittering ’toastedness’ in the end, faint metallic ’zing’ somewhere in the middle, leading to a malty finish in which the caramelly and toasted malt bittersweetness persists, quite one-sidedly so, but enriched with on the one hand a dash of herbal, almost tea-ish, but most of all rooty and lightly earthy hop bitterishness being subordinated to the malt character but serving its structural purposes very well, and on the other hand a glow of warming, subtly spicy, rum- or even brandy-like alcohol, which becomes a bit fatiguing in the end without descending into unpleasant astringency.  This beer seems less interesting than I remember so my suspicion proves right: the can I had back then, bought at a - at that time! - novelty beer store in Rotterdam, harboured a somewhat more complex beer, with unexpected smoky and tomato-like accents, and those elements, which I was looking forward to revisiting, are as good as absent from this bottle.  This is still very interesting, combining that typical wet kitchen towel-like aspect of so many lagers (regardless of style) with a deep, rounded, caramelly malt body, making it quite a saturating beer, as it ought to be with these strong, malty German beers.  Salvator is to be respected as the grandfather of a style in much the same way as Hoegaarden is to be respected as the archetypical Belgian witbier: an influential standard, more suitable than anything to get acquainted with the particular style, but surpassed by many others since its creation; neglecting 21st-century craft beer innovations, I would e.g. place Andechser’s Doppelbock Dunkel (one of the exceptions in Germany in ignoring the -ator suffix) and Ayinger’s Celebrator, the two most famous classic Doppelbocks after this, above this Salvator in terms of refinement and richness.  The alcohol could have been better hidden in this one and the sulfuric accent in the nose bothered me a bit as well.  Huge respect for this beer, and glad I revisited it, but objectively reviewed, this is a very commercial example of the style in spite of its traditions, more on a par with e.g. Löwenbräu’s Triumphator and the like.  And my final critical note: do not believe the story that this is still brewed according to the recipe of Paula’s friar Barnabas from 1773, as this industrial brewery would like you to believe: this beer is bottom-fermented, a practice that became generalized only in the first half of the 19th century.  Maybe a top-fermented craft beer tribute to this very classic beer would not be such a bad idea?

330mL bottle BB 05/15
Another beer had on numerous occasions, yet haven’t rated...madness.
Anyhow, pale ruby body, decent clarity, holds a small beige head.
Nice rich aroma; toasted nuts, lots of dark caramel, cocoa, and subtle dark fruit undertones.
Texture is quite interesting - not quite thick & rich, not quite dry, carbonation somewhat higher than expected.
Palate delivers some upfront burnt toffee with plenty of nutty malt & bitter cocoa. Plum undertones lead into a rather dry finish with a reasonably high bitterness and lingering minerality.
A nice beer, perhaps lacking the punch of the best in the style.
Crimson on the eye, medium white head. Malt, caramel, and notes of alcohol on the nose. Smokey, with caramel, cellar and malt on the tongue. Warn malty finish. Good.

From 12 oz bottle at the 2014 German Bierfest (ATL). 
Deep orange amber body with asomewhat weak head. 

Nice caramel malt nose with light alcohol esters. Flavor follows but has more strength. Depth and complexity. Mildly bitter.
Excellent version of style.

Pours a hazy pastel orange with subtle honey hues in it. A fat head of tan foam that is slow to fall. Nose is malty. Brown crusty bread. Rich dry malt that is expansive on the nose. As the beer warms a hint of chocolate comes forward. Light caramel sweetness underneath There is a dark fruit presence. Some prune, raisin and a faint whiff of alcohol. Taste is malty and rich. breaddy malt, dry and crisp. The middle of the drink is fruity. The edges have some grassy hops in them and the finish has a touch of medicinal alcohol. The alcohol dries out the palate and the malt lingers with a light bit of that caramel sweetness. A bit of bitterness comes from grass and form alcohol to finish this one dry. Lighter mouthfeel than some dopplebocks but medium and full enough. Slight warming from alcohol.
J’ aime beaucoup cette Doppelbock. Gout fort et prnoncé, très alcoolisé avec un arrière gout amer plaisant

0,5 bottle courtesy of a German colleague. Reddish brown, clear. Tick beige foamy head. Nose of coffee, German roasted malts, BBQ. Liquor feel in the mouth, sweet notes of amber malts with a hint of nuts. The hops invade the palate short after. The body is round and complex and the notes above develop after every sip. The best Paulaner (surprisingly)!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Malty aroma. Golden amber colour with no head. Nice caramel malt flavour with smooth finish. Heavy body with low carbonation.

From bottle poured into pint glass. Bottle purchased in Denver. For an above 7% ABV this is really good. I was also concerned about the transport and UV exposure, but the dark bottle did as it was asked. Highly recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rich chocolate, dark plum, roasted flavors. Very tasty and rich brew, almost feels like an Abbey dubbel.

Drunk from a snifter and poured from a bottle brought back from Munich. Shared with family. The main distinctive taste in this beer is that of flaxseed, which manifests also in the aroma. It also tastes vaguely of wheat. It has a cheese-like aftertaste. The beer was unlucky enough to be followed by the Andechs Doppelbock Dunkel. On its own, I may have scored it higher. I have tried to compensate fairly for the circumstances. I would pair it with, I believe, certain scenes from Aladdin, or perhaps rice.
Amber in color w/ a thin head. Hoppy biterness up front w/ hints of burnt coffee.
Bottle 0.33l from Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia.Pour it deep red colour with small white head, Taste is bitter with aroma of dark fruits and caramel.not my favourite but ok.

Apricot tart cream. Amber red about clear body. Some thin lacings. Aroma; malts, sour peaches, grassy hops, bread, caramel juice, yeast, booze, dough.
Taste; confectionery stuff, strong caramel malts, fermented plum, bread, berries. Straight and solid on palate. Finishes with black caramel, confectioneries, cognac, redcurrant wine notes, bread - and tasty juice finish with still some bittterness in the final postludium. Good slow evening sipper.
[50cl brown btl 7.9%abv ° BB03.15]

Draught at Paulaner Beer Garden at Sarona market. Clear red with low white head. Cherry aroma, date honey, bready, sweet. Flavor is very sweet, date honey, bready, notes of coffee. Very alcoholic. Oily texture. Medium body. Sweet aftertaste.
Beautiful, golden colour, pleasant sweetness but little aftertaste. All in all, a good beer for a calm evening on the sofa.
Dark red almost copper tones with good amount of white head. Very light on the carbonation. Not a big fan
Poured from the tap. Copper orange with white head. Caramel and bready malt with slight sweet and bitter.
Noticeable malt smell, sweet like burnt cooking sherry and hints of caramel. Slight warmth from alcohol, tastes like the color brown.
cereal, nuts, roasty, soy sauce, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter
Cerveza de tonos rojizos. Con cuerpo pero de sabor suave y agradable con un regusto final a caramelo.

Bottle from Alder Carr Farm Shop, Needham Market. Red with a light fizz and a large beige head that swiftly vanishes. Malt dominates up front with red berries and Weetabix coming through. Spice follows in a dry finish. That was all in the first sip. The second gulp reveals a big alcoholic hit with more berries- Ribena maybe. Overall though dry malt and sweet berries dominate and are well balanced against each other. It’s rather good actually, and I’m glad I picked it up.

50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Coppery brown color, almost no initial head. Medium to low carbonation, but very full-bodied and slightly creamy / oily. Aromas of caramel, dried fruits suchs as raisins and plums. Taste is sweet and coffee bitterness. Extremely long and sweet aftertaste. This doppel bock is such that almost replaces a meal...
Lovely traditional dark amber beer with bitter taste and alcoholic flavor. Much better drink it on tap at Bavaria

Ruby red slightly hazy beer with big blonde head dissolving soon but leaving lacing. . Aroma and flavor have sweet bready malts, raisin, toffee, licorice, earth and herbs. Palate is full and with medium carbonation. Finish is long with a quite mild bite of bitterness, swet malts and some alcohol. A tasty but straightforward doppelbock, more like a strong dunkler bock without the roasted elements.
Dark orange pour, thin head that went away quickly. But good flavor, nice strength.
C-. Pours a clear deep copper color with white head. Very malty with a bite at the end.

✝ Bottle. Clear chestnut brown with a large slowly diminishing beige head. Rich malty notes of caramel, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, over ripe banana, light coffee like bitterness in the finish. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Little alcohol presence. Nothing overdone and quite pleasant. More a fan of eating than of fasting, but this could be an ok replacement for food in large enough quantities. ✝

Aroma of dates and raisins with a touch of bitter paper. Appears clear copper-brown, many streams of fizz rise to the top, white foam, no lace. Tastes sweet, of dates with a balancing paper like bitterness. Palate is fizzy, thick, nice. Overall, nice.
Bottle. Clear red. Bubbly. Sweet malty nose--almost Baltic. Thinnish. Bright body with fruity malts, bread yeast, slight hops.

Thank you to monk Barnabas and the Paulaner Monks for guarding this wonderful recipe.

 A Deep rick, thick, Doppelbock much deeper than Spaten optimator. 

Not a reral summer beer unless you live in a area where it g ets cold in the summer like the North coast of California along the shoreline. 

Would suggest tasting on its own to appreciate its character. Not a typical brew to match with food given the deep thick mouthful,richness 
and deep warmth after enjoying a bottle. Does come in 6 packs as well as the larger pint plus size bottles which is great .

Would consider the brew version of a glass of port after drinking wine with dinner. That last pour for the night .. Might scare off puss Corona extra light drinking man, however don’t assume it will chase off the girls as a he man brew either. German girls at least don’t have a problem with bigger head. 

A well deserved high 90’s on the rating for the quality over the decades.
makes a great present at Christmas for a fellow coworker who enjoys brew.

Sehr malzig und leicht hopfenbetont kommt dieses Bier rüber. Der Antrunk ist eher hopfig und der Abgang dann malzig. Es ist ein schönes, gut bekömmliches Starkbier. Das Etikett sieht ganz gut aus. Fazit: Schmeckt ganz anständig, gutes Bier!

Bottle from SuPerAlko in Tallinn (€ 1,55), July 2014. Pours a deep, brownish copper; tan head. Bubbles. A sweet, very - almost burnt - caramelly (Kukekomm!) nose with some strong cereal notes there, too. Taste is mostly just caramel but not overtly sweet, a bit roasty, metallic. Medium to full body, thick mouthfeel, though quite a soft palate with some crisp carbonation. Dry mouthfeel with a bit of a hay there. Malty, slightly spicy and alcoholic, warm, metallic finish. I just can’t seem to be turned into a Bock fan. Though I do imagine I’d enjoy this with some roast beef and baked potatoes.

Bottle from SuPerAlko in Tallinn (€ 1,70), August 2017. Same everything, some herbal bitterness in finish. Dropping it from 3.3 to 3.2. Too prickly and light on the body.

I've wanted to drink a bock for the past week so I picked this one up. After prying off the cap I could smell the sweet malts and the caramel flavors. Poured it displays a deep coppery color and a thick white head. Scent is dark breads like pumpernickel, slight yeast, malts, and a mild hop characteristic. Taste is malty, yeasty, bread, slight alcohol, and candy flavors such as chocolate, caramel, toffee, butterscotch depending on the drinker's taste buds. Mouthfeel is thick, smooth.

En ganske fin og dejlig øl...
Flot farve 
Anonym duft
Ikke særlig stærk i smag, på trods af høj alkoholstyrke

Light brown colour with a nice white head.
Aroma is malty, roasted, sweet, honey, alcohol, toffee
Taste is malty, caramel, too much sweet and some alcohol.
Hops is not enough to balance the taste, so drinking is too much sweet.
Medium oily body. Good carbonation.
Unbalanced

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought near Bamberg, Germany. Strong dark bock beer with lots of flavour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Cheers jeevan! Pours clear copper with a thin, long-lasting off-white head. Aromas of banana bread, burnt toffee, spice. Taste brings a honey note, but nice balance of herbal hoppiness. Creamy texture, full body, long sweet finish. Lovely.
Draft @ Gustav’s (PDX). Light Maury aroma. Orangish, cloudy appearance. Nice malty flavor that is full bloodied. Overall, is very tasty. Nice 2nd to Optimator.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
Alemã Duppel Bock clássica. Saborosa, adocicada cheiro e sabor de mel mas não enjoativa. Amargor e álcool equilibrado.

Reddish brown beer with medium head.
Malty, barrel-aged aroma.
Flavor has same mature maltiness, berries. Very nice.
Sweet and malty, but what stands out is how smooth and creamy it is. Rich yet easy to drink. Very unique, I like it.
Bottle 33cl. Globus. Dark red, lightly sparkling, small white head.  Aroma of light caramel, dark fruit and nutty malt.

DAAIS; Pours clear amber with a off-white to tan, lasting, leaving lacing head. Nose is malt, caramel, dark, dried fruit and alcohol Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, light bitter and spicy with a moderate lasting, and warming finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.
Clear dark amber color with medium carbonation and thin head. Roasted malts, bittery charred taste with slight alcohol aftertaste.

A legendás főzetnek már sötét borostyánszíne is sok jóval kecsegtet, az első korty pedig az "életem egyik legjobb söre!" felkiáltásra indíthatja sokak beszédközpontját. Kellemesen pörkölt, karamellizált cukros, tejkaramellás, mazsolás jegyek bontakoznak ki szépen sorjában, melyek betöltik a szájat, a komló lecsengése pedig minden kortyot megkoronáz. Fantasztikus sör.
Caramel, bread, roasty, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, leather, earthy, banana, licorice
Pours a nice light brown color with off-white head. Lots of barley malt, and caramel malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a littl enop note and more roasted character.
Cerveja com cor avermelhada, pouco cremosa. Aromatica e saborosa, sente-se sabor e odor de mel. É bem encorpada.
Deep amber with thick biscuit-coloured head. Initial aroma is sour milk followed by hops and malted barley. Strong bitter taste, with very mild sourness. Full body, mild alcohol burn to the mouth.

Couleur ambrée foncée, mousse beige qui disparait. Nez de caramel et note fruité (prune figues). Gout malté, caramel grillé et alcool, note de fruits (prunes). Fin malté amère. Pas mal

01/11/2014 100e fois que je bois cette bière, une de mes plus courante. Toujours nez de caramel doux intense, malté, fruité. Gout malté caramel doux,  avec notes grillée et fruits noirs, prunes, voir cassonade. Fin amère houblonnée, épices, fruitée, noisette, assez longue. Je ne me lasse pas de cette bière. Légère et intense, on sent a peine les 7c°
Caramel and alcohol notes. Color is amber and the liquid is a bit cloudy. Minimal head. Sweet taste with some alcohol taste in finish,
Brownish red pour with a tiny bit of haziness. Sweet malt aroma with a bit of roasted grain. Tastes of roasted grain and caramel with a bit of bitterness coming through.
Color is a dark red, minimal to no head. Very bready and sweet aroma. Flavor is caramel sweetness, bready, some dark fruits. Solid beer. It’s a pretty well-done doppelbock.
crisp, malty, somewhat caramelly sweet. really enjoyed this one and am looking forward to tasting more like this after moving to Germany

Deep red and dark color. Strong, intense and bitter taste, with fruit touches. 

Abundant body, which makes it a very consistent beer.

Reddish brown, hazy with lots of miniscule suspended particles; no head beyond a thin white ring; carbonation looks low, almost flat; aroma is gorgeous sweet malt and yeast, plummy, raisins; this takes me back to Belgian Christmas beers of a few months back; taste is toasty bready malts, followed by sticky sweet stewed fruits - plums, oranges, apricots; the candy peel thing; definitely sweeter than average; long, sweet boozy finish; tastes like a Christmas beer too; good, but not as good as Celebrator, but what is?
Classic doubleboch you can taste the alcohol but it tastes good w the roasted barley low carbonation but not flat
reddish and clear with rapidly fading head that leaves modest ring and no lacing. Malty and toasted aromas with slightly bready, yeasty notes and noticeable alcohol. Sweet, medium carbonation.
White head disappearing quickly. Clear red amber. Alcohol warmth. Caramely. Not as sweet as expected. Balanced. Good but not my favorite style.

Kifejezetten örömteli élmény volt megkóstolni. Magas alkoholfokkal bír, de krémesen lágy és itatja magát. Kellemesen gyümölcsös, nem túl édes, ami nagy előny. Én leginkább a doppelbock söröket kedvelem, de azok közül is kiemelkedően finom

My favorite "go to brew" in this style. Pours a deeper reddish brown that’s darker than shiny copper, and has a thin, fading head, the color of light brown sugar. Taste is bread, yeast, and sweet roasted malts with a hint of hops bitterness, and dry booze coming through. Palate is pleasant, thick and sticky, without cloying. Overall a great beer!
Tasty doppelbock. Has nice notes of roasted malt, without being annoyingly sweet. Good one.

Pours a finger and half of head on a dark straw colored body.
The aroma has lots of caramel and malty goodness.
The taste is caramel sweet from beginning to end, though some lemon bitterness balances it out a bit at the finish line.
The texture is sticky with moderate carbonation.
Always a pleasure to drink.
Pours amber with light tanned head. Aromebis malty, lots of caramel. Taste is malty, roasted and caramel.

Aroma: floral sweet
Flavor: bitter sweet with a dry finish and notes og yeast and alcohol
Color: reddish brown with a white head.

12oz bottle - pours a medium brown . Sweet malt aromas with mild fig and raisin. Taste is sweet and bready . Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Føtex. Clear amber pours with a good off-white head. Taste is malt. hops, caramel, some fruits. Oily texture. Sweet finish.
Rated from notes taken 8 Mar 2014 -- This is still the beer that all other doppelbock’s should be measured against. This is just a great beer overall and a perfect example of the style.

Bottle. Dark red amber, small head with small bubbles. In aroma malt and fruits - dark and red one :), some raisins. In taste the beer is sweet, malty with a hint of fruitiness, medium bitter. The beer is more than medium bodied, very nice carbonation. Very good doppelbock, especially after some time.

Bottle. Half a year after best before date :) Dark amber color, small head, but stayed to the end. Aroma of fruits, malt, caramel - sweet in general. Alcohol not present in the aroma or taste - only little watming effect. Full body, thick texture. Taste of malts, caramel, little hops bitterness. Good beer.
Pours a light chestnut. Really sweet malt smell. Strong alcohol on the taste.
Clear amber color with minimal white head. Aroma is malty and sweet, roasty, fruity and alcohol is pretty evident. Slightly bitter finish. Very good.
Bottle 0.33 l. Red color, medium head. Some lacing. In nose dominate malt, honey, caramel. Very nice. In flavor also malt, and some herbal, flowery notes of hops. Full body. Sweet. Pretty good.

Dark amber color, small white head. Hoppy nose. Aroma is hops, caramel, hints of coffee. Bitter sweet taste. Alcohol is barely noticeable. Full body, thick texture and flat carbonation. Bitter finish.  
(Metro 0,33l bottle)

Clear deep amber color, huge off white head. Medium to full body, very soft carbonation. Aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruits, raisins. It’s sweet, but there’s also some strange fruity bitterness. Slightly dry also. Interesting.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

2014 bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden brown with an off-white head. Aroma and taste are extremely bready and yeasty with a solid malt backbone and some prune-like taste and smell. Easy to see how this was a sustenance beer over Lent.

Cerveja escura, forte gosto adocicado.. Vale a pena... Bem diferente das nacionais

0,3 draught @ cafeteria in Bilbao. Nice brown colour with decent head. Very easy to drink. Taste is somewhat sweet and malty. Hides very well the high amount of alcohol.
Pours a nice dark copper color with a small tannish head. Has a strong malty taste, pretty smooth. Don’t think I could drink to many of these with its 8% alcohol content...not a bad thing! :)

Bottle. Stem glass. Dark cooper with two finger white head, which dissapears quickly. Good lacing. Heavt malty aroma, bread, caramel, dark fruits, pear, honey and alcohol, some yeasty notes. The taste is very similar. Medium sweet, light bitterness, noticable booze, warming sensations. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture.
Bottle, pours a coppery color with a tan head, stats sweet with dark fruits, caramel, and toffee flavors, slight bitter finish, good Doppelbock

Bottle: Aroma is sweet, malty, light alcoholic, notes of molasse and caramel. Roasted malt and cacao, fruity notes of plums. Dark amber to brown color, creamy brownish head. Flavor is malty, fruity with notes of plums, some banana, cherries, light spicy. Roasted malt, chocolate, cacao.

Aroma: caramel, roasted nuts, chocolate
Appearance: deep red, minimal foam
Taste: slighty sweet, medium sour, slightly bitter
Palate: abrupt finish, medium body, soft carbonation

Perfectly hidden alcohol. A great example of its style.

A Very nice double boch. fruity smell, good dark colour, some sediment. Packs a punch. 7.9%ABV.Drank it very cold. Not much carbonation and head thin. Not complex, just very good at being a double boch

Beautiful amber-brown beer with a transient white/light-brown head. Aroma of honey, ripe fruit, alcohol and yeast. Nice taste of alcohol, overripe fruit, caramel and something else. Overall a very very decent beer.

aroma: malty, nutty, caramel, toffee
appearance: hazy brown colour
taste: malty, bread, hay, alcoholic, sweet, caramel, raisins, complex and very balanced

50cl bottle at Paulaner, Bremen. Clear amber brown with a medium to full off-white soapy head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with bitter tones. Caramel, brown sugar, spices, herbs, hops and warming alcohol. A decent full flavoured German brew.

Nice grainy, bready aroma. Reddish brown color with an off-white head that dissipated fairly quickly, Very nice malty taste with chocolate overtones and just enough hopping to reduce the sweetness. Nice medium body with a very smooth finish. Number one example of the style in BJCP Guidelines.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours reddish, amber light hazy into the glass, with fizzy carbonation and big, foamy beige head. Settles around 1½ finger. Fruity head and nose, blum, pear and apples, herbal, citrus along moderate spices. Malt, brown sugar, earthy yeast and butter biscuits too. Very similar taste - no surprises there. Clear, warming alcoholic taste, not that aggressive, but still very noticeable. Solid medium bodied, oily texture with soft, average carbonation.

Moderate off-white head and lacing, dissipates quickly. Clear ruby dark amber liquid. Attractive aroma of grains, bread and spring floral. Moderate bitterness and floral hops in the background. Very smooth to drink with full body and warm finish. Very enjoyable to drink and I can't wait to get my hands on some more! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rødorange tåkete med beige skum. Masse søt sydhavsfrukt som mango, papaya, noe skogsbær. Bitter sur smak, grønn te, kompleks med mye som skjer. Lite kullsyre
Med ölföreningen julen 2013. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, marsipan, torkad frukt. Stor sötma, rund och len. En flaska från 2012.

500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmmalzig, schokoladig, fruchtig. Geschmack röstmalzig süß mit leichter Fruchtigkeit, leicht schokoladig.
Tap at Kaisla, Helsinki. Originally rated 13082011. Colour is reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, fruits and malts.

Bright brown, reddish and clear with rapidly fading head that leaves modest ring and no lacing. Malty and toasted aromas with slightly bready, yeasty notes and noticeable alcohol. Sweet, medium carbonation.

hvala mom kolegi iz ragbija Nani koji se potrudio donjeti ovo pivo...jedno dosta dobro pivo .. jako pivo crvenkaste boje ...zanimljivo i pitko pivo ...alkohol se ne osjeca toliko puno ...okus je pun ...

Shared a 50cl bottle. Pours a almost clear dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, malty and fruity. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and some sour notes. Overall, a very good lager beer.
Cerveja escura de trigo, com uma boa complexidade de sabor e aroma. Caramelo, fermento, pão e aroma alcoólico que se destaca.
Too strong.. It’s a good beer, not my favorite taste...............................
500 mml Bottle tasted at home on 26/02/2014. Nice appearance with golden brown colour. Little sweet on paladar with smoky notes . Next one please!

Bottle
Aroma-malt, plums, dried fruits
Appearance-amber, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly sour, medium bitterness, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall- very good
Amber with minimal head retention. Alcohol and dried fruit on the nose. Sharp alcohol and caramel flavors, boiled sweets, strong malt. A very nice doppel bock.
The aroma is sweet and fruity. Pours clear amber. The taste is bitter and sweet at the same time. Tastes sweet of caramel and nuts. And bitter of citrus and pine.
A melhor Doppelbock que já bebi. coloração castanho escura, espuma de boa formação e estabilidade, encorpada, aroma de malte tostado, amargor pronunciado e residual adocicado.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 12/2013. Pours lightly hazy reddish copper color with a 2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of caramel, pear, plum, apple, brown sugar, toast, biscuit, brown bread, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Nice aromas with good balance of malt and fruity yeast notes with solid complexity; and good strength. Taste of caramel, toast, brown sugar, biscuit, plum, pear, apple, brown bread, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, brown sugar, biscuit, pear, apple, brown bread, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish. Nice balance and solid complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; with good robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth and fairly slick mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a nice doppelbock. Good balance and solid complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A nicely enjoyable offering.

Pour dark, unclear amber with decent off white head. Smell caramel, raisin, roasted malts. Taste is raisins/prunes, big caramel bite, with some fruity yeasty esters. Dominate sweet, but not overly. Not a bad lager. Thanks discount bin.

Forte tanto no gosto quanto no álcool. Excelente opção para uma segunda prova. Deve ser tomada como a ultima cerveja do dia, pois dificilmente você irá conseguir aproveitar outra depois desta explosão de sabor e amargor.
Dark brown, little bit foggy color. Roasty, with the some malt in the focus. Creamy, sweet, molasses taste. Avarge bitterness, nothing special, but it is not about the hops at all.

Bottle. Nose: very faint. Generally, aroma of malt, dark bread, alcohol, caramel, a little bit of prune. Brown colour, clear. Light sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Good, but not exceptional.
330 ml bottle. Reddish amber color with thin beige head. Aroma: sweet malts, caramel and alcohol. Taste: malt, carmel, fruity, little bitter. Low to average carbonation. Great beer.

Lovely dark red colour, the aroma reveals malt and sweet honey notes, the flavor considering the amount of alcohol is beautiful balanced, and at the end the hops just adds enought bitterness, to make it work perfectly.

Bottle BB Aug 2014. Dark red, lightly sparkling, small white head. Smell - malty, slight banana esters and raspberry. Body is medium, slightly foamy, carbonation low. Taste - bready malts, goji berries and raisin, alcohol tang, drying yeasty finish. Nice enough.

Paulaner Salvator Is a coppyer colored (amber/orange) brew with a thick off white head. it has a medium body with a velvety mouth feel. Initially I really liked this beer it was heavy on the malt and light on the hops, but it was slightly yeasty. Every minute the beer spent in the glass the warmer temperature just intensified the yeasty taste till it felt like I was trying to swallow a loaf of sourdough whole. It was very bready, but even in bread you don’t want a really overt taste of yeast. It was just a little much. So drink this one fast and you will enjoy it more.

P: Vivacious copper orange body with small layer of creamy tan head. 

S: Huge aroma of Whoppers chocolate malt balls, roasted toffee, salted caramel apples, prunes, milk chocolate and barley. 

T/M: Hard apple cider soaked prunes, toffee, and finishes with dry salted caramel covered apples. Mouthfeel is actively carbonated and a creamy medium body. 

O: A good beer that has great availability. It’s s solid competitor for a go to dopple bock. The aroma when cold was awesome cause I was over whelmed by Whoppers and I love Whoppers. Anyone who doesn’t really doesn’t exist and I would rather not ever see them. Anyways this is a definite have to try. Cheers!

11.2 oz. bottle. Appearance: half finger of white head that dissipates quickly, ruddy orange/red color, cloudy, sub-par lacing. Aroma: prune or raisiny fruit, molasses, leather, floral, light citrus. Palate: medium/full body, oily texture, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Taste: sweet molasses, light raisiny sweetness, ends with a slight bitterness. Overall, very complex, well balanced, very alcoholic, just not my personal favorite.

Golden brown with fast disappearing white head. Caramel, candy sugar, spices, yeast, lightly roasted malts. Medium sweet and a light bitter touch. Unexpectedly light bodied, I would say a solid medium and lots of alcohol presence. OK, but a bit thin and too much straight up alcoholic.

Bottled. Notes from 19.03.2013. Deep brown in colour. Small, brown head. Aroma of caramel, plum, raisins. Tastes of bread, plums, raisins with caramel and toffee notes. Full body. Smooth. Good doppelbock.

Bottle. Pours a ruby-like body, with an average light brown head that diminishes pretty quickly, leaving a good lace. Pretty weak aroma, nicer as the beer gets warmer, but still pretty weak, nice booziness and roasted matls though. Taste is phenomenal, pretty alcoholic, but never offensive, along with a sweet roasted maltiness, and notes of vanilla and caramel. Very nice smooth texture, almost full bodied, very nice carbonation level. Wow, didn’t expect that, amazing beer.

Classic doppelbock showdown: Paulaner vs. Spaten. Aroma of light caramel, dark fruit, barrel aging and nutty malt. Hazy tannish-copper. Sweet, starchy malt taste, hits of fruit and nuts. Medium to heavy body, very smooth, will appear stronger as it warms per stylistic norms. A go to back when bocks were my favorite style. Beats Optimator, although they are more different than I remember.
Bu en bouteille de 50cl avec Renobob, une couleur brune avec peu de mousse, grande présence de malt en bouche et assez riche sur le côté grillé excellente
Belle couleur, arômes de caramel, malt assez présents. Un bon produit, plaisant à boire.

Hazy burnt orange pour with a 1 finger, creamy beige head. Aroma is pretty big on grainy and bready malts, some nice caramel, light nutty notes and spicy hops. A- Pours a deep, rusty amber color. Lots of red comes through in the body when held to light. Small, 1 to 2 finger head forms and is off-white to tan in color. Slight haze in the glass, adding to the opaque nature of the beer that is given by the dark color. Lacing is good.

S- Starts with a bang of dark malts. Somewhat fruity in flavor, the malts are semisweet and pretty complex. Almost a brown sugar flavor in the scent before the dark fruity notes make an appearance.

T- Pretty much matches the smell on this one. More dark fruit flavors than in the scent, with an almost raisin-like flavor mixed in. Also, a hint of nuttiness is intermingled among the caramel and dark malts. Ends with a slightly bitter dark malt finish, which feels a little like a hop finish.

M- Medium to light in carbonation and thick and smooth in feel. This one feels pretty much like the liquid bread it is supposed to feel like. This isn't quite a sipper, but it will weigh you down and fill you up.

Aroma agradable e intenso. Los granos destacan ampliamente, se percibe con facilidad la cebada, sin embargo también es distinguible sus maltas caramelizadas que le brindan un sabor dulce. Aroma exquisito.

Color marrón con destellos rojizos, se percibe turbia y sin filtrar. Cuerpo medio, carbonatación baja, corona de espuma media con baja retención.

En boca, suave con un buen equilibrio entre el dulzor inicial y un sutil amargor final.

Al paladar es una grandiosa doppelbock, si bien es cierto que en primera instancia el dulzor es algo fuerte, esperado en virtud de las maltas utilizadas, posteriormente un ligero y agradable amargor equilibran de buena forma esta cerveza, permitiendo un grandioso final. De igual forma es hasta el final cuando se puede percibir su potencia alcohólica.

En resumen una muy buena cerveza alemana, la cual reúne ampliamente las características del estilo, que si bien no deja de ser una cerveza de baja fermentación, es una muy agradable. Muy maltosa, dulce y bien equilibrada cerveza. Definitivamente un pan liquido.

Draft to pint. Looks good for the style; a hazy amberish brown with foamy head somewhere between off-white and light beige. Smells and tastes sweet and malty with notes of caramel. Nice and smooth on the palate. A good example of the style.
Brown with a tan head. Malty, sugary, nutty aroma. Big malt and toffee flavors with with  a bit of nuttiness and a short slightly sweet finish. Very nice, but not exceptional.
On tap, pours a cloudy orange with little head. Nice nose, malts, sweet dark sugary, fresh bread. Sweet on the pallate but not overly. Very drinkable.

This is quite the enjoyable beer! This beer should set the standard for dopplebocks. Although the taste didn’t strike me as exceptionally complex, it featured a savory maltiness with a syrupy sweetness undertone that wasn’t excessive, also some dark fruit flavor. Some alcohol notes slip through but for the most part is muted despite the 7.9% content. The mouthfeel is smooth and finishes with a mildly bitter toffee aftertaste. Good color and head retention for appearance. Aroma was a little weak, but is an interesting sweet caramel and roasty malt mix. I personally prefer this to the Weihenstephaner Korbinian (which I thought had too heavy a taste), which is the closest equivalent I’ve sampled. Also slightly beats out Ayinger Celebrator in my opinion. Overall, a nice quality beer to sip and savor. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

Robe brun rouge, faible effervenscence. Nez de fruits confits et alcool. Attaque légérement amère, le malt et l’alcool dominent, légérement liquoreuse. Amertume assez persistante. Assez suprenant et pas mal du tout.

11.2 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a murky copper color. An incredibly fluffy head (about two fingers high, off-white in color) tops it off with amazing texture,and mediocre retention. As it fades away, some lacing is left on the glass.

S: My very first whiff of this brew made me wonder if it were lightstruck - it was a bit skunky. Once it warms up in the glass, however, it smells less like a skunk’s ass and more like the dying presence of German hops. Also of note is plenty of caramel and brown sugar.

T: I pick up more in the way of dark fruits than I did on the nose, especially when it first hits the palate. The general flavors are caramel and brown sugar. I also get an apple note, distressingly similar to a macro lager - if I had to pick my least favorite part of the profile, this is it. On the plus side, I’m surprised how hoppy the finish is given its proximity to the 11/13 best-by date. It honestly does a good job of cleaning the palate up, and also provides a nice bitter-ish balance.

M: Like I said, the finish is drier than I anticipated - and that’s a good thing! It helps to balance the syrupiness without killing the rich feel. Carbonation is low, but that’s because I let it sit for a while before drinking.

O: A solid doppelbock, but it lacks the defined complexity to be a great one. Would drink again, though.
Dark red-brown body, thin off-white head, minimal lacing. Notes of caramel, raisins, prunes and other dark fruits. Medium bodied, nice sweetness, moderate carbonation and a compact finish.

If I liked doppelbocks a little more, I’d probably like this a lot more than I do. As it is, I’m always put off by the doppels over-sweetness. Still drinkable and enjoyable, just not something style-wise that I want very often.

Dark amber, good head but doesn’t last. Full bodied impressive malt with a kick of bitterness. Excellent flavor and drinkability but almost 8% alcohol but no hint of malt liquor alcohol or icehouse type liquid crack. Very bready, great aroma for a beer. Bold tastiness, not wimpy for those who like light beer. Most excellent for 10 bucks a six pack at the HEB grocery.

11.2oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy medium dark orange amber with a rapidly retreating light straw colored rapidly retreating head with decent lacing. Nose is of carmel, malt, chocolate, and dark baked bread. The taste follows the nose but has some deliciously balanced overtones of dark fruit, prunes, and slight bitterness of hops. The body is medium and conveys a very moderate yet complex balance of malt flavors. This beer is complex while simultaneously being understated and highly drinkable. The finish has a dry crispness to it but also has the slightly sweet lingering flavor of the varied and rich malt bill. Carbonation is light. It is pretty clear why they have not modified the recipe since 1773 and how the monk's could live on this beer without food during lent. This "mother of all" double bocks is amazingly drinkable, deceptively complex and achieves beer making near perfection through it's subtlety rather than clubbing your tongue into submission with the brewers artistic flavor choices. Watch out though, it's 7.9%ABV drinks like a 4.2%ABV session beer. I love this beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2oz bottle, from Jungle Jim’s in Fairfield. Best before 11/13. Mostly clear amber red orange color. Thin khaki head, fades to minimal. Only a couple loose dots of lace. Bigger body. Smooth, lighter sort of crisp carbonation. Sort of dry in the finish. More of a malt forward flavor. Caramel malt, spice, and fruit in the aroma. Slight nuttiness. Not bad but a little simple and blunt, not as complex or robust as my favorite examples. Moderate bitter taste, bigger sweet, too. More spiciness than your typical doppelbock. Very light hint of warmth in the finish, alcohol is hinted at more with the sweetness, though. Fine doppelbock. Just nothing great about it, not really my style.

Dark amber in color , creamy nice head. Aroma of roasted caramel and just a little alcohol. Taste is malty sweet but sweetness good balanced with hop.

Bottle- Pours a rich dark amber with a finger of tan head. Aroma is dark fruit alcohol. Taste is sweet up front with caramel and coffee, then rolling through alcohol and ending with a nice hops balance. Smooth mouth feel with just enough carbonation. A very very fine beer.

Salvator was very well balanced. Aroma of raisin, caramel, toast, nuts, with an tan head that did not linger long, but clung to the sides of the glass. The Red/black in color,dark fruit notes increased as the beer warmed. Medium sweetness and well balanced hops played well with the carbonation. Nothing stood out too much which only speaks to the incredible balance.
33cl bottle, 7.9% abv. malty aroma, taste is bitter countered with sweetnes and roasted chocolate notes. alcohol slightly noticeable. dry finish.
Poured into a boot with deep ruby red color and voluminous copper head. Aroma of sweet roasted malt and the flavor follows with lots of different flavors and yeasty hints. Delicious beer
Bottle at The Ale House, Chelmsford. Pours a dark amber colour with beige head. Sweet, malty, caramel aroma. Medium bodied. Good beer, but a little too sweet for my taste.
Dark amber color with creamy head. Fruity aroma. Flavor is sweet and malty with bitter aftertaste.
Clear brown. Small off-white head  Rich malts featuring caramel, toast, dried fruit, vinous notes both on aroma and taste. Solid body. Not overly sweet. Tasty. Good.
500 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Dark red with off white head. Aroma is malty, bready and sweet, faint caramel and alcohol. Taste is sweeter with bread, malt and faint fruit followed by alcohol.

Bottle from Germany. Dark orange color with a weak, beige head. The aroma is very complex, a bit sweet, sour, dark, malty, some caramel, alcohol... taste is very rich, mellow, sweet, but strong tasting because of the relatively high alcohol content. Just a hint of bitterness at the end, but it works fine. Medium-full bodied, low carbonation. Overall, it is too sweet for my taste, it won’t be my favorite, but it’s a nice one.
33 cl. flaske med 7,9 %. OK tysk øl. Rød-brun farve. Ikke jordens bedste men fin til en almindelig tirsdag
Considering I only paid about two bucks for 16 ounces of this, I’m super impressed. Really malt focused, but all together balanced. Smooth and with loads of character. Loved it.
Mooie caramel en koperen kleur. Prettige geur van, caramel, vanille. Smaakt prima, caramel.
Pours a copper beer with a good white head. Smells honey and caramel. Tastes licorice and caramel. Good average carbo with a medium body and a sticky texture.

50cl bottle from Tengelmann in Munich. Pours a lightly hazed amber colored body with an inch thick, creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is malty sweet with some nutty caramels, bread, a light toastiness, a bit of a yeast spice, and some dark fruits. Flavor is similar. Bready caramels with a nice sweetness, nuts and toast, a light yeast spice, a bit of a hop note throughout, and a few plum dark fruits. Finishes clean and dry with a slightly sticky sweetness and a light bitterness. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium-full, smooth body and a soft, creamy, moderate carbonation. Overall, an excellent doppelbock. A bit on the malty sweet side, but well balanced and easy drinking. Great beer.

Pours a darker red with some head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is malty, bready and sweet. Body is medium carbonated, caramel and sweeter taste with a strong alcoholic/sweet aftertaste. Strong, but still drinkable and enjoyable. Nice bock!

1/2 liter at Wurst und Bier Crosswoods on 6/14/13. Cloudy red/amber in color with a medium tan head. Nose consisting of sweet malt, caramel, nuts and fruit. Malty flavor with cherry accents and caramel before a semi-boozy finish. Very nice d-bock.

Bottle at hohenschwagau. 
Nice strong nose, prunes , alcohol, reisins. 
Walnut color, small white head. 
Medium body, alcohol, nuts, prunes. 
Really nice Starkbier!


:)
Bolton Brew.

Dark Brow, Medium Head, Did Not Leave any Lacing. Sweet malty Aroma. Sweet, Bread, Malt, caramel, slight alcohol finish. Medium body. Higher ABV Has warming effect.Might be nice in cold weather. Pretty Good.

Great Dopplebock! Before the strong American microbrews, this was the best strong beer available. It is very malty and bread like with a nice hop finish. German hops have a way of transitioning smoothly within their beers and it is the same case here. Despite being loaded with malt and alcohol, there is a hop bite. Try this beer and remember the style, rather than comparing it to other American styles.
Dark amber. Small head. Best part is bready aroma. In the taste the sweet "too much alcohol" kicks in. So a tad too sweet, but drinkable in small amounts
Very nice. Rich full bodied malty flavor. Hints of plums. Very nice. Had on Tiberias.
Intensive malts and caramel aroma. Small, durable head. Brown hazy body. Sweet bready and caramel taste, also little bit of alcohol.

Amber in color with small to little head. Poured into tulp glass. Taste and aroma was of malt. Not as Dark as others of this Style. Less thick also. A enjoyable doppelbock at a nice price and easy to get.
Pours amber color with off white head. Malt, caramel and alcohol aromas. Malt, caramel, toffee and some fruit flavors. Medium body with slightly bitter, alcohol flavored finish.

Bottle from Magasin du nord, Copenhagen - Dark amber pour with a medium off white head on top. Roasted caramel malty pleasing number, and some nice fruity nuances in play, banana, plum, vanilla. Very satisfying.
Aroma was sweet malt and alcohol. Appearance resembles a glass of tea- not dark like most dopplebocks. Not much head and no lacing. I believe this one may have gone downhill since I last had it.

Bottle at beertasting with Carsten Bertelsen 19 / 6 2013. Dark orange/red, small white head. Aroma, malty, bread, hoppy notes, toffee. Taste, malty, toffee, alcohol. Leaves a bitter aftertaste, with some alcohol.
(bottle 19/06-2013) [7,9%] low beige head, clear amber color, sweet malty aroma, medium co2, sweet malty light bitter taste. BB date 02/2014.
Bottle shared with pals at club w..   brownish pour with thin bubbly white head.. Aroma is funky malts and fruit.. Taste is very easy drnking fruitty light bitter finish.. Like it

Pours a reddish brown with a medium white head. Has a slight liquor aroma with some notes of herbs and roast. It has a medium sweetness that is almost like wine. Much like the taste, the palate is that of wine with a thin body and slick texture, and it has a slight dry and bitter finish. This is a very interesting beer (though I haven’t had many  double bocks) that is a welcome change from most beers you’ll find.

0,3 bottle. pours dark hazy amber with medium off-white head quickly disappearing.
malty sweet aroma, with caramel and winey notes.
caramel,plums and alcohol also in the taste, with roasted malts in the final. 
lively carbonation, medium to heavy body.

Keg@ earl of Essex. Pours red to brown colour. Some carbonation and ok head that vanishes pretty quickly. Nice aroma, sweet malt, cherry candy not very strong smelling. Good foamy mouthfeel. Sweet with caramel cherry flavour and smooth finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It’s not my favorite Doppelbock but I like this beer. The aroma is nice and the flavors are sweet without being cloying. The alcohol is present but not overwhelming. It isn’t sticky or syrupy like many other beers of the style. An easy to drink, enjoyable beer.

I might have rated this higher, but I had it right after an Aventitus, which is pretty much the best bock out there. This one had a fainter banana smell, and a bit harsher bite to it, but was still a very good sweet and malty brew. It claims there are hops in there but I don’t think they made a dent in the malty power.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber color, smell of caramel and malt , taste is pretty similar to nose, well balanced bitter-sweet with light alcohol hints. Bitter aftertaste, medium to heavy body. Nice doppelbock.
Keg at Earl of Essex, Islington, London. A dark amber coloured pour with a thin off white head on top. Fruity, malty, caramel aroma. Tastes malty, fruity, caramel, slight sweetness.

33cl bottle in Samobor, Croatia. Pours clear, glowing amber with a small off-white head. Malty aroma with caramel and herbal hops. Sweet and a bit caramelly with a quite well balanced bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. Alcohol is well integrated and makes this dangerously drinkable. Nice and desserty doppelbock. (2013-05-19)

Flaske fra Beligsk Bryg, delt med Ovesen en hyggelig tappe- og omstikkingskveld: karamellduft fra malten, med et forsiktig humlehint. Deilig rund og mørk bocksmak som fyller ganen, og heldigvis leverer den lenge!

A - Pours a clear copper with red highlights. 1.5 finger tan head.

S - Lots of rich toasted caramel, almost like caramel melting in a pot, musty wheat bread, musty yeast, over ripened apples, sugary figs, nutty.

T - Toasted bread, fruity malt, caramel, alcohol does not hide, grassy bitterness shows up along with some dry nuttyness.

M - Full and slick, but drys out on the finish. Adequate carbonation.

The aroma is better around 52 degrees. After that the alcohol really pounces on things. The flavors were good but fell flat of what the nose describes.

Serving type: bottle

08-27-2011

Body is a clear amber, head is minimal. Nose is spicy with notes of bready malts and some hops. Taste is sharp and spicy, leaving a long lasting bitterness and warmth. Alcohol taste is a bit too pronounced. A somewhat one-sided but nevertheless decent beer.

The grand dad of the double bocks.  Not the best of the style, but still one of the best, and its flaws actually makes the good parts better.  A bit thick on the pour, and a bit overall bready, accented by a nice blend of noble hops and thick sweet malt.

11.2 Bottle. Poured dark amber with a small tan head and some lacing. Aroma is strong malts and grain.  Taste is also very malty caramel and dark fruit, alcohol and some bread flavor too, very sweet beer. quite enjoyable and easy to drink, liked it a lot.

A bottle that poured an amber color with a tan head. The aroma was exceptionally sweet with taffy & caramel notes. The flavor was fruity with plums,  caramel, quite sweet & reminded me of iced tea... I also got figs or dates. It’s really sweet but smooth but has some booziness to it, pretty good and at a nice price. It went very well with some camembert cheese.
0,33L bottle. Musty, rotten potato, alcohol aroma, animal farmyard smell.  Alcohol, medical spirt taste is strong and disruptive. Dont find anything special.

Light amber with a small and quickly fading light brown head. Strong caramel aroma. Deep and caramel flavored with hints of molasses and malt. Very traditional German Doppelbock 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very sweet like many double bock.  Carmel dark sugars nothing to great.  Smell same thin head.  Average beer heavy not refreshing.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
