pours a hazy amber with a medium off white head.  aroma is fruity...candied fruit...with a mild earthy bitterness.  flavor follows suit...adds a touch of chocolate.  mouthfeel is light and the finish is warming earthy bitter/fruit.

Poured into a 16 oz. snifter.
Pours a medium amber-brown with a small, white head that fades away quickly. Aromas of strong, sweet tea, cherry Kool-Aid and a moderate scent of alcohol. Taste is fruity sweet and bitter right up front. I don’t notice much complexity or change between the initial taste and the finish. I also don’t detect any toasted or caramel flavors that I am accustomed to with other doppelbocks. That aroma of cherry Kool-Aid is also present in the flavor. Alcohol presence is above what I consider normal for a doppelbock with a bit of a burn. A bit hoppy, too. Mouth-feel is right; medium to full bodied with carbonation very low.

If I were judging this beer by its accuracy to style, I would give it a low rating; it lacks the many of the attributes that a doppelbock should have and possesses some that it shouldn’t. However, it is still a very tasty brew that I’ve bought many, many times and will again.

On tap at Richtar Jakub, Bratislava. Dark brown copper color. Creamy head. Aroma of malt, sweet sugar,. The aroma is similar to belgian strong ales. Alcohol present but warming, not burning. A very tasty beer.

On tap @ Doktor Malz. profumo estremamente maltato, quindi un misto di dolcezza e cereali integrali. La schiuma è bianco sporco , della consistenza quasi di docciaschiuma, compatta ma poco stabile e non troppo durevole. Il colore è rame antico, perfettamente limpida, dalla poca carbonatazione. Alla’aasaggio si percepisce il dolce della fermentazione alcolica e il sentore dei malti tostati. Gusto pieno corpo rotondo e finale dolce/amaro molto lungo.

Another classic doppelbock, have had this at least 10 times.  Bottles and tap.  I remember a time when I found a Paulener t shirt at a thrift shop, had no idea what it was, and ended up trading it for some pot.  That was freshman year at Umass.
Very bready, caramel and sweet. Smells like a loaf of bread. Very good. Good warming alcohol content. Heavy mouthful. Can be a little overwhelming at times. Perfect for a chilly spring day.

330ml bottle. Malty, some caramel and subtle roasty aromas. Pours dark copper, almost clear, with nice offwhite head. Medium body, some oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is malty, some sweet and spicy.

16.9 fl oz / 500mL bottle into a pint glass.

Aroma: Delicious warm caramel, strong malts and a little fresh yeast.

Appearance: Barely translucent deep amber. Khaki head that lingers a bit.

Taste: Wow full of caramel and malt! A little alcohol flavor, but it’s not super-present. The flavor in this one packs a punch!

Palate: Lingers lingers and lingers. Creamy and mouth-coating, with a nice warming.

Overall: Fantastic beer. Fan. Tastic. Caramel and malt to the max.

Bottle. Bit hazy, brown amber color. Thin light brown foam, dissipates quickly. Smell has some malts and a light fruity note.

Taste is somewhat watery, but has a nice woody and malty tone. Also has raisin in the taste. Light carbonation. Alcohol is nicely concealed yet comes through a bit. Overall very drinkable and good, but nothing to look forward to especially.
Bottle at home. Clearing backlog. No comments. Apologies, future ratings will have detail.

Kaatuu lasiin hieman yllättäen kuparinruskeana ja hieman sameana, vaahto on tiivistä ja noin sormen paksuinen. Haju on melko mieto, mutta siitä löytyy selvää limppuista maltaisuutta ja mausteita. Hieman kuivattua hedelmää ja anistakin löytyy joukosta. Mallaspohja kyllä tuntuu, mutta haju kaiken kaikkiaan on melko mieto. Maku on hyvin maltainen limppuisella tavalla, mutta nyt mausteisuus ja lievä sitruunainen happamuus tulee joukkoon. En tiedä, onko menossa pilalle, muttei tämä ainakaan ensisiemauksilla haittaa. Suutuntuma on alkuun makea, mutta happamuus leviää suuhun melko nopeasti. Melko erilainen doppelbock, joka on jo vähän happaman puoleinen. BBE on 11/13, joten ei tämä kuitenkaan pilalla pitäisi olla. Happamuus tuo jännän piirteen tähän olueen ja ihan maistuvahan Salvator loppujen lopuksi on. Maltaisuutta olisi kuitenkin kaivannut enemmän.
Salvator taste sweet malty and fresh. The sweetness is not overpowering the rest of the aromas and therefore this beer is pleasant to drink.

Bottle @ Restaurant Gilleleje, Nyhavn .... company christmas dinner 2012... It pours amber with a small off white head....The aroma is roasted malt, hoppy, molasses, caramel, spices and some alcohol...... The flavor is quite the same as aroma... Not bad.... nice....

The nose is malt, raisin and honey like a typical bock. The pallet is malt, raisin and finishes with a crisp effervescence. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle bought at Biere von Irene in Yuen Long.



Clear dark copper amber colour, kind of like maple syrup; Thin head and beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Good lacing and notable carbonation; Nice, fragrant aroma of banana, sweet caramel, vanilla, plum, raisins and alcoholic hint. The overall aroma has the basic, stripped - down feel of a typical BSA; Nice sweet taste of caramel, liquorices, toffee, chocolate, light coffee, light booze, herbs and hidden hops; Medium to full body, oily palate; Taste profile is sweet caramel base with strong but pleasant liquorices, good dose of chocolate and just the right taste of coffee! Wow! All under the bare bone BSA backdrop and in a very subtle manner; Booze is extremely well hidden and managed throughout. No knock out being felt throughout the tasting; Hop bitterness is quite pronounce for a Doppelbock but not yet to German Pils level, with mild, comfy and lingering astringency to close out. Slightly dry after taste; Quite easy and tempting to mouth.



Comments: I am quite speechless about this classic. At the first few sips I thought this may be just a strongly - hopped, BSA-ish sweet bock. Its sophistication, however, becomes more and more evident: no nonsense BSA-ish aroma, very tasty but never cloying sweet caramel, close to magical liquorices that links all the taste together, and booze is so sublime and hidden I really wonder how Paulaner achieves that. The 8% abv stays so quiet for as long as I am typing this speak volumes about the quality of this brew. I don’t think I want to compare this to Höss Doppel-Hirsch, another nice Doppelbock, as they work their way to my palate quite differently and both are very good in their own way. This one though, is all about understated sophistication. The more I sip, the more I like. I don’t need to say any more, just grab them whenever you see them. Cheers!

0.33 l bottle @ Beraria Kovaci, Bucharest.

Dark amber colour with burgundy hints, clear liquid, short white head.

Aroma has notes of dried plums, honey, caramel, raisins, malt, noble alcohol, dark chocolate.

Full body, average carbonation, bittersweet taste, oily texture, long finish.
Reddish muddy brown. Medium dense creamy head. Malty, caramel, dark fruit, toffee. Medium to full body. Bitter, sweet, smooth, desert-like finish.

Nice to try a "classic" doppelbock. I loved how heavy the malts were here, I guess this is the exact opposite of the IPAs. Roasted caramel, syrupy, honey, not "complex" but just really enjoyable to drink.
Large tan head very frothy. Caramel color and slightly cloudy. Caramel malt nose. Sweet malt flavor that lingers. Good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark orange with a very fizzy tan head. Aroma of prunes and dark chocolate. Tastes of vanilla, caramel and a bit of honey with a decent bitterness that lasts quite long. There’s a touch of alcohol in the background that suites the overall taste very well. Ok carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel. Very nice.
Ok beer, nothing special. I’ve had better beers, also from Paulaner. No beer you will find in my fridge, but I won’t say no if someone offers me one.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur ambrée et claire. Nez de pain, de caramel toffee aux notes rôties, avec des notes fruitées, de houblon, d’épices et d’alcool. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi qu’une texture aux notes liquoreuses. Goût très légèrement fruité (prune) lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi rapidement d’un goût de caramel toffee légèrement rôti avec un petit goût fruité aux faibles notes sûres (raisin, notes de cerises et de prunes) ainsi qu’un léger goût de pain puis finalement une légère amertume d’alcool et de houblon floral viennent s’installer. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer d’alcool avec une léger goût fruité et rôti avec des notes de houblon herbeux. .
Bottle. Pours red with a small off-white head. Strong taste of hops, malt, molasses, caramel, spices and alcohol. Full bodied. Long bitter aftertaste of malt and caramel. Not bad.

500 ml bottle, bought in Germany. Poured into a snifter glass. ABV 7,9%
Deep amber colour, hazy body. One finger of off-white head, with average retention and almost no lacing.
Aroma consists of mostly caramel, with some nice chocolate malts.
The taste is where this beer shines. Lots of chocolate, lots of coffee, a nice light bitter taste which becomes even more bitter on the aftertaste and invites you for one more sip.
Medium to full on the body, good amount of carbonation.
At first I wasn’t impressed by the appearance or the smell, but the taste was so good that it made up for everything else. Nice beer, recommended.

01.03.2013. 0,5l Bottle. Scandinavian Park, Flensburg. Amber brown colour with off-white head. Aroma is malty with sweetness and strength. Caramel and toffee together with dark malts, sweetness and bitterness.
Great beer, ruby/brown color,  very interesting sweet and bitter taste with caramel and toffee.

Bought a pint a local store for $1.25. Light brown/ruby in color, cloudy appearance with a tan head. Aroma is malt dominant, toffee, carmel, and toasted bread. Taste also is of roasted malts. Creamy mouthful, with a slight alcohol burn. Good beer, but would not seek out.

Clean dark amber color, medium creamy head, which disappears totally in couple of minutes. Light aroma of malt, caramel and some coffee. Taste is bitter sweet, with caramel malts, notes of dark fruits and spices, mildly bitter finish with gentle alcohol hit and hoppy aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Flavorful and balanced beer.

Beautiful dark reddish brown color,  thick foamy head, with rich malty flavors blended with molasses, caramel and a little alcohol taste at the end. Hearty, full-bodied. 
Buy some! Delicious.

Poured an amber color with some carbonation and a small head. Aroma was of bread, a little metalic and a little banana. After it warmed up, the metallic aroma dissipated. Taste was sweet, but not too sweet with a medium body. Definitely a beer I will be purchasing again and sharing with friends.

February 19, 2013 - bottle from Randall’s.  Light brown pour with nice amount of head.  Aroma was sweet malt, dark fruit and alcohol.  Taste was consistent with aroma maybe a caramel and chocolate mix and surprisingly noticeable alcohol with this clocking in at 7.9%.  Medium to full body and light carbonation.

Great color.  Kind of a deep orange brown.  Just a touch of bitter and a heavy malt flavor in the finish. Aroma is mildly sweet and flowery with  citris notes and mild molasses.  Mild carbonation an a light head.

Smooth toasted flavors of caramel and dark malt. Sweet while not being overpowering like some Belgian double or triples. You can taste the strength but the alcohol is in the background not ruining the malt. Lite bittering hops with mild carbonation and a thin half inch white head. Wonderful beer and the best doppelbock I have had no wonder the original is the best.

The aroma combines fig, dough, vanilla, and clove, and the color of the beer is a hazy chestnut with a minimal head. The taste is mildly bitter, slightly sweet, and slightly umami, but the palate has an average carbonation, a long yet slightly astringent finish, a medium body, and an oily texture.

Aroma: delicate bready, caramel, dried plums; Appearance: dark reddish brown, rather clear, moderately big off-white head; Taste: quite sweet, medium-low bitterness, little alcoholic/metallic; Palate: medium(+) body, oily feel, a little bit metallic, rather soft carbonation, quite long bittersour finish; Overall: very good, quite drinkable as for percentage and "fullness"
Mooie diep rode kleur. Maar voor de rest niet mijn ding. Te bitter en tezwaar voor dit type bier.
Bottle @ brewday. Aroma has caramel, spices, metallic malt. Flavour is big caramel, molasses, spices and a slight hop note. Nice.

Bottle. Dark amber with a lush red sheen. Thick off-white head with little sign of fading.  Nose of honey, caramel, and some sweet malt. In the mouth, there’s a slight alcohol kick... bags of malt, honey, some raisin, banana, some slight nuttiness. A really long, smooth finish with a little syrupyness. Incredible.

Dark amber, brown head. Nose is malty with caramel. Taste is dried plums, yeasty hints, lots of malt. Syrupy finish with malts, caramel and hop bitterness. Oily palate, medium body, discreet carbonation. Great balance, all that caramel and malt doesn’t become overpowering or cloying.

Bottle at all in hua hin, hua hin, thailand. Hazy medium brown color, big white head. Delicious wheaty and yeasty aroma, fruits. Balanced taste, wheat, licorice, sweetness, hint of alcohol reduces points but nice.
Caramel aroma, flavor, palate. Cloudy caramel color. Sweet and toast. Medium body with a long finish. Great Beer for winter times.

Small bottle. Semi-transparent orange/amber body with a medium head. Aroma has sweet toffee and some faint hints of alcohol. Smooth and light taste of caramel and dried fruit. Covers the 8% nicely, no sharp spikes. Smooth and sweet finish. Despite the high ABV it never becomes cloying or too hot. A true classic indeed. Re-rate: upping the score from 3.8 to 4.1. A high ABV beer that is rich yet easygoing at the same time. Never disappoints.

Great-looking, reddish copper with vivid reflections.Creamy head, disappears and leaves a layer of two mm. Strong aroma, caramel, black sugar are present. Body is moderate, creamy, nicely alcoholic. Finish reminiscent of licorice, cinnamon. Excellent flavor, very sweet. Reminds fruits, wood, candy, bread, ... huge roasted malt notes. Complex malt notes, good balance. Very sweet. Complex and powerful.
Apricot color with a thin head and a caramel, fruity, sweet nose. Easy entry with a mildly-carbonated, syrupy mouthfeel and a finish with overripe banana, raisin, caramel, and vanilla notes.
Pours an orange tinted amber with a small off-white head and little lacing.  Aroma is caramel, toffee, bread, malt.  The taste is similar to the smell with some alcohol coming on at the end.

50cl bottle(s) - Poors a less than inspiring translucent red-brown with modest beige head. Nice light roast and caramel, light-medium mouthfeel, distinct notes of alcholic burn and slight ethanolic fumes = not brewed down to perfection imho. Not unbalanced, drinkable, but disinterested in brewing anything more tasty than a traditional (60s70s80s80s) Doppelbock for the traditional palate. Initial Rating Date: 1/28/2013. -  -  - Rerate on tap in München 03/2015: gentle plum and pudding and soggy brown bread go gently into faint milk chocolate and plum jam and maroni caramels. This is the time for Starkbierfests where gentle beer connaisseurs are gently sipping their 1L mugs of this stuff at the Nockherberg and by 9pm are gently bashing their own and each other’s heads in. Not sure if I could even stomache a full Maß of this Doppelbrick...

reddish-brown colour; yellowish-off-white head, which (maybe thanks to the high alcohol content) disappears within some minutes; aroma of dried fruits, floral notes, bread, yeast extract and cheesy notes; taste of roasted notes, grains, dried fruits, some smoked cheese and syrupy sweetness; great doppelbock

Palack, most januárban éppen akciós a Práter utcai krimóban (Budapest)
Amikor a ’malátás’ szakszó már nyugodtan lecserélhető az édeskés szóra, de ereje miatt csepept sem "nőcis" sör. 
Klasszikus, alap, kötelező. Egy üveg nem elég, de kettő belőle már maga a Megváltás. 
Télvíz idején vényre is kapható (meseországban).

My favorite dopplebock, perhaps because it was my first.  It pours a dark amber. It smells sweet, malty, rich and yeasty like a loaf of homemade wheat bread. Very smooth and drinkable. Good out of the bottle, excellent on tap.
Amber with off white head. Malty sweet aroma. Flovar follows with caramel and raisin.  Nice dopplebock.

Color is deep reddish amber with a short lasting head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Taste is sweet malty and sugary, with little bitter finish.
I’m not a doppelbock lover, but  it was ok.
Very malty with a lot of hints of raisins and dried fruit. Rich and creamy with a good body.

Draught at Kaisla oluthuone pub. Another high quality product from Paulaner. Right after first mouthfull you feel that you choose right. Strong, very tasty - a lot of tropical fruits - pineapple, banana, mango. Nice bitter taste of hops. You dont need a whisky with this.
2012 - 01 - 14 500ml bottle. light-brown colour. very small off-white head. hint of caramel in the aroma. bitter-sweet taste.
One of the best beers I’ve tasted.  Alcohol level high, not that I’m complaining.
Tap. Copper with big foamy head. Smells like honey nut cheerios. Almost a hint of spice in the flavor and sweet and a little like bourbon. Round mouth feel, lightly sweet finish.

Bottle.  I have been drinking this for years, first one i’ve had for awhile.  Can’t forget how classic and defining for the style this is.  Pours a clear chesnut brown with no head.  Malt toffee and honey nose.  Very smooth malt caramel flavors.  Has a silk like palate and a clean finish with some burn.  This a great winter beer!

#20
Das Aussehen ist non-plus-ultra-geil!! Frisch vom Faß ist es auf Guinness-Niveau schwarz und dunkel mit geilem Schaum, herrlich!
Das Aroma ist eine Verheißung nach zartbitterem Malz und kräutiger Würzigkeit. Der Antrunk ist sämig, kraftvoll und unvergeßlich malzig lang... Im Geschmack kommt dieses bayerisch Blockmalz besonders beeindruckend rüber und trotz des relativ hohen Alk.-Gehalts ist die Süffigkeit geradezu grandios. Dazu Weißwürstel mit Kraut, Kartoffelpürre und süßem Senf und im 7. Himmel schweben...Weiß-blaue Glückseligkeit zum trinken!!
	
Test vom 14.5.2007, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 15,12,13,15,-,14 - 13,78

16.9 oz bottle.  Pours slightly hazy with a dark amber, copper color and a nice frothy off-white head that leaves no lacing and dissipates quickly.  Smells sweet and malty with notes of banana and a light chocolate.  Medium-bodied, slick and creamy with carbonation.  A malty, rich and lightly sweet flavor with a little chocolate and some light bitterness in the back.  Smooth and drinkable with a sweet and lingering finish.  Good stuff
Mild pleasant aroma. Dark golden appearance.  Somewhat sweet at first with no bitterness. Went surprisingly well with an Italian spiced lentil soup.

El hecho de saber que esta gente de Dios, sustituian la comida x cerveza, lo dice todo. Es una cerveza fuerte, espesa, para masticar. Sabores complejos y alcoholicos, con buen equilibrio entre malta y lupulo. Una cerveza, como Dios manda!!!

Pours a nice dark tan with fruit on the nose, my first dopplebock.  Very prominant and pleasing aromoa and deceptively smooth with a 7.9% abv, a good description fails me other than silky smooth palate with mild fruity tones and excellent drinkablility.
Bottle - fari size foamy head, dark amber/orange color, very sweet malty aroma and flavor, mild fruity hops

I’m not really a fan of the style but even I can recognize the quality in this beer.  Thick and richly sweet with toffee, licorice, and dark fruit.  Hops don’t play much of a role here with the exception of some subtle zing on the tongue.

Bottle. Pours clear full amber with thick off-white head. Dark aroma of hop, malt, and dried fruit. Very pleasant, bittersweet taste of barley malt and hop. A raisinlike and roasted note at the end. Really good. Drinking it Christmas eve, so it’s very appropriate, given the name :-)

Deep amber-brown with yellow-tan head.  Aroma of dried fruit, citrus hard candy, spiced biscuit, and brown sugar.  Flavor is mild dark fruit and fig with a sweet biscuit and toasted malt finish.  Lightly sweet at the end, but pretty well attenuated leading a very drinkable beverage.  Smooth, but somewhat lackluster.  A good example of the style.
Aroma of grain, molasses, toffee, dried fruits, and soft European hops. Sweet taste of caramel malts, with a dry, concrete-like finish. Alcohol imperceptible, medium-to-light mouthfeel.

Une couleur ambrée foncée avec une mousse grande. Ca c’est une bière qui met l’emphase sur le malt. Le nez et goût sont fort de malt. Je peu sentir quelque chose comme du banane aussi. Il est un peu sucré avec très peu d’amertume. Peut-être que je suis fou, mais je trouve le goût sucré a des traces de banane mure caramélisé.

On tap at Paulaner Brauhaus.  I had this bottled a few weeks ago but was able to get it on tap in Germany --- totally different.  This was very creamy and thick (for the style) and the sweetness of it lingered.  Alcohol gave it a warmth but never made it too "hot."  loved it.

this is a beer every beer lover and connoisseur should have in their beer-cellar. Round taste, powerful, this beer impressed me with its strong malty flavour and hints of dark fruits, but this beer is not as sweet as a belgian one,  this beer is very well balanced, close to perfection. Very very good beer!

BRown, malty, slightly bitter, malty, thin foam head, malty, and some dried fruit notes.
A nice malty bock!
Cheers

Deep red/brown with a thick lasting creamy tan head that rests into a thin ring on the surface. Smells of malt, caramel with lots of dried fruit like figs, dried apricot, dried banana and an overall booze hint. Medium to full thin oly body. Tastes os sweet malt that is overshadowed by the strong alcohol taste. Its really overpowering. Some wood, plum and caramel. Smooth to drink but needs to be worked on to get that strong taste out.
Bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, fruitiness, hay, grains and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, hay and grains. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer

Pours slightly deep amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel and fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

29/1/2018. Poured a hazy red-brown with a one- to two-finger light tan frothy head that retained very well but laced poorly. Carbonation high, lively and fine to medium. Aroma strongly of sweet caramel and malt. Taste is very sweet (too sweet) with caramel, toffee and dried dark fruits; very low bitterness. Medium body. Smooth with a very sweet but short finish. 1/12/2012. Draught at Bavairian Bier Cafe, Broadbeach. Poured a semi-translucent orangey red with virtually no head and no lace. Carbonation was very low to nil. Aroma strongly of yeast plus a subtle undertone of malt. Taste of sweet yeast followed by a slight bitterness. Light to medium body. Short slightly bitter finish.
Smells a bit pumpkin-y. Tastes very malty, honey and cranberry, quite sour but very savory. Sticky feel. Worth going back for seconds.

Caramel color with small brownish head. Aroma of brown sugar, raisins, figs and dark fruits. Taste is smooth, well balanced with the right amount of sweetness and you cannot feel the alcohol content at all. Really good beer.

great beer - very savory.  Ate spicy Kra Prau (thai food) with it.  Was amazing...   This beer is like rich raisin bread, but wheat bread and not really bready at all.  The flavor is raisins, and the mouthfeel is a little oily.  Great beer.
Bottle - Hazy orange/amber pour with no head.  Aroma of honey and grains.  Taste like aroma, with toasted bitterness.  Mouthfeel a bit syrupy and not very bubbly.  Decent.
Just no. Doppelbock. I’m gonna rename Doppelbock to Doppelbollocks. That’s how I roll.

Bottle. Pours clear amber colour with light brown head, that almost completly disappear in a minute. Sweety aroma of cherry, liquor,, ruby port, caramel and tiny note of smoke. Taste is sweet at 1st sip, but when tongue get used on it, after few sips, it is acctualy moderate bitter and goes to heavy bitter in the aftertaste. This beer has medium to full body and oily texture with soft carbonation. There are also some alcohol notes. Paulaner Salvator is proof, that Germans can do a good beer.

Bought from Makro cash & carry in Kifissou str. Pours light brown with beige foam. Aroma is light caramel. Taste with notes of coffee, alcohol is well hidden, carbonation is soft. In general a good beer.

Deep copper pour with a nice, slightly yellowish head. Grainy aroma with hints of caramel/toffee and light vanilla and flour sugar. taste is sweet caramel in abundance. Light hints of bitterness in the finish, with a nice detour involving raisins and more malty sweetness and a slight slight hint of alcohol. Medium body and soft carb.
7.8% very dark amber colour with a poor head, malt aroma, sweet fruity but strong taste, very good.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham.  Clear auburn which despite my best pouring efforts was headless within minutes.  Strong aroma of syrup, orange and fruit cake.  Initially bitter taste and rough mouthfeel, giving way to burning alcohol feel, bitter, smokey, wooden, liquorice, Marmite, malt, yeast, milk, sugar, salt, flour, lemon juice, 2 eggs, then whisk together until creamy and bake in the oven on gas mark 7 until golden.  Delicious.

Probably the first Doppelbock I ever had.  Filtered ruby-garnet red.  Thin, steady head.  Sweet, deep, pungent aroma.  Damn true to style but maybe not the most enjoyable beer out there.  Pungent prune, licorice, yeast notes.  Cleanish body, very refined and drinkable despite the intense yeast tones.  Gets more bready and mild the more it mellows out and warms up a bit.  Full bodied but not into overboard territory.  Classic.

Pours a dark amber colour with a one finger white head. Really strong sour aroma with oak as the primary smell. Flavour of oak, alcohol and raisins. Really low carobonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Maybe a bit boring after three tastes. An avarage beer imo.

500ml bottle. Aroma is malty and sweet. Has a brown, clear color with a small white head. Taste is sweet and light bitter. Has a full and complex body with a caramel and toffee finish. Overall a nice Bock beer.
Malty and a bit of caramel aroma.  Pours a dark amber with a small fizzy head.  The taste is balanced, with some caramel, roast and sweetness.  A little warm, but it is compensated by the full body.
My first dopplebock, and I must say that now this is one of my favorite beers, tasty, malty, balanced alcoholic taste, lightly sweet and complex enough.
Zajímavé polotmavé pivo, trochu méně hořké než by bylo ideální. Doppelbock se asi nestane mým oblíbeným pivem. lahváč z Mnichova
Brown color, caramel and burn aromas. So malty with full body and lot of alchool.
Small white head. Red-brownish colour. Wonderful woody, caramel aroma. Tart taste and a full-flavoured, aromatic finish. My favourite bock beer.
Chestnut brown colour mokka head which dissapears quick, sweet hay sour smell, bitter cacao/chocolate hints but also fresh, flower like, medium carbonation

Bottle. Terrific scent right away. Sort of like candy apple with a bit of cinnamon. No head. Low carbonation but not flat. Very dry alcohol taste with sweet maltiness and resinous texture. Almost a belgian dubbel taste to it.
On tap in the Paas. Poured amber with no real head. Aroma of sweet malt and dark fruit. Medium bodied, quite hoppy flavour with some caramel malt and dark fruir. Dry, bitter aftertaste.
Decent doppelbock, however not as dark and rich as Ayinger Celebrator. I will finish the 6 pack but not purchase again.

Clear ruby color with light brown foam head, sadly enough fast completely disappearing. Aroma is malty caramel as a bock should be. Taste also is as expected. A good decent bock, not too sweet, but also not outstanding. (Velp 201210)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Cloudy amber brown color. Thin tan head that disappeared quickly. Aroma of brown sugar, raisin, and wheat. Flavor was caramel, raisin, and toasty malts. Slight malt bitterness on the finish.

Poured in tulip glass (not big tulip like Judas but  Alhambra 1925 glass)


A:   brown and amber

S:   bitter hops combined with fruits

T:     again bitter hops and fruits. Toasted .

M:    Long bitter aftertaste. Full-medium body and regular carbonation.

O:    nice doppelbock. Good balance
Brown colour. Caramel aroma. Taste is sweet malty caramel with some alcohol.

From Notes, 4/27/11:

Poured 12 oz bottle into my strictly functional and not pretentious Weihenstephaner stange.

A: Hazy amber color with a little burnt orange around the edges. Light carbonation rises to the top of the glass. Slight cream head that dissipates quickly. No white lacing.

S: I like the malty aromas that come with Doppelbocks, so no disappointment here. Buttery bread, caramel with some fruity sweetness in the background.

T: Sweet malts dominate, hops are just enough to let you know they’re still there and bring some balance. Fruity smell becomes something like fig in the taste. Honey and caramel are present.

M: Syrupy, but not too much so. Alcohol there, but smoothness is nice.

O: Will pick this up again if the mood strikes for a sweet, sipping beer with moderate body. Would recommend to those exploring the Doppelbock style.

Dark amber, small tan head.  Strong aroma of alcohol (7.9%) and Belgian-style yeasts.  Toasted malts, sweet caramel.  Full body.  Lighter and sweeter than Spaten Optimator.  Although not my style, this is pretty tasty.

Not a bad doppelbock but there are better. Bready malt aroma. Watery chocolate brown with a frothy head. Almost all malt and no hops presence. More of the same bready malt with a sharp aftertaste, almost like burnt toast. The alcohol was noticeable as well.

Murky brown-orange beer, the foam disappears a bit quick. Aroma of malts, dark fruits and spices, slightly some hops, not bad, a bit liquorish. About the same with the taste, slightly the biterness gets in at the end. Not bad, but neither great.
33cl. Dark red color with a white dissapearing head. Sweet aroma, fruity flavor with a hint of yeast. Good alchool aftertaste. Very good beer
Enjoyable mouthfilling malty taste with well-balanced aftertaste. Solid dobbelbock.
330 ml bottle. Pours a dark amber/orange with light head. Aromas of sweet cereal, biscuits, and malt with a little caramel. Flavors of sweet malts, toast, and burnt sugar.

My father in-law keeps giving me ticks like this. Keep em’ coming old man ;)
Pour copper/light nut-brown with a large frothy tan head. Aroma of bread, hay, slight leather, weak and old hops, nuts. Overall quite malty. Taste is rather bitter. Slightly watery body, with a semi-flat carbonation.
Reddish pour with a very thin head.  Aroma of sugar.  Thin mouth.  Taste is pretty muted.  Super light weight with some caramel and fruit.

Obtained in a trade thx. to drunkenaim // 50 cl. bottle split with Kraddel and Dennoman @ Gollem // copper amber with a small white head // smells of watery synthetic caramel, pils malts, synthetic toffee, copper, grains // skunky, synthetic caramel and toffee, grains, pils malt, bitter floral, fake biscuit, metallic, bitter plastic finish // light body // either this bottle has gone over the edge or the total score and reputation for this one make no sense
0,5 l bottle. One of the Bock Classics. Pours in nearly brown but clear. Nose is a bit earthy and caramel. Aroma is caraml with some herbs. Great beer.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Nice, intensive beer with dark colour and low head. Flavours of roasted nuts and grains.
Bottle. A good doublebock. Sweet notes of caramel and marzipan. Small spiciness. Maybe a bit too sweet.
Bottle@tasting (2003), 50cl. Head: beige colored foam. Color: ruby. Aroma: malt. Taste: sweet, bitter. Palate: sweet, bitter, watery, medium body. Overall: nice
No doubt this is the best of paulaner, poors cooper, great yellow head. Sweet aroma but get lost with alcohol.  Malt and caramel in the taste. Good co2, soft bitterness at the end. A great beer

Buah!. De las mejores cervezas que he probado. Nada más depositarla en la copa, su aroma te embauca, literalmente. Pero es que al beberla, sus fuertes pero satinados sabores hacen que el beberla no sea un simple mecanismo, sino toda una celebración. Grandiosa.

Very sweet. Malts are ever present. Sits heavy. Can get one down. Nice brew overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Durchaus leckerer Doppelbock für meine Geschmack ist der Alkoholgeschmack im Nachgeschmack minimal zu kräftig. Leider nicht von der "kleinen Brauerei um die Ecke".

Wow! This is the doppelbock! Orange/copper color with one finger head fading to skin on glass. Caramel notes, roasts grains, light bitterness. This is one of my favorites and never disappoints. Truly delicious! Just as good as the first time!

0.33l bottle from Barley Wine, Copenhagen. Have been looking forward to this one! This is a cloudy glowing amber beer with a small islandy bubbly off-white head. It smells both sweet candy-like but also a strange kind of almond-fruitiness with tones of caramel. A strange but really interesting aroma! It’s really comfortably carbonated, small prickling bubbles and a silky oily texture. Flavors have lot’s of malt-sweetness, caramel, some alcohol dancing in the background before it ends in a almost watery and dark-fruity bitterness. Almost feels like it has a light spicy aftertaste, but most likely just the alcohol that’s fooling me. Yeah, a scary beer to drink, and quite a good one! 20.06.2012
Aroma of dark malts. Some sweetness. A little sweet. Not very bitter. Lasting aftertaste with flavours of malt and malt sweetness.

half liter bottle.  Pours copper with a nice, tight, finger of tan head, uneven bubbles, and a good bit of lacing.  Aroma is not overly pungent but has some dark fruit, brown sugar, a little caramelized malt.  The taste is very malty and sweet but has just enough of a hop bite in the finish to balance the brew a bit.  This beer is more enjoyable than many similar as the alcohol is not present.  Pretty good.

Dark and clear.  Smelled very malty, caramel, coffee (?).  Unsurprisingly, quite sweet, also bitter.  Could definitely could taste the alcohol.  Dry finish.  Average carbonation, medium/full body.  Good, but definitely a sipper.

Bottle from Rewe, Freising (poured into a glass!) consumed on train to Regensburg - 27/04/12.
Hazy brown to dirty orange with a good finger and more of off-white head.
Caramel and malts dominate the aroma with a background of yeast and nuts.
Biscuity malts in the taste, sweet dried fruit and a touch of caramel in the taste.
Medium bodied, a little chewy but the alcohol is well disguised.
Decent D’bock!
Es riecht fruchtig nussig. Dunkler Ton aber dennoch hell. Bitter und sehr herb im Geschmack. Der nachgeschmack erinnert an zartbitter Schokolade.

Had it at a Paulner brewhaus....in North Station (a Boston train station)  ... very good for its style.  Deep caramel color with a tan head.  Strong but not overwhelming taste.  Caramel and malts with a pleasant long aftertaste.  Worthy of it’s rank.

Bread, sweet dough, cookie, candy sugar, and malty aroma.  Dark brown-copper pour.  Taste is sweet and sugary, but still beer.  Has plenty of malt sweet malt taste.  Overall you really have to try it, but being a lover of 10 Rochefort, this makes a close substitute for the money.

28/VII/2012 - 50cl bottle @ Crystal’s place - BB: VII/12 - (2012-773) Thanks to Caytinator for sharing the bottle!


Clear amber to red brown beer, small yellowish head, unstable, non adhesive, dissipates immediately. Aroma: sweet caramel, dried fruits, raisins, bit sugary, milk chocolate, malty. MF: soft to no carbon, medium to full body. Taste: caramel, dreid fruits, raisins, spicy, sweet hoppy touch. Aftertaste: mocha, dark chocolate, caramel, some spices, peppery, orange peel, green banana.
I was a little surprised at this one. I wouldn’t classify this one as "great," but this was better than I thought. Lots of maltiness to the taste and smell.
bottle- A rich, deep, amber-brown colour: a buttery-malty aroma ; and a toffeeish flavour, drying in a long, moreish  finish
Pours a bright amber color, but the taste is not as full as other doppelbocks.
Not as good as some other double bocks, but this one has the typical flavors considered of the type of beer. Just okay.
Bottle from Alko. Amber color, white head. Malty taste with plum, fruits. Some roastiness in finish. Good brew.

Aroma has sweet, dark malt; even syrup. Hazy amber with nit much head. Taste has also sweet malt, bread, alcohol, currant. Mildly roasted. Fullbodied, oily soft, mild carbonation. Overall.. liked the beautiful colour. Think this is a pure and personal example of it’s style. Just not one of my favorites.
Dark colour, complex but smooth mature and fruity flavour and delicate sweet aroma. 500ml bottle.

Pours a pretty light copper color with non-sustaining off white head and no lacing. The aroma is very malty with maybe a hint of caramelization and prunes. The taste is primarily sweet malt, but  not over the top sweetness. There is also a toasty quality present and a hint of dark fruit. I think I detected a note of alcohal in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is medium and smooth. I wouldn't want to drink more than one at a time, but I will definiatly drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle- Pours a rich amber color with a head that fades slowly to some lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and some caramel sweetness with some herbs and spice and hint of chocolate. Taste of dark fruit and some caramel sweetness with some spice and bit of chocolate in the background. There is a muted bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, smooth and creamy with a rich texture. Good doppel back.This beer has been around for a while so they seem to have it right.
This beer offers a rich taste, rich buzz, and if being drank in a group, a great clanking of the mugs.  Great with Greek and middle eastern foods.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a lightly cloudy dark ruby with no head. Aroma is caramel and dark fruits. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Caramel, dark fruits, and some light spicy hops. Medium bodied with a somewhat thin yet sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a decently long finish. Overall, not bad. Pretty standard doppelbock.
Creme com boa durabilidade, aroma de café e mel. Cerveja forte com leve adocicado e de boa duração. Excelente pedida!
Versión tostada de la Paulaner. Bastante buena. Mejor de barril que de botella.

On tap, pours a clear dark reddish amber with a nice off white head and lacing in the glass, the aroma is very sweet with a good amount of caramel and malt, the flavor is solid with a front end of caramel and a finish of slight spices, mouthfeel is very creamy and smooth, delicious.
Bottle. Pours caramel-brown with a slight head. Malty sweet aroma. A smooth double bock, that finishes on the tongue. Tasty.

Pours a cloudy copper - a little light for the style - with a thin white head that fades quickly. Minimal lacing. Sweet, malty, caramel aroma. Full, creamy mouthfeel. Sweet taste, lightly offset by some hop bitterness. Iconic representative doppelbock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

had on draft and is much better than in the bottle.  sweet maltyness finishes with some spice that is out of this world and just lovely.  light mouthfeel that deceives you of the higher alcohol content.

330 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy golden brown with a half inch tan head that lasts.  Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, fruit and spice.  Similar, but lighter aroma.  The body is creamy and finishes with some warming alcohol.  Good, but not that great.

bottle. It pours a cloudy red/orange color with a small head. The aroma has red fruit, plum, raisin with some dry lager yeastiness and dense malt profile. There’s some mild floral hops as well. The flavor is very fruity with raisins, plum and some alcohol. The dry maltiness comes later before a medium spicy, floral hop finish. There are better doppelbocks out there, but this is very balanced and satisfying. A classic.
Ceverja forte, com bom sabor e um pouco amarga. Mas no final uma boa pedida pra qualquer dia.
Barva jantarově hnědá. Pěna řidší. Vůně: nádherná karamelově sladová. Chuť: plné vyvážené pivo, středně hořké s výraznýou sladovou chutí a středním chmelovým dozvukem

pours a hazy amberwith an almost smoky, sweet aroma. flavour is sweet wheat malt with with smoky, earthy flavour that’s hard to describe.finishes with a subtle bitterness that hides the abv well.great take on the style.
Very strong for the beer. has a great aroma with lots of malty goodness. rich high body flavor with little hops flavor. very strong, very tasty.
12 ounce bottle at the Brass Tap, poured a dark amber color, aromas of sweet malt, roasted malt, and some nuts.  Flavors follow suit with a light hop flavor.  Slight alcohol flavor aftertaste.

Pours a red amber with light carbonation and somewhat of a head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, grain behind them, and some butterscotch. Flavors of butterscotch, toffee, caramel, slight grain and a hint of whiskey. Has a medium sweetness and almost no aftertaste. Really has flavors that are close to the butterscotch candy. Pairs well with milk chocolate and peanut butter.
At Paulaner am Dom Frankfurt. Very smooth. No soy sauce aroma or flavor. A little minerally. Nice.  Serving: Bottle.

Bottle. Pours hazy-near clear amber copper with creamy light tan head. Aromas of bread grain noble hops and a cloying toffee/malt sweetness. Medium-full body, medium light carbonation, toffee, figs, grainy fruity flavour. Finish sees the flavours linger in a very satisfying way. Top beer, but not the top Doppelbock.

Cloudy red beer. Sweet scent. Tart finish. Mild carbonation well rounded flavor and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark orange and ruby color with very little head.  Aromas of bubblegum, banana, and dark malt.  Taste is very very sweet to start but mellows through the finish.  Very crisp and smooth but not overly complex or exciting to me.  A nice beer to sit and sip for a while.  A good dopplebock but nothing like Aventinus or Celebrator.
From old backlog. Hazy amber colour with small white head. Sweet, malty beer. Would like to try again.

Rating #47 for 2012

12oz bottle cold from a stem glass. Shared with three people and we all agreed that this beer smelled a bit foul though its BB Date was in 2013. Aroma heavy rotten pumpkin, finishes with a much more pleasant mix of pumpkin and cinnamon. 1/4 inch head over a red amber beer expected it to be darker. Pumpkin and mild spice came through, finished oily. Very thin palate almost no carbonation. Very boring will drink again just to see if a different bottle will be better.

11.2oz or something bottle. Poured a red-amber color with a very small white head. Aroma is very sweet malts, bready, almost like scotch. Flavor is pretty much sweet malts - lots of toasted and nutty notes too. Malt, malt, malt. Alcohol makes itself known - just a bit.

Bottle from Makro, Thessaloniki: One of my favorite beers and the one that got me into the beer world! Deep red colour, with a white/beige frothy head. Aroma of caramel, red fruits, dried fruits, raisin (maybe). Sweet taste. Medium body, with long finish and averrage carbonation. Overall, very good beer! A must for my cellar!
Poured from bottle deep orange copper  color with tan head. Aroma of caramel, bread with some molasses and acachol. Taste of some fruity.
Diverse flavour and a stronger taste than the usual Paulaners. Certainly is a wonderful winter beer.

330 ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy amber with medium-sized beige head that creates a lacing. Aroma has caramel malt, honey and hops. Taste is nicely bittersweet with plenty of licorice, blackcurrant, toast and caramel malt. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and nice licorice finish. Low to medium carbonation. A delicious and well-balanced beer that offers a challenge.

Clear, deep ruddy orange copper with 3-finger tan head that vanished after a couple minutes. Aroma of sweet caramel, bread and toffee malts with molasses and alcohol. Tasty is malty and fruity with sweet caramel malts, toffee, brown sugar and hearty flavors.

Poured from 11.2 oz bottle.  "Best before 01/12.".  Oops!

Clear, deep ruddy orange copper with 3-finger tan head that vanished after a couple minutes.   Virtually no lacing. 

Aroma of sweet caramel, bread and toffee malts with molasses and alcohol. 

Tasty is malty and fruity with sweet caramel malts, toffee, brown sugar and enough indeterminate hops to give it balance. 

Body is on the full side of medium carbonation is on the low side.  Slick mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy red orange color with virtually no lacing. Candied fruit cake and baking spices on the nose. You get a little fruit cake on the palate without being overly sweet. Great bread feel with a nice malt character through and through. Kudos for getting the style damn near perfect.

Location/Date:Bottle on May 8th, 2012.



Appearance:Pours a copper clear.
 

Aroma: Sweet, bready.
 

Taste: Light bitterness, lots of sweet caramel malt.
   

Palate:Medium body light.



Summary: Thanks Jay for the bottle! I always prefer my German-style beers for the most part from Germany(Great Lakes is an exception), and this one is pretty solid.

33cl Brown bottle best before 08/2007, drank 12/2006. 

Part of a six-pack purchased while in Bavaria for the Munich O’fest during 2006, sad to break them up really. I shall have to drink the rest before they get lonely! 

See through reddish brown, sat in a Palm beer tulip glass, no head, which in my opinion ruins the look of a beer, no matter what style. 

Sweet aroma of caramel malts, getting stronger as the beer warmed in the glass. 

Fine balance of flavours and alcohol content, but the mouthfeel is watery for the strength of this beer, which is why my scores are all over the place. I don’t understand how the first taste of every sip is so good, but the mouthfeel is so weak, strange.

Poured a medium thin tanned head, which it made a reasonable attempt to retain. Dark amber colour with a slight haze. Smelled very boozy, blocked out everything else. Tasted dark chocolate, hints of plumb, caramel. Had a very long boozy finish. Thick texture, almost chewy, some gas. Overall very boozy, a bit too much.

Draught at Bavarian Bier Cafe in Sydney during their "Pure Bier Fest" throughout May. Pours translucent copper-brown with a medium cream white head showing good retention and lace. Rich caramel malt aroma with doughy yeasts and fruity hops. Yeasty bready palate with cherries and sultanas and mild bitter finish with the alcohol coming through right at the end. Good chewy body with perfect carbonation. Really enjoyed this one.
50 cl. bottle @ home. Copper brown with a huge tan head. Aroma of roasted malts with some coffee. Round mouthfeel, lively carbonation and some alcohol warmth. Overall a great beer.

April 28, 2012:
From bottle, served in a branded pilsener glass at Biercraft on Cambie. Not much head. Nice aroma, and a light coppery color. Taste is understated, low key, but somewhat complex. Yeasty, bready, somewhat fruity. Very nice, mild beer.

May 24, 2018:
From a tall can bought at Firefly on Cambie St in Vancouver. Same delicious doppelbock I sampled 6 yrs ago. Not quite the equal of the Ayinger Celebrator, but very nice! 3.9

28-APR-2012, bottle @home, from "Superbest". 
Rye bread nose with a touch of bitterness. 
Taste the same. I do not like that bitterness. Partly from standard hops and partly from alcohol. 
OK drink but not more than that.
Tap @Põrgu. Hazy copper color. Thin head, dissapears quickly. Caramel, sweet malts aroma. Bitter start, followed by burnt honey, roasted malts. Nice beer.
Pours dark foggy brown.  Aroma of fruit and caramel.  Malty taste reflects the aroma. Not strong.  Mediocre beer.

There is a slight sweetness that accompanies the malt, at first I didn't like but sip after sip became one of the many things I love about this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep copper colour with a tan head. A bit sweet caramel and light fruity aroma. Sweet and a deep malty taste with a fruity finish. Also some alcohol.
[Bottle from a supermarket in Kiel, Germany]
Caramel aroma, flavor, palate. Cloudy caramel color. Sweet and toast. Medium body with a long finish. Great Beer for winter times.

Appearance: medium copper brown with a yellowish, medium frothy  head that mostly diminished down to a very small amount of residue with a tiny collar.
Aroma: malt, hints of caramel, dark fruit (figs and plums), and was a bit nutty. 
Taste: Sweet and ended a tad bitter and mildly sweet with a strong note of dark fruit and a mild alcohol tinge. 
Palate: medium/full body, moderate carbonation with medium to long finsh. .

330 mL bottle. Pours a hazy, dark, orange-brown with a medium, tan head. The aroma is bread, brown sugar, a little earthy and pine hops, and brandy. The flavor is very sweet, with a little bitterness. The palate is medium to heavy, nicely effervescent, sticky, and creamy. The aftertaste is long, sticky and sweet, with only a hint of alcohol warming. Overall, this is a wonderfully malty beer, with good complexity and a deceptively smooth mouthfeel.
A bit too sweet and more pale than other doppelbocks. Try it and move on for there are far better of this style out there

Bottle from local Yamaya discount store.Sweet thick roast malt aroma with lots of prunes. Dark cloudy orange-brown. Thick, rich brown sugar flavors. Sweet aftertaste with a bit of alc. warmth in the throat. Very smooth and pleasant -- but just about on the edge of cloying. A well-made doppelbock.
Update 11/18/2012: 2008 Vintage. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Aroma: Fumes, smoke, slight oxidation. Appearance: Light dirty brown. Taste: Light but bright dark fruit; sweetness settles in mid palate; final has al. warmth and just a touch of bitterness. Body: thin-medium. Overall: Very smooth, flavors are somewhat diminished. Nice stuff. 
7/3/7/3/14 -- 3.4

Pours a cloudy dark amber with orange hue, thin light tan head, no lacing.  Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, herbal hops, a light brown sugar.  Flavor is complex, sweet, and matches the aroma well.  This is a pretty nice (and slightly different) doppelbock.
Wow, brilliant beer! I’d like to compare this to Strong Belgian Ale, really exceptional in the German market. Great full taste and overall a wonderful doppelbock.
pours an amber color a little hazy with no head. aroma of caramel. Begins as a medium sweetness and then finishes with a light bitterness.

Bottle. Poured a wonderful copper/reddish color. The aroma was of caramel and candy. There are some interesting flavors that include dark fruit, candi sugar, caramel, (a touch of) roast, and malt.  Delicious.  My girlfriend remarked, "if this were a candy, I’d eat it everyday."  I’m not exactly sure if that is a compliment or not when considering this beer, but I thought it was note-worthy.

Alla spina. Bel color rame limpido con una solida schiuma beige. Aroma delicato di malti scuri con sentori di luppoli e frutta secca; gusto nella media dello stile con tracce di caramello, zucchero e sentori abbrustoliti/legnosi. Corpo medio ed effervescenza mite; sfortunatamente il sapore è fastidiosamente dolciastro e un po’ appiccicoso e sfocia in un retrogusto acquoso: forse era un fusto rovinato o è stata spillata male, devo provarla in bottiglia.
Bottle.  Translucent amber pour.  Aroma of caramel and green grapes that are overripe and drying on the vine.  Taste is sweet wheat bread and undertones of alcohol.  Enjoyable beer.

Bottle. The pour was a medium copper brown with a yellowish-amber hue and a large (2-3 finger) cream colored frothy head that mostly diminished down to a very small amount of residue with a tiny collar, which produced some poor lacing.

The aroma was of a light biscuit malt, and a sweet doughy yeast with notes of caramel, dark fruit (figs and plums), and was a bit nutty.

Taste was sweet and very malty with a big note of caramel in the beginning and ended a tad bitter and mildly sweet with a strong note of dark fruit and a mild alcohol tinge. The flavor lasted an average time after the swallow with a nice sweet fruity taste left behind along with a nice mild alcohol warming sensation.

Mouthfeel was a bit under medium in body and dry yet a tiny bit syrupy in texture with a moderate carbonation.

Overall a very impressive beer with a really good blending of malts, fruit and sweetness which made this a wonderful tasting experience...

Gloriously opaque bronze crowned with a modest khaki foam....copious malt emanation, nutty sweetbreads and smatterings of toasty sugar. Silky body with warming thread. Steady layers of flavor through to lightly bitter end. Meal in a glass indeed.
Pours amber with a off white head.  Aroma of roasted malts, fruit and hops.  Taste is sweet malt and a spicy bitter finish.

Folds into the glass with a reddish amber glow crowned by a creamy tan head. Nose is of caramel and malt. Thick viscosity, this double bock is a creamy nectar on the palate. Taste is rich and full of carmalized malt, some sweetness and a touch of hops to finish slightly dry. An excellent beer that has stood the test of time. Can be enjoyed as a meal unto itself or paired with a variety of snacks including nuts, pretzels or cheese and crackers.
Pours a clear red with a tan head.  Smells of grains - malty, like multi-grain bread and nuts.  Taste is sweet with a mild bitterness, very true to it’s style.
On tap. Lovely amber color with average head. Strong fruity aroma. Taste of fruits and spices, strongly alcoholic.

This is an amazing beer. Crisp malt aroma with just a bit of alcohol. The body is full with lots of malt and a good balance of bitterness at the end and just a bit of alcohol warmth. It’s very clean and warming and great for a late winter beer. An old favorite that still lives up to my memory.

I can’t help myself...this is one of my absolute favourite beers of all time. The aroma is a wonderful blend of caramel, nuts and some kind of dark fruit, coming closest to ripe cherries. The appearence is red/amber/brown with a quickly disappearing head. Taste is sweet to bitter, caramel, nuts and again the cherry flavour. Average carbonation and long lasting aftertaste - some alcoholic notes shimmer through, warming the throat. Outstanding brew!
Bottle. Clear bronze body with an average sized off-white head. Strong malty aroma-caramel, bread. Flavour on the sweeter wide of balanced, but with a toasty, bitter background finish. Medium bodied.

Ovanpå den kopparröda ölen lägger sig ett stort fluffigt skum, som snart försvinner. Rätt svag arom, där citrus och röda bär ändå lever fint. Smaken desto bättre, med honung, citrus och smörkola som främsta kännetecken.

0.5 bottle. Warm malty aroma with noticeable bread, corn and scotch scents. Amber color and a small rapidly disappearing head, nothing special. Taste is incredibly sweet, some sour tones can be noticed but the amount of sugars is so extensive that sweetness predominates the entire experience. Medium to full body with indication to the latter, sticky texture and average carbonation. Finish introduces some variation from the original taste with its bitter tones, quite nice and balanced. Overall the beer is pretty average, incredibly sweet and syrup like, the main problem is that even though it creates a cozy mood, it doesn’t suit such situations as reading a book by a fireplace.

aroma, bread cereal, slight hop in the nose
color, poured into stiener, hazy meduim amber, head comes up then fades.
taste, carmel on the front, then burnt sugar emerges, and fcascades, down
overall, very good, singles rack at Monsters, good price too!

A great crisp beer. I like it. It pours nicely with a dark shade.               

   

---Rated via Beerology
Heavy beer with very strong, warming aromas. Tasted lots of caramel and coffee, and hints of fruits in the beggining. App clear, amber, tan foam, Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,
awesome taste of decoction mashing and caramels. A bit sweet but super nice and complex.

33 cl bottle. BBE 10/2012.

Pours clear amber color with large foamy head. Aroma of caramel malts, ripe fruits, sugar, earth, yeast and some grass. Flavor of sweetish caramel, lots of malts, ripe fruits, some toffee, nuts and mild spicy notes. Smooth and somewhat creamy palate.

5425

0.5L bottle.  My favorite German beer of all time.  The quintessential Dopplebock.  Aroma is strong and malty.  Medium head dissipates quickly,  bold amber color, hazy.  Medium bitterness blends well with medium sweetness, and a little alcohol taste at the end.  Hearty, full-bodied, delicious.
Caramel, woody, alcohol, nuts, butterscotch, licorice, cooked vegetables, leather and honey.
Cloudy amber color with a small white head. Toffee aroma. Sweet and heavily malty beer.

Draught at Porter&Sons, Tel Aviv. Pours hazy dark amber, bight, light tan head. Uncooked malt, oatmeal and honey aroma, sweet malt, biscuit, honeycomb taste. Light body, fizzy, long finish. A little too sweet to my liking.

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy dark amber color with large creamy brownish head and low carbonation. Aroma of caramel malt, spicy hops and fruits. Sweet malty taste of caramel, warming mouthfeel and light hoppy aftertaste. Full bodied, oily textue and soft carbonation in palate. One of the best Paulaner products...

Tastes malty, some caramel.  Didin’t have a super strong taste but it’s heavily drinkable.  Was expecting a little more from all the marketing.  Colour is good and the body is decent. on tap at beer bistro

Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a soapy off white head that fades to a wispy film and foamy collar. Aroma has nice spice and figs with some banana as well. Taste is good sweet fruit sugar and malty with a faint warming finish. Palate is medium with solid carbonation and finishes malty and dry. Solid brew!

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Beautiful clear light ruby color with medium non-durable off-white head. Much lighter color than regular Doppelbocks. Smoky odor with caramel and some bread. Light aroma with caramel, sugar, alcohol and some hiding herbs. Dominant, medium sweet taste. Light body with creamy oily texture and lively carbonation. It’s a beautiful, light colored Doppelbock. Lighter aroma, not too much of roasted malt. It’s a standard among Doppelbocks, the first one. Classic one.

Very good. The nose is big and bready with notes of citrus and fruit. The beer is deep hazy brown with almost no head.  The taste is very malty with a lot of caramel and some spice. The palate is smooth and thick.

Smells like honey and lemon. Strong scent if ethanol that goes away as the beer warms. Taste starts and finishes sweet. Honey lemon some caramel and malts. 

I poured a very nice head into a weizen glass which sadly did not last. Became flat rather quickly. 

Not my style but sure glad I tried this one. Liked it better than korbinian since korbinian is a dunkel double bock which makes more like a stout

Currently drinking while typing. No huge aroma coming from the stein it’s been poured into, primarily it has scents of malts, toastiness, sweetness, brown sugar, caramel and a general cereal taste. The beer has a lovely light brown rusty glowing colour with a subtle haze but relatively clear, when poured the head arose as a bubbley off-white tan colour but soon shrank into a clear surface with no sign of a head being there! Almost like pouring Coca-Cola. Good malty taste, subtle booziness, slightly sweet, cereals, toastiness, yeasts, burnt sugars and a very tiny bit of hop in the aftertaste but mainly a buttery cereal taste and an ever so slight bitterness in the very last part of the finish. Good fullness and good body to this with great smoothness but lacking enough carbonation, better carb would severely improve this beers enjoyability. A nice doppelbock flavour but with a slightly unpleasant lack of carbonation and head formation, apart from this, it’s a nice beer.

Bottle , pours cloudy, dark orange with minimal light tan head. Heavy malt scent, caramel,sweet fruits...Flavour is thickly malted, plums or figs, very sweet, nearly a sticky, syrupy feel in mouth after.  overall, a very enjoyable beer..a little heavy to drink more than one at a sitting, though.

Dark cloudy amber in color with off white head that doesn’t retain for too long. Distinct caramel toffee aromas that isn’t overly sweet. Little taste of hops balances the malty caramel flavors very well. Moderate carbonation makes it Easy to drink. A great doppelbock.

Poured a hazy orange/brown color with a medium-sized off-white head.  Aroma has oranges and caramel with some toffee.  Taste is big and malty with some alcohol.  Some interesting flavors, plums and dates.  A slight touch of cardboard with more alcohol in the finish.  Overall pretty flavorful and well balanced.  A good doppelbock.

Pours a dark amber color with a small white head that dissipates into a ring. Very nice aromas of caramel, toasted malt and dark fruit. Flavors much of the same. Creamy mouthfeel with a sweet finish but it could have been a bit fuller. A good beer from a good brewery.

Apeearance was cloudy caramel with 1 finger head that disppears quickly with no lacing. Aroma was sweet figs, chocolate, biscuity, butterscotch, nutty thing of beauty. Taste was chocolaty herbal  delight with slight alcohol. Mouthfeel was creamy light carbonation chewy-like full body with a long dryish finsih.Mmmmmmmm...
I had this one a long time ago. If I have the chance to drink it again, I’ll update this rating

Draught. Amber color, slightly cloudy. Medium-sized creamy head. Very matly sweet aroma with raisins and dates. Fruity and alcoholic flavor is sweet and straightforward. Oily, slick and alcoholic palate. Full bodied.

On tap at Pilsener Haus.  Pours a clear ruby with a touch of haze under a thin beige head.  Sweet malt, cherry and a touch of dark fruit.  Medium bodied, sweet malt, toast.  Sweet malt, long toast and a touch of fruity plum.  Nice.

+/-  bittere nasmaak
- beetje waterig
+ eerste slok vol, daarna word hij een beetje scherp en brand licht in de mond.

Helaas kan ik niet meer noteren als deze rating. Dit komt doordat ik dit biertje te slecht vond om er meer over te kunnen noteren.
Dominantly malty lager but not overly sweet. Some good subtle, complex flavors; a great beer and a favorite lager.
very bland beer...  red liquid, no head... some banana in the aroma, some cheap malts... far to sweet, medium long bitter but pukish finish... not drinking this again
Heavy mouth feel with a lot of flavor. Complex characteristics make up the wonderful taste of this beer.
Cloudy amber with a small white head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, citrus. Taste is treacle, malt, burnt sugar. Almost sticky mouthfeel, good body, sweet with a slight bitterness in the aftertaste.

330ml bottle.
Pours a deep amber/orange, with a beige head.
MAlty aroma, caramel, diacetyl, hops, chocolate.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, creamy CO2.
Malty taste, lots of caramel and fudge, lightly hopped, very well balanced.
(2012-01-21)
Pours a hazy amber with little white head...honey on the nose. Buckwheat honey on the palate with awesome roasted malts. Wonderful stuff
chocolate, toast, cheese, leather, cooked vegetables, skunky, smoke, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, thick feel, flat, long finish,

Dark red amber clear , with frothy head, which sets rather quick. Aroma caramel, honey melon, malt. A little thin carbonated body, with sticky watery syrup texture. Aftertaste warming with decent hints of alcohol and sweet malt  with balanced hop finish. Really drinkable beer for such ABV levels.
Dark reddish brown colour with off-white creamy head. Strong sweet raisin molasses aroma. Taste is sweet dark fruits, malts, not bitterness at all. Abv well hidden. Nice creamy palate. Quality stuff.
Pleasant thick sweet aroma. Caramel in colour with a beautiful frothy thick head. Sweet nuanced taste. I can pick up molasses.

clear deep reddish amber brown with a modest clearing white head . Very malty aroma with yeats , bread . Caramel  malty flavours  quite rich  . modest carbonation .Not much body at the finish which lasts well with slight bitterness and hint of burnt sugars .Quite an enjoyable winter beer
While I enjoy this beer very much, it seems to destroy my palate when eating and trying to drink other things.

I finally got around to trying the original doppelbock - a favorite style - and this one does not disappoint.  12 oz bottle pours a clear dark red/amber with minimal white head -not as I expected.   Nose is full of caramel malts and apple.  Aroma is complex, with caramel malts and butterscotch.  Taste is sweet, with no bitterness.  Alcohol kicks in on the 2nd sip.  Much better than the last German Doppelbock I tried (Spaten Optimator) and infinitely better than the Lithuanian Doppelbock’s I’ve tried.   I’ll gladly come back to this one again.

Amberkleurig met een goede kraag die ook weer snel weg is. Ruikt fris  en naar mout. De smaak is  lichtzoet met mout, stroop, caramel en wat bitter. Weinig nasmaak.
Goed door te drinken bier ondanks de halve liter flessen en vrij hoge alcoholpercentage.

Pours lovely rich amber brown, it displays minimal foam....but the aroma is something else. Its rich molasses and nutty, slightly sweet. It tastes very well balanced for a beer of this strength with a residual sweetness and slight cloying on the finish....overall an above average beer.
Bottle. Murky amber with no head. Aroma of berries and some grape. Flavour is warm fruit, raisin and blackcurrant with a light bitter background

Pours a surprising medium amber color, with a nose of clean malt and dark fruits. A full mouthfeel, this beer boasts a significant punch of dark fruits (raisin, plum, etc) all atop a caramel nut malt backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from bordershop in Germany. It poured a hazy amber liquid with a small head. Sweet malty wineous smell. Similar taste. Nice.

Bottle from Alko. Clear ruby coloured beer with off-white head. Very malty and syrupy aroma with some alcohol. Taste is a bit sweet and very malty. Full body, alcohol is actually well hidden. Mouthfeel soft and oily. Overall an enjoyable doppelbock.
Aroma is als welriekende romige zoete kaas. Smaak is zoethout, maar ook lijmachtig met rokerige bittertje. Kraag is wat zwak en zakt snel in. #2 het lijmsmaakje is een stuk minder. Smaak +1

Poured into a globe glass.  Color is sort of a dirty, cloudy copper with a thin tan head.  Aroma is a little hard to decipher but seems to have some fruit (raisins) and some spice.  Flavor is interesting, earthy and fruity with some molasses like flavors.  Medium bodied and almost buttery.  Overall just not really my style of beer.
Pours a hazy copper color with a medium sized light tan head.  Aroma of caramel, fruit, and some light alcohol. Flavor of caramel and roasted malts with some fruit. Pretty good.
Draft. Brown pour  with some slight tan head.  Rusty, fruit, light earthiness, and floral flavor tones. Had to pull teeth to get the sampler I asked for...
No big aroma and a little too red for the full malty beer that it is. Nice and creamy with a metallic, maybe even apple aftertaste. Bottle from Berts Bierhuis in Utrecht

Pours a deep copper with cream coloured head. Sweet aromas dominated by stone fruits, cinnamon and sweet malt. Flavours are sweet but not overly so. Darker stone fruits seem to come through in the taste. Minimal alcohol. Full mouthfeel. Relatively dry finish. Yep great beer.

Bottle. Pours dark copper with a rocky head that disappears. Aroma sweet buttery with a hint of alcohol. Sweet on the tongue, but not so much alcohol that the aroma would suggest. Needs more carbonation which is very low. Not Bad.

50cl bottle. Pours a hazy orange-brown.
Smells of a semi sweet malt, and some bread. Tastes of caramel malt and bread. Medium bodied, finishes wet.

Not terribly interesting.

Even though I’m not a big fan of dark or bock beers, i think i liked this one.... I bit of caramel and sweetness on the taste. I think it’s also a bit bitter and dry on the finish which i liked. It goes well with meets and cheeses on winter days......
Bottle from Kris. Deep reddish orange colour. Aromas alcoholic, malt, caramel, tastes relatively sweet, not too heavy given abv, very nice wintery beer.

Mahony body with medium to small head. Ripe fruit, clove, dough and generally malty. Spicy dry taste with very drinkable but full flavoured light bitterness. Fizzy carbonation. Suits me very well. (50cl bottle, 2,25 EUR)

Pours a ruddy brown, with a very small tan head that quickly fades to nothing. You can count the bubbles on top of this one. Smells like caramel-drenched overripe fruit. Raisins galore. Flavor is a bit drier, and actually allows some hops to come through. Not nearly as much to the flavor as there is to the nose -- this is really an olfactory beer. It builds expectations, then comes up short. Too bad.

Drought at St.Patrick’s Irish Pub, Skopje. Red-amber color, spongy tan head with long retention, cheesy aroma, taste and flavor of berries, medium carbonation, slightly bitter long finish. A nice find in Macedonia.

Bottle at Beer Time, Athens. It pours hazy deep amber, with a thin white head. The nose is brown sugar, caramel, sticky fruits, raisin, currant and fig. The taste is brown bread, alcohol warmth, raisin, fig, currant, wood, light spice, caramel and brown sugar, with a boozy finish. Full body, fine carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Nice winter warmer.
12 oz bottle.  Light brown beer with a small tan head.  Sweet, warm caramel nose.  Medium body.  Fig, toffee, and a hoppy finish.

I agree with many others that this is one good looking beer. Pours dark amber with a nice lasting head. Aroma was caramel, toffee, malt. Flavor was deep and rich with hints of toffee, sweet malts, and a nice dose of hops to balance it all. A great example of a dopplebock that even this self-proclaimed hop head appreciates. A must have!

Tasted from bottle into tulip glass. Poured a dark reddish brown color with chill haze and creamy beige head, somewhat lasting with fine lace. Aromas of bread, biscuit, toast, roasted barley, very faint flowery hops and fruity yeast esters. Extremely complex malt-sweetness only partially subdued by a flavorful hops bitterness, tastes of biscuit, caramel, molasses, nuts, raisins, plums, black currants, cranberries, sour cherries. Banana, citrus, and clove phenols increased as it warmed. Heavy body with full, "chewy" mouthfeel. Lingering bittersweet and fruity aftertaste. The very standard for the doppelbock style. Entirely delicious.
Rood bier met nauwelijks kraag. Snel dood. Zoet, licht kruidig, beetje caramel. Weinig koolzuur.

Draft. Beautiful amber coloured with a white head. Head flattens really quickly, wich is a real shame. Aroma is malts and ripe apples, with some alcohol. Flavour is malty, syrupy sweetness. Not a real burning alcoholic taste, but it has its sweetness. Nice beer.

Appearance:  an amber body with a spare frothy off white diminishing head. The body is sparkling in appearance. This beer is beautiful. It looks like a shot of a single malt. 

Aroma: heavy smell of caramel and grain. Hints of toffee and roast follow afterward. 

Taste: sweet caramel and honey start that slowly heats up with a cinnamon and pepper finish. 

Overall: this beer is a great example of a doppelbock. This is one beer that is great to have at any given moment.
It poured an amber color with a white head. The aroma was full of malts and caramel. The taste was sweet with a little bitterness.

Es la mejor cerveza producida por Paulaner,una espectacular doppelbock,olor intenso y agradable a malta y fruta,al paladar las sensaciones explotan en una intensidad increible ocultando el alto nivel de alchool de 7.9 grados. En fin una grandisima doppelbock  recomendada sin dudas
Bottle. Pours Reddy Brown with a beige head. Smells great. Roasted malty sweetness. Toffee and roasted malt. A glorious marriage.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate malty and sweetish aroma, caramel and some fruitiness, light alcohol with faint roasted malt. Medium, malty and sugary sweet flavor, caramel, light fruitiness and alcohol. Finish is average to long, malty and sweetish, some caramel and alcohol. Sweetish doppelbock with caramel - too much alcohol, not enjoyable.

.

16.9 oz bottle. Here’s another beer I can’t believe I haven’t rated yet.  Aroma is toasty, caramelly. Pours a cloudy blood-orange color with a medium dissipating beige head that falls into a ring. Taste is malty sweet with a bitter counterpoint showing itself mid-palate and continuing through the finish. Banana flavor comes out in the finish after it warms a bit. Has a noticeable alcohol presence. Highly carbonated. Nice enough.

The beer pours a medium hazy brown color with a large tan head. The aroma is toffee and biscuit malt with a little bit of dark fruit. The flavor is very malty. I get a lot of toffee and caramel malt with some dark fruit and grass from the hops mixed in. There is a nice grape flavor, as well as some warming from the alcohol. Very easy to drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
As a big fan of dobbels and dobbelbochs this is a nice brew without being spectacular. Not too sweet but with a light caramel taste.
Bottle.Dark orange colour with medium white head.Aroma is sweet of toffee caramel,dried fruits and malt,good well balanced taste with hint of tosted bread and brown sugar.

Beer purs a dark red color with a nice head. Smells of caramels, booze, butterscotch. Nice aroma. The flavors in this beer are roasty malts with a slight amount of booze, dough, and a nice small hoppy floral note at the end. Im having trouble picking out all of these flavors, I know there are more in this beer....Good beer will have again. and 7.9% is nice too.....
500ml bottle.  Pours copper with a medium head.  Aroma is sweet toffee and some apple.  Taste is sweet to start.  Burnt caramel finish with some alcohol and apple on the aftertaste.
Pours a dark, hazy copper.  Malt, fig, fruit, toffee.  Thickish.  Caramel, toffee, slight roastiness.  Smooth.  Pleasant, mildly sweet finish.  Nice.

(Flasche in 0,5l Helles Gas) Ein klar filtriertes, schönes, mitteldunkles Braun mit einem leichten Bernstein Einstich und einer etwas feineren Schaumkrone. Mazig-carameliges Aroma mit einer winzigen Röstnote. Vollmundig malziger Geschmack mit einer Röstnote auf dem Gaumen, die auch ein bisschen als Nachgeschmack nachhängt. Im Grunde ein leckerer Dunkler Doppelbock.

Aroma is not very strong but hints of caramel, banana bread, slight dough and dark sugars. Appearance is brown and murky. Taste is way too sweet. Malt on malt on malt, no balance whatsoever. I suppose this is the style but man this is cloying and I’m finding I don’t want to drink the whole thing. Palate is thick and syrupy. Overall I won’t be trying this again even in the darkest of winter months on the coldest of days.

Pours a cloudy opaque brown with a small short lived tan head. Aroma and Taste of toasted dark caramel malt, sweet dark fruit, dates, yeasty, with some sweet alcohol esters and hops. Medium to full body with nice carbonation and a lightly creamy texture on the palate. Finish is toasted dark malts, yeasty, dark fruits, dates, ending with a sweet fruity alcohol taste with a slightly bitter ending for balance. Overall a good, flavorful and enjoyable brew.

Bottle 33cl. Reddish beer with minimal beige head. Aroma to toasted malt, caramel, brown sugar. Taste to almond, nut and caramel. Low carbonation and medium hopped, maybe a few oleic, only maybe. Vinous and alcoholic finish. A well balanced beer that is one of my favourite. Very enjoyable.

500 mL bottle from Welshwizard (thanks!), poured into a pint glass at home.  Surprisingly evervescent when poured, amber brown with good head.  Typical doppelbock aroma, roasted and malty.  Nice on the palate, malty, even a bit nutty and a little smokey.  Alcohol is evident too, but its not over the top.  A nice beer.

Definitely a brew going into my BHOF (Beer Hall of Fame)!! This brew pours a rich dark red body that sports a thick foamy head that lends well with the brew for quite a while.  Scents of strong malt, coffee (maybe a rich espresso) followed with rich malty flavors blended with hints of orange or cloves with very little presence of the taste of alcohol.  It has a nice thick feel to it.

bubbly clear copper, medium white head that quickly disappears, not much lace.  nose of fruit, plum, prune...mush to sweet for my nose.  falvor pretty much follows the nose with plummy fruitiness.  oily mouth feel, sweet finish.  a good example of the style...a style that i am not a fan of.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden amber with minimal head.  Aroma is banana bread, yeast, caramel.  Taste is dark fruit and other malt notes.  Light bodied; oily, sticky texture.  Lingering sweet alcohol finish.



Original rate on 9/20/11: 7-3-8-3-17=3.8
bread and malt in the aroma.  More of same in taste, along with some cinnamon and apple.  Creamy mouthfeel, and the alcohol is barely noticeable.  Really good.

Ar: Sweet and rich malt, a bit of red apple.
Ap: Deep and clear amber - medium and dense light tan head with good retention and fine bubbles.
T: Firm robust malt, nice melanoidin richness - warm alcohol, but clean - maltiness mixes with a touch of spicy hops - firm, malty finish.
P: Rich mouthfeel, but still dry - finish is firm.
O: Nice malty doppelbock - not quite the depth of rich munich character I have seen in some doppelbocks, but still very solid.

Bottle.  Aroma is malted barley with faint fig undertone.  Pours copper co precept thin off-white head.  Taste is intricate mix of malt and sour.  Bit of brown sugar mixed with bit of licorice.  Finish is fig, hop, goodness.   Well done beer.
Tasted in bottle. Amber color with medium head. Nice sweet and soury, real bock (double).

Amber with a frothy cream-colored head.  Aroma is moderate caramel of medium darkness, some toffee, and a rather strong lager flavor that I associate with pale, light lagers which probably results from sulphur compounds from the yeast and some light grassy hops.  Perhaps some fig as well.  Hint of chocolate.  A full aroma.  Hits your mouth full bodied, syrupy with some prickly carbonation coming through eventually.  A moderate caramel that is slightly cloying (it would be a big caramel if it wasn’t balanced so well).  Grassy grassy bitterness which lingers for a long time.  Not really harsh, but perhaps it lingers too long.  Full flavor, but could be a bit more quaffable.  This is a sipper doppelbock.

(Bottle 0,33l)
